story:
"Dusk to Dusk" - 2016

Inspired by a power outage brought on by a raging windstorm, "Dusk to Dusk" came to fruition through a simple idea yet complex vision of the ultimate horror story: one of the human mind, in all it's deviousness and trickery.

This idea was expanded upon with personal encounters with mental illness, which led to the idea of having an agoraphobic lead character who would carry the film.  Nearly two million people in the United States suffer from mild to severe cases of agoraphobia.  Other films have tackled the subject, yet seem to undermine the complexities and seriousness of the issue by exploiting it for cheap thrills.  In "Dusk to Dusk", we dive deep into the mind of a man whose world is swiftly closing in around him, and watch as he slowly loses his grip on reality.  Our project, "Dusk to Dusk", tackles it's subject honestly, and doesn't shy away from the ugliness and seriousness of mental illness.

This project can help bring awareness to agoraphobia and other mental illnesses that slip through the cracks of popular knowledge while telling a challenging but rewarding tale that will scare moviegoers in the right way.  Aristotle once said, "The purpose of tragedy is to arouse fear and pity and thereby effect the catharsis of these emotions", and this relates to the darker stories we sometimes watch and read.  A great Horror story is the scariest ride in the park, where some will pass on it, others will consider it, and most will exuberantly seek it out.  

The minds behind this project, Philip Cornwall and Morgen Johnson, have a history of delving into the horror genre.  Philip attended The Los Angeles Film School and his thesis film, a psychological horror entitled "The Dark", was released to praise.  Morgen recently completed his feature length horror/thriller "I Don't Believe in Ghosts", which is set to premiere at the Tacoma Film Festival later this year.  With a strong script written economically and experience telling strong, character driven stories, they have the tools necessary to turn this project into an indie horror success.

Donations to our campaign will help fund this important project, and allow us to make a quality film that will challenge, enlighten, and scare the bejesus out of our viewers.  As the saying goes, "Rome wasn't built in a day", and that goes for quality films as well.  The pieces are in place, and funding will be the glue that holds it together.  Although 99 % of feature films need a larger budget, we are confident that we can get this film made with the donation goal that has been set.  With frugal spending, an economical plot line, creative solutions, and personal resources, we have laser sharp focus to make every dollar count.  Contributors will be donating to something unique and special, a film that will speak to a diversity of people in many different ways.

Our contribution goal of $6,000 will be stretched out to the maximum.  There will be no penny wasted.  The majority of the roles have already been casted, and the two primary shooting locations have been finalized.  With our talent and location spending already covered, the funds will be spent primarily on four key production components: equipment (camera, sound, and lighting gear), makeup effects (this is a horror story, after all), production design (set dressing for the lead character's home, primarily), and craft service (feeding your cast and crew is paramount!).  

For contributing to this exciting campaign, we offer wonderful perks to thank each and every person that helps us on our quest.  From the smallest donations (shout outs and Thank You's) to the largest (four open Executive Producer slots), we will make every contributor a part of our team.  Signed movie posters, copies of the signed script, and digital copies of the finished film are just a few of our exciting perks.  

If for any reason we do not reach our goal, the funds that we do accumulate will be split up between the four key components listed above.  Adapting to changing circumstances is a part of life, and part of the film production as well.  Cut backs on costs will have to be made, and creative solutions to problems will be emphasized even more.  No matter the amount of contribution funds we do receive, every penny will count.

Contributions will be valuable in ensuring a complete project that will get back to the public even sooner.  When film productions run out of funds, they typically shut down for a period of time.  We plan to push on no matter what happens.  This project is too important to be thrown away and forgotten about.  Those who suffer from any form of mental illness or social anxiety deserve to have a version of their story told as much as anyone else.

One of the producers of this film, Morgen Johnson, launched an Indiegogo campaign for his feature film, "I Don't Believe in Ghosts".  Although he did not reach his desired goal, he pushed on, and with resiliency and passion, completed his film.  All of the contribution funds that he did receive were stretched to the maximum, and his feature film was completed for approximately $4,000.  His project is a shining example of how a feature film can be completed and released with minimal spending. 

With every film production, there are always curve balls that bring unexpected challenges to overcome.  We plan on meeting these obstacles head on and moving past them.  Everyone falls, and when you do, it's essential to make sure that you fall forward.  If we end up requiring more shooting days than originally thought, we will move forward.  If a cast or crew member has to drop out of the project due to unavoidable circumstances, we will move forward.  If the project happens to need reshoots and we go over budget, we will move forward.  Every positive step we make will be built upon, a true snowball effect.

There will be some that read about our campaign and are unable to contribute, even if they wanted to.  There are other ways to help out, such as spreading the word to your friends and family, as well as through social media.  A "like" on our Facebook page is enough to help our cause, as well as using the Indiegogo share tool, which is invaluable in exponentially increasing awareness for this exciting project.  Thank you to everyone for lending us your ears and your time!
story_txt:
"Dusk to Dusk" - 2016 Inspired by a power outage brought on by a raging windstorm, "Dusk to Dusk" came to fruition through a simple idea yet complex vision of the ultimate horror story: one of the human mind, in all it's deviousness and trickery.
This idea was expanded upon with personal encounters with mental illness, which led to the idea of having an agoraphobic lead character who would carry the film.  Nearly two million people in the United States suffer from mild to severe cases of agoraphobia.  Other films have tackled the subject, yet seem to undermine the complexities and seriousness of the issue by exploiting it for cheap thrills.  In "Dusk to Dusk", we dive deep into the mind of a man whose world is swiftly closing in around him, and watch as he slowly loses his grip on reality.  Our project, "Dusk to Dusk", tackles it's subject honestly, and doesn't shy away from the ugliness and seriousness of mental illness.
This project can help bring awareness to agoraphobia and other mental illnesses that slip through the cracks of popular knowledge while telling a challenging but rewarding tale that will scare moviegoers in the right way.  Aristotle once said, "The purpose of tragedy is to arouse fear and pity and thereby effect the catharsis of these emotions", and this relates to the darker stories we sometimes watch and read.  A great Horror story is the scariest ride in the park, where some will pass on it, others will consider it, and most will exuberantly seek it out.

story:
Here's a little tease to get you in the mood to be Outdoors!

 

#wewillbebrief

A brief summary of who we are, and why you will really, really like our short:

  • Anna Giles and Mike Jones are the co-owners of Tiny Park Productions, an Atlanta-based film production company specializing in making awesome stuff!
 

#about

Mike Jones :: Director

Mike's background in theatre and film fully prepared him to shoot The Great Outdoors - he's aided in shooting celebrities and professional models in Los Angeles, has fully mounted his own plays in Atlanta, and edited videos for productions in Seattle. 
 
Anna Giles :: Actress/Executive Producer

Anna has been acting, writing, and producing her own work (and other companies') for about 15 years. She was nominated for a Golden Space Needle award for 'Best Actress' for her debut feature film, SCRAPPER, and was a co-producer for the independent horror film VOWS (coming soon!). 
  • Our goal is to fully fund a 4-day short film shoot, set in Georgia. This is our first short film, and while we understand that there are roadblocks and stressors with any production, we very much hope that by funding our film via Indiegogo and any other private donations, our stress levels will remain low, and we can pay our cast + crew the compensation they deserve!
  • By contributing to The Great Outdoors you will be funding the first-ever passion project of Tiny Park Productions, making the dreams of two passionate film lovers come true. That's not just hyperbole - if Mike and Anna died the day after putting The Great Outdoors in the can, they would die two happy schmucks. 

#nosuchthingasafreelunch

The breakdown of what we need, and what you'll get from donating:

  • We need $9,000 to make this short film happen. Can we do it for less? Probably! But the quality would be low, and no one wants to see a low-quality short, and no one wants to work for a low-quality production! We originally said we could do it for $8,000, but we're tacking on an extra thou' for fees [Indiegogo said to be transparent, so transparent we will be!]. This $9k covers it all: pay for our pros, craft services, location fees, insurance, transportation - you name it! Whatever goes into film production, you're helping to pay for it!
  • If you donate today, you'll get a veritable cornucopia of goodies! Well, maybe not a cornucopia, but you will get cool stuff! We have trail mix! We have Nature Box subscriptions! We have a super neat walking stick, (signed by the cast)!
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, rest assured, we will still make "The Great Outdoors" - we are bound and determined. It may put off production a bit, but we will persevere! 

#results

 

 

Why your contribution is valuable:

  • You are helping to create art - plain and simple.
  • You are helping to pay artists living wages - something a lot of us only dream of. So, in that regard, you're not just making TWO people's dreams come true - you are the personal fairy godmother (or father) of MULTIPLE people.
  • We are submitting The Great Outdoors to as many film fests that'll take us - again, this will hopefully give our cast & crew a little pay bump, as well as put Tiny Park Productions in the forefront of influencers' minds when they think of GOOD independent film.

#challengeaccepted

Yeah, we're worried about the obstacles in our path. But here's why we know we can overcome them:

  • Between us, we have about 8 years in the film industry, and have worked with celebrities, corporations, TV shows, independent film companies, and big box film companies. We have the experience and moxie to see any challenge through to completion, and we are confident that with our network, ambition, and through sheer force of will, we will get this short film made!
  • Any challenge we face will be solved not by simply throwing money at it; we will weigh our options and utilize our creativity and contacts to create a management solution that works for all parties.

#timeframe

  • We are set to start shooting The Great Outdoors early May 2016 (please donate even $1 so we don't have to push that date back!).
  • Perks will be sent out in June/July 2016.
  • Footage will most likely be shipped off to LA late 2016 for editing and post.
  • 2017: widespread release on all major video platforms (Hulu, Netflix, Xbox, Amazon, etc.) - or so we hope!

#nomoneynoproblem

Just because you can't contribute monetarily, doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Please, please, please spread the word on social media, in person, call your grandma, what-have-you - tell your mom, tell your dog about "The Great Outdoors"!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools when you DO post about us! Let's show Indiegogo some love, since they're awesome enough to let independent filmmakers utilize their crowdfunding platform.

#timeframe

Perks will be sent out in June/July 2016.
Footage will most likely be shipped off to LA late 2016 for editing and post.

2017: widespread release on all major video platforms (Hulu, Netflix, Xbox, Amazon, etc.) - or so we hope!



#nomoneynoproblem

Just because you can't contribute monetarily, doesn't mean you can't help!

Please, please, please spread the word on social media, in person, call your grandma, what-have-you - tell your mom, tell your dog about "The Great Outdoors"!
Use the Indiegogo share tools when you DO post about us! Let's show Indiegogo some love, since they're awesome enough to let independent filmmakers utilize their crowdfunding platform.

story:
A continuation from the original campaign : https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/women-of-yolanda-documentary

My Film and I

My name is Laura Mobbs and I am a passionate filmmaker. I have been fortunate enough to travel to many countries and experience different cultures. From all of the beautiful places I have visited, there is one country that has stolen my heart. The Philippines. From wonderful people, to the culture, to creatively inspiring me, it is an unforgettable place.

I lived in the Philippines for 2 years when I was younger and view it as my second home, where I have fallen in love with the people and their way of life. When the strongest tropical cyclone ever recorded, Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda), struck on November 8th 2013, I was devastated and felt useless because I couldn't physically help in any way. Despite donating money to the relief effort, I never felt like it was enough and this frustration gradually grew. I was angry that a place I cared for so much had been destroyed. 

Bantayan is an island located at the north-western tip of Cebu Island and suffered extreme damage as a result of the typhoon. People’s lives were destroyed and the income that many generated from fishing boats was severely affected. Therefore projects, like James Doran Webb's 'Bantayan Crafts', were set up to help these people rebuild their lives. 

'Bantayan Crafts' is a project where handmade accessories are made by women living on Bantayan Island with 100% of the proceeds going back to the women's community. They create intricate crafts by using debris from the typhoon, which are later sold at a few resorts and airports. This whole idea of creating something out of nothing struck me and I immediately became passionate in wanting to share their story.


My short documentary ‘Women of Yolanda’ will explore the lives of these women, from struggling through the typhoon attack to finding hope and solace in craft-making. By documenting their everyday lives the film discovers what it is like and what it takes, to be a woman living on this calm island.

Their story is extremely important to me, as I want provide an insight on how extraordinarily strong these women are. Even at the darkest of times, humankind can find the strength to carry on and this community of women proves that. I hope to use the film to generate support for these women through providing an awareness of their on-going endeavors.

Women of Yolanda is a film about hope, survival and being content in a place which was almost washed away. Through capturing their journey and their voice, I would be returning the support I’ve always wanted to give.  

However, I can't make this film without the support and generosity of others and I hope that we can all work together to help these women and get their story told. Any contributions would be greatly appreciated, in which you can grab some unique perks in return. 

Salamat kaayo (Thank you)


What We Need & What You Get

  • I am looking to raise £3000 and the majority of this will go towards travelling because the most important but expensive thing we need is flights ! The Philippines is about 7000 miles away and theres 2 of us to get there . We also need money to get to-and-from destinations and to travel around while filming.
  • Accommodation and catering is also a large portion of the budget with a little being spent on equipment.
  • I also hope to give as much money as I can to the women and the project so whatever money I raise will also be benefitting them. 
  • Most importantly , some of this money will be used to enter my film into film festivals as I need to get it out into the world so that as many people can see it as possible. By distributing it , I hope that more support will be given to the women and projects just like theirs. 
  • Your generosity will be rewarded as my perks involve getting your name in the credits or becoming an Executive Producer ! With certain donations you can also receive some amazing crafts that the ladies themselves make , so please take a look at all of the perks on the right-hand side of the screen, as I really want to express my gratitude in the best way that I can. 
  • If I don't reach my target or do not receive enough money to get me and my crew there , then all the money will go to the women and their 'Bantayn Crafts' project anyway. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute financially to this project but that doesnt mean you can't help at all.

Please pass this page onto anyone you know by sharing it on social media or by email.  

You can also 'Like' and 'Share' the page on Facebook or 'Follow' and 'Retweet' us on Twitter. 

www.facebook.com/womenofyolanda

www.twitter.com/womenofyolanda

story:
A bit about me: 
Although my background is predominantly wildlife, I come from an upbringing where purpose is a fundamental part of existence. All my previous films have a strong moral message about upbringing, child care, humanitarian work, the detrimental effects of abuse, whether it be verbal or physical and the importance of doing what is necessary for the greater good. It has played a significant role in what has become my individuality. 

In Cold to the Bone, the message is concise in that it deals with the increasing dilemma in the lack of Obedience, Respect, Discipline and Honor within our youth generation which ultimately leads to lack of control in a chaotic environment, resulting in violent repercussions. The story is told through a diverse group of young scouts in a survival scenario where flashbacks reveal psychological elements to the story.  It reiterates the number one scout rule 'Leave this world in a better place than what you found it'. The film also covers other social issues such as mental illness, anxiety, depression, schizophrenia, teen narcissistic personality disorder, bi-polar and social outcasts caused from a missing ingredient within our social structure.

Did you know that 1 out of 8 teenagers struggle from depression? 20 percent of teens suffer from anxiety. Teen Narcissistic personality disorder is more common than you think.


In Cold to the Bone we parachute into the mind of a teenager suffering from depression who sends the audience into a spiral of adventure and intrigue during his self comprehension and self modification stage of his mental imbalance.  His schizophrenic narcissistic antagonizer is a constant adversary working against everything he believes in. The psychological elements, the social behavior issues and the suspenseful action adventure of the film are integrated into a marketing business module allowing the distributors to promote the film based on artistic criteria. If the film had no marketable elements then that would defeat the object since the idea of any film is to reach a worldwide audience. 

So how did this film come about? 

Well I have a major infatuation for the great outdoors, wildlife, adrenalin activities, nature, flying and working with youth. I love to live on the edge and push my boundaries beyond that of what I think I can handle. Why? Well, because I get bored really easily and I am of the belief that we are not only here to find ourselves but maybe more importantly to create ourselves, so I am going to continue to push my own limits and get through as much as I can in this life. I want to achieve the goal of creating as much of myself as humanly possible. That way I can feel fulfilled that I have done the best I could to experience as much as I could in as short a time as I could through this beautiful gift of life. 

A bit of transparency about me and Cold to the Bone:

I was a boy scout in my teens. I worked a lot with animals, I was a lifeguard, volunteer fireman, youth camp counselor, and horse ranch manager.  I have a private pilot license, worked as a mountain rescue volunteer and as a parks ranger for many years which put me in the front line of danger. Many incidences were with the local indigenous tribesman themselves. When a person becomes exposed to that kind of lifestyle, it becomes addictive because it's forever changing. I am a wildlife film maker and animal wrangler. Still to this day, I volunteer at the animal hospital in Los Angeles and I still do the occasional wildlife documentary, as much as time allows. I also have suffered from depression ever since I can remember but I think the key age was 15. I have never been diagnosed, but it doesn't take a genius to know there is something wrong with you. So I basically took all the elements that I am passionate about and created an action adventure suspenseful thriller with a strong message that I believe the world needs to see. I say "see" and not "hear" because in film, the primary rule is "Show, don't tell".

Why is it so important for me that this film gets made? 

Flashback 20 years and look how immune we have become to foul language, nudity, certain things on television, billboards, commercials and of course public appearance! The novelty of a moral code has somehow worn off on our youth and they are practicing the very thing they are being taught which leads to creating this narcissistic mental disorder of attention seekers, excessive bragging, selfishness, having unrealistic hopes, stubbornness, short tempers and having difficulties in relationships, to name a few. The result of none of the about coming to fusion leads to it's counterpart of depression. The film covers these issues very strongly as we tick tock between two characters, who as best friends become formidable enemies.

About the campaign:

By making this film possible, contributors will aid in revealing truthful elements that we as a society can focus on to create a more moral world, A world our youth can be proud of. I hope to set a standard that illustrates the importance of treating the world and those who live in it with the respect and honor that it deserves including ourselves. Obviously the film has a strict entertainment value as a means of luring in the necessary target audience, as we cannot forget that people go to the movies to be entertained. That is where the art lies, in being able to tell a good marketable convincing story with the subtle moral message that it portrays through subtext, metaphors and symbolism, leaving the audience to process those important issues in an ingredient that allows us to relate, reflect and identify.

Thousands of similar films have been made in the past such as 'Lord of the Flies',  'Stand by Me', 'The Lost Boys', 'Basketball Diaries', 'Sleepers', 'The Dangerous Lives of Alter Boys' and 'The Edge' just to name a few.  It even stems into animated films such as the 'Lion King' or family films such as 'The Neverending Story'. I could literally go on all night about films that have had a deep impact on the world.  Films that carry a strong subtext about a moral code that captivates it's audience but at the same time allows us to ponder on the idea, that finding a moral purpose is perhaps the answer to the missing pieces in our heart, which will ultimately effect our mind. Cold to the Bone is a complete new concept of film and will take the audience where not many film makers have dared to go.

The business of art and where the money goes:

The difference between development funding and capital funding for the film Cold to the Bone.

The minimum development budget for this film is $65,000 which primarily pays for a development company to package the film. It gets a little intense from here on out so bear with me.

When we talk about packaging a film, first of all it means that the script needs to go through a strict edit identifying the story arc, the character arc, the love theme, the character development, the emotional and physical journey of the characters and of course, ensuring that the film has the correct demographics for it to be commercially viable.

So an analytical company will analyze the script and dependent on how much work needs to be done, a ghost writer will be employed or in this case a reputable script doctor. Once the script is modified to the business module's demands, it then gets a strict schedule and budget. This is an extremely intense process as it entails breaking down every scene, sequence and shot. A UPM (Unit Production Manager) or line producer is employed for this role. This process takes several weeks. In the meantime, Producers will be attaching cast. The attached cast will depend on the budget and of course whose name will help in making the film bankable. In other words, whoever the development company attach as above the line cast, can have a major influence on the banks decision in financing the film based on the popularity of the actors. It gets even more complicated when it comes to distribution which is the most important part of any film getting financed. Once all the correct pieces are in place, the producers then take the package to finance companies, banks or institutions and go about the tedious task of getting capital finance for the film. So you can see why the development budget is so important.

How the pledges work?

Any pledge is welcome! There is no minimum amount other than zero of course, but every cent helps. Just think, if 65,000 people pledge a dollar each, then there is our goal already met. Considering there are 7.5 billion people in the world, for 65,000 people to make a one dollar pledge is of great significance to us even though a dollar may not be much to you. Here's a thought to ponder. If somebody came up to you and asked you if you could buy them a cup of coffee because they need one, would you? Well, this is like you buying me a cup of coffee, instead it goes towards my film.  What do you get for it? I give you Entertainment! How do I entertain you? You get to follow my journey from Los Angeles, CA.  to New York City, NY. on my bicycle... I am going to document the whole thing and give you video's and pictures on a daily bases. You will also be a part of fulfilling one persons dream in making a film that will have an impact on many others. So, in essence, you are making a difference in a number of ways.

So why this campaign...Why a bike ride?

If I am going to be asking people to help me fund my film, then I can't sit back and expect the pledges to roll in without doing my part. Cycling across the country is a way of me personally meeting with people, personally handing out flyers, spreading the word about the film and the change I believe it can make. Also if I am going to ask the public to help finance the development stage of my film, I can't expect to be paid for it, so there is absolutely no salary in the development budget for me during the development stage. I can support that statement with my previous investors from my previous films and the development company, Moving Pictures Media Group, who will be going about taking this film under their wing. The fact that I get to make the film is reward enough, and the aim is that the film and it's strong message will live forever. The development company have come in below their usual rate since they are aware of my campaign, however, any funds raised beyond the goal will go into better packaging the film to ensure it's success rate in getting financed.

The Budget:
I am going to break down the budget to each cost, that way a pledger can decide where he/she best feels they would like to contribute. 
First things first. The registered script gets handed over to what is called an analytic company which is a third party independent company, and basically what they do is provide market analytics, sales projections, the marketability of the film, is there a market? Is it bankable? What are the demographics of the film and will it sell? These are some of the things they will take care of amongst other things.
So here is a breakdown of where the $65,000 will be going:
Producers Rep. This dude is a key element in getting the golden key to capitol funding and that is, he/she gets distribution for the film. These guys are different to a sales agent in that they represent us, the producers. They visit markets and get sales projections based on cast, genre and key elements in the film. VERY IMPORTANT DUDE! 
Artwork for a look book - These entail storyboard images much like the one's I have added in the website, http://controversialentllc.wix.com/coldtothebone! They give the overall idea of how the film will ultimately be shot, angles, characters, costumes, souvenirs, make up and props, etc.
Scheduling and Budgeting: This is as vital to the film as a wing is to a plane. It's the very thing that allows the producers, director and investors to know exactly how much money is being used for any given stage of the game. Each day is broken down, each scene is dissected and every shot is analyzed. It is a pain staking process of making sure we don't go over budget and that the film is legitimately budgeted and scheduled and not just guesstimated. This is usually done hand in hand with a line producer and a Unit Production Manager.
Animatics:  An animatic is basically the scene played out in animation form. This is done so that the financiers, crew and cast can get an overall idea of what the scene entails. There are incredibly intricate stunts involved in 'Cold to the Bone', so of course animatics are created to not only allow the camera crew to know where they can position cameras, but also for the CGI (Computer Generated Image) operators to advise as to what the camera can and cannot do for the software to work with a practical scenario (real life in real time image) and of course to help the actors know where they have to be at any given time. Not to give away spoilers, but I need to share at least some of the scenes so that you the pledger can have a clear understanding of what it entails. 
We have a waterfall scene, 3 bear attack scenes, a cracked ice on a lake scene, a crashing aircraft, both with a fixed wing and helicopter, an avalanche, an incredibly intense cliff face scene and several very involved explosions. Those are just to mention a few.
Look book compilation:  Although this could be done by me, to add a producer or service company that specializes in this type of creative element, will further influence finance institutions to come on board. Being a jack of all trades may be a useful element when it comes to the overall layout and vision of the film, however, credibility of those involved is key in getting finance.
Posters and one sheets:  Artwork is of absolute importance to a film. I was at the 2014 American Film Market and one film got funding based solely on artwork (so they say). A professional recognizable graphic designer is allocated for this task and can sometimes take weeks. It's a science verses art design that must not only meet the approval and understanding of the audience, but also of the distributors pitching the film to international territories.
Legal fees:  A reputable entertainment firm is allocated for all the legal requirements of the film and if I had to list them, I would need a 300 page novel.  Basically it has to do with insurance, workman's compensation, more insurance and even some more insurance. 
Bonding company:  A completion guarantee (sometimes referred to as a completion bond) is a form of insurance offered by a completion guarantor company (in return for a percentage fee based on the budget) that is often used in independently financed films to guarantee that the producer will complete and deliver the film.

What We Need & What You Get

The minimal amount of money I can develop this film for is $65,000.  If we raise more than that, then as mentioned, we can improve the package to make it more impressive. That's not to say that the film will not be developed in it's best form with a minimal amount, it's just to say that additional information and resources will be pulled in to create a more fanciful presentation and pitch, the things distributors look for as a hook to promote the film and raise the necessary money to secure financing. 
If we don't reach our goal, depending on how much we are able to get, then the money will get used for the more important elements needed to ensure the budget is raised. It becomes a triage situation. A process of illumination, that which is less important or can be done by those who are willing to offer their services on a Pro- Bono basis. 
The film industry has a very distinct catch 22 scenario. Financiers want the actors attached before the money is put in and A list actors want the money attached before they commit. So who comes first? This is where the development money helps, it pays for the attachment and secures them to the film. This is done through an entertainment attorney so that they can't later pull out of the deal if the finance of the film takes too long to raise, or if production takes a little longer then scheduled. 
So the plan is rolled out as follows:  1) Get a script doctor in to fix holes in the script. 2) Hire a UPM to schedule and budget the film 3) Attach the cast to secure the deal 4) Artwork for pitching 5) Employ a Producer rep 6) Get all legal requirements up to standard 7) Find capital finance and BOOM, we're ready for the pitch. Time is an issue as winter begins in November up in the Utah mountains. Due to the tone, feel and grade of the picture, it's important that there is not too much snow visible but enough to capture the harshness and extreme outdoor conditions. The winter and snow is also a major part of the story.

The Impact

This is my second cycle campaign.  My first one was a success in that I cycled the 1300 mile circumference of Michigan to raise funds for my previous film 'The Parricidal Effect'. Not all the funds were raised, but I managed to make the film from the money we had sourced through the campaign.
Teaser for full length documentary of MiMittenMision: Video coming soon!

https://vimeo.com/149076238 Feature film trailer: 

This is why I am doing another cycle in that I found it to be the best way to go out and physically meet with people face to face, announce my dedication and determination in wanting to make my film. Also, if I am going to expect people to pledge, I want to work for it. By handing out brochures or flyers allows the pledger to at least have something to hang on to for their pledge that they can stick on a fridge door to remind them of our campaign and follow it through the process. At any time they can log on to the website clearly listed on the flyers and follow our progress as if they were with us from the start. It is an exciting process. From pre-production, to production through to post production and even marketing and distribution.

Risks & Challenges


My biggest fear in life is and always has been the risk of failure but the second biggest fear would be to not have tried. I have always done well in the things I have tried to do and I have tried everything I dreamed or wish to have done. Whether it be flying a plane, sailing a vessel, geared up in a fireman suit pulling someone out of a smoking car, rescuing someone off a mountain, training horses, counseling youth or simply just enjoying the great outdoors.  It's always something I am extremely passionate about and unfortunately I have to choose one vocation above all and I chose film. It's the one thing I believe has had the biggest impact on the most amount of people at one single time. We as film makers have the ability to reach a large amount of people at one single gathering, so why not use that opportunity to send a positive message. I guess my fear with this film would be that there are many layers to the story and I would hate to confuse the audience, which is why the screenplay will go under strict dissection before we attempt to make the film. Unfortunately this dissection process costs money and it's money I don't have, so this is where I need your help. 

My challenges in this cycle would be weather, wind and time. Fitness would not at all be a challenge for me since I know I have prepared well. I have been training really hard for the past 2 months and I am fit as a fox, however it's those unforeseen circumstances that we all try and prepare for but will only know how prepared we really are once they hit. That's the beauty about an adventure. You never knows whats coming.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I would really appreciate any support in spreading the word not only about the campaign but also about the message behind the campaign. If you know someone suffering from any kind of mental illness. Reach in so they can reach out. Also please make use of the contact list availbale for teens needing or seeking help. There are Psychologists at hand freely avaibable to help those in need.
  • Please also make use of the Indiegogo share tools you will find on the sight. You could share it to either your Facebook, twitter or email accounts.
story_txt:
A bit about me: 

Although my background is predominantly wildlife, I come from an upbringing where purpose is a fundamental part of existence. All my previous films have a strong moral message about upbringing, child care, humanitarian work, the detrimental effects of abuse, whether it be verbal or physical and the importance of doing what is necessary for the greater good. It has played a significant role in what has become my individuality. 

In Cold to the Bone, the message is concise in that it deals with the increasing dilemma in the lack of Obedience, Respect, Discipline and Honor within our youth generation which ultimately leads to lack of control in a chaotic environment, resulting in violent repercussions. The story is told through a diverse group of young scouts in a survival scenario where flashbacks reveal psychological elements to the story.  It reiterates the number one scout rule 'Leave this world in a better place than what you found it'. The film also covers other social issues such as mental illness, anxiety, depression, schizophrenia, teen narcissistic personality disorder, bi-polar and social outcasts caused from a missing ingredient within our social structure.Did you know that 1 out of 8 teenagers struggle from depression? 20 percent of teens suffer from anxiety. Teen Narcissistic personality disorder is more common than you think.
In Cold to the Bone we parachute into the mind of a teenager suffering from depression who sends the audience into a spiral of adventure and intrigue during his self comprehension and self modification stage of his mental imbalance.  His schizophrenic narcissistic antagonizer is a constant adversary working against everything he believes in. The psychological elements, the social behavior issues and the suspenseful action adventure of the film are integrated into a marketing business module allowing the distributors to promote the film based on artistic criteria. If the film had no marketable elements then that would defeat the object since the idea of any film is to reach a worldwide audience. 
So how did this film come about? 
Well I have a major infatuation for the great outdoors, wildlife, adrenalin activities, nature, flying and working with youth. I love to live on the edge and push my boundaries beyond that of what I think I can handle. Why? Well, because I get bored really easily and I am of the belief that we are not only here to find ourselves but maybe more importantly to create ourselves, so I am going to continue to push my own limits and get through as much as I can in this life. I want to achieve the goal of creating as much of myself as humanly possible. That way I can feel fulfilled that I have done the best I could to experience as much as I could in as short a time as I could through this beautiful gift of life. 
A bit of transparency about me and Cold to the Bone:
I was a boy scout in my teens. I worked a lot with animals, I was a lifeguard, volunteer fireman, youth camp counselor, and horse ranch manager.  I have a private pilot license, worked as a mountain rescue volunteer and as a parks ranger for many years which put me in the front line of danger. Many incidences were with the local indigenous tribesman themselves. When a person becomes exposed to that kind of lifestyle, it becomes addictive because it's forever changing. I am a wildlife film maker and animal wrangler. Still to this day, I volunteer at the animal hospital in Los Angeles and I still do the occasional wildlife documentary, as much as time allows. I also have suffered from depression ever since I can remember but I think the key age was 15. I have never been diagnosed, but it doesn't take a genius to know there is something wrong with you. So I basically took all the elements that I am passionate about and created an action adventure suspenseful thriller with a strong message that I believe the world needs to see. I say "see" and not "hear" because in film, the primary rule is "Show, don't tell".
Why is it so important for me that this film gets made? 
Flashback 20 years and look how immune we have become to foul language, nudity, certain things on television, billboards, commercials and of course public appearance! The novelty of a moral code has somehow worn off on our youth and they are practicing the very thing they are being taught which leads to creating this narcissistic mental disorder of attention seekers, excessive bragging, selfishness, having unrealistic hopes, stubbornness, short tempers and having difficulties in relationships, to name a few. There are Psychologists at hand freely avaibable to help those in need. Please also make use of the Indiegogo share tools you will find on the sight. You could share it to either your Facebook, twitter or email accounts.

story:
SYNOPSIS

Kose est un truand de Montréal, le petit roi de son entourage. Une entrée d'argent est problématique et un de ses collaborateurs semble lui avoir fait fausse route. Misant uniquement sur son assurance et son charisme, Kose tentera de récupérer ce qui lui revient.


L'ESSENCE DU PROJET

Le monde du gangstérisme québécois connait un changement viscéral depuis la dernière décennie. On se fit maintenant sur la glorification des petits criminels par leur propre milieu afin de proliférer les ventes. Ces criminels hiérarchisés nous entourent, certains flirtent sur une aura artificielle afin d'avancer dans leur milieu. Ce court-métrage s'intéresse à l'humain derrière la façade du truand, l'être de carences, de complexes et de contradictions.


POURQUOI VOTRE AIDE COMPTE

Créer un film n'est pas chose facile. Derrière ce court-métrage se cache une équipe incroyable qui travaille d'arrache-pied ; réalisateur, scénariste, acteurs, direction photo et artistique, équipe technique, direction sonore, bande musicale originale. Cette collaboration a pour but unique un court-métrage différent et vrai, ce que nous souhaitons que King of Tears devienne. Toutefois, un tel projet demande beaucoup de temps, des locations d'équipement coûteux et des collaborations professionnelles. Votre aide est donc vitale à notre projet, elle nous permettra de passer au travers de la préproduction, du tournage et de la postproduction afin de vous offrir un film de qualité qui représente ce que nous avons à dire.


D'AUTRES FAÇONS D'AIDER

L'argent est une denrée rare et il est possible qu'un don ne soit pas dans vos possibilités. Ce n'est pas grave. Vous pouvez toujours nous venir en aide en partageant cette page Indiegogo ou en attribuant la mention J'aime - ou toute autre émoticône émotive - à notre page Facebook. Ultimement, c'est pour vos yeux que nous travaillons, et plus de visibilité mènera donc à une réussite plus éloquente.

Merci de nous supporter et d'encourager le cinéma indépendant québécois. 


ÉQUIPE

Réalisateur : Benoit Marquette

Producteur : Thomas Vachon Croteau

Scénariste : Thomas Vachon Croteau

Directrice de production : Maude Maillé-Daviau

Directeur photo : Christophe Dalpé

Acteurs : Maxime Genois, Sébastien Tessier, Lyndz Dantiste, Myriam Gaboury, Philippe Gougeon, Mark Breton et autres.

Graphistes : Antoine Charbonneau-Demers & Charlie Poirier-Bouthillette

story:
"The devil's finest trick is to persuade you that he does not exist."

Charles Baudelaire 



WHAT IS FEAST ? 

Feast is a short film about the Seven Sins gathering around Satan for their annual feast. Everyone enjoys the diner served by Satan’s demons in its very one way, excited, thrilled and intimidated by the presence of their holly master. The arrival of their sacred and attended meal, a young innocent woman, pauses the feast for a moment: she has to answer a special enigma to save her life. 

Every sin has its own characteristic. Each actor will embody one sin. 



 WHAT IS THE MONEY FOR ? 

           Every single dollar you give us will go towards bringing FEAST to life.

A lot of stones are needed to build a castle. As a lot of dollars are needed to make a film ! 

The money is for : 

  • Renting the appropriate space, to the story and to the confort of the crew (and in New York, space unfortunately equals money...). The location has to be an out-of-time space that we can't relate to: a space where hell gathers once a year to enjoy a very special and expected moment. 
  • Production design, wardrobe and make up: Satan and every sin have their own personality, we'd like the visual elements to represent them. They will eat extremely bizarre, repulsive and disturbing food with a frenzy and crazy craving. 
  • A happy crew and cast makes a happy shoot, and a happy shoot makes a good result ! That includes food, water, transportation...  And without a motivated and well fed crew and cast, it is very hard to work. 
Why should you contribute ? First, thanks to you and you only, a film can be made ! A FILM, how great is that ? And made by an extremely motivated team  who works together very often and likes it very much. Thanks to you, young filmmakers like us can continue making films and work harder every day to make the best of your money. 



                                           SOME MEMBERS OF THE TEAM....
We are a group of students from the New York Film Academy shooting our thesis film. Final film of the program, let's make it an unforgettable memory and our best work ! 
 
                              

 Aizhan Tuganbayeva - Director and writer 
Ever since I stared making films I've always wanted to get better with every new projects. Sometimes I had big failures, but all of them were for a reason. Right now I am at the stage when I'm confident about my skill and would like to enjoy doing what I do. I'm in love with filmmaking  and I'm in love with our new project Feast. 

Once a year, Satan and seven sins gather for a feast, in which they eat or let go of one innocent soul. Every sin is humanized at the feast, where they are enjoying many exotic foods. Bizarre, disturbing, deeply metaphoric, and poetic, this story bravely reinterprets a biblical narrative.

I love this story not only because of the artsy aspect of it and a chance to get creative with characters, but also for the greater meaning that stands behind the feast and the overall metaphor - final thought that the short film is bringing together. 

Thank you and I hope you will help us to create what we have in our minds. I hope you will become a part of this process. This film should be made. Every single person who will watch it, will enjoy the experience and find something of their own to reflect upon. And this is what cinema is about. 

 

  Julie Angelo - Cinematographer 
I am a cinematography student from France. I've been in love with photography and painting since the first time I saw a movie. 
This project is one of the most challenging and interesting I've ever had the chance to be part of. Every single character has a very unique personality and the way they will be lit, framed and dressed will considerably affect the impact they'll have on the audience. As they embrace their sin, the camera and visual atmosphere will have to embody the feeling of these sins. 
I hope you'll find the project as interesting as we do ! 


SPREAD THE WORD  
You can help spread the word ! Using Facebook, telling your friends, family, strangers in the street.... 
You're awesome, thank you ! 
You can also email us at julieangelo2@gmail.com for any informations. 

Thank you for your great support !

story:
LET ME INTRODUCE YOU TO A MODERN AND MOST EFFECTIVE TECHNIQUE TO ELIMINATE ANXIETY FOREVER. BUT, NOT TOO MANY PEOPLE KNEW ABOUT IT.

How often do you feel anxious during the day? You are losing your most valuable energy and mind concentration at that time. Since you’re generating negative thoughts at these unhappy moments, you are destroying your life.

When you suffer from anxiety disorder or panic attacks you are advised to either just “breathe deeply” or use drugs.  (Click play on the video above)

Master’s Solution: STOP ANXIETY! is a modern technique based on psychology science and years of testing helping people to eliminate their anxiety once and forever.

It gives an absolutely new approach to stop anxiety and get people back life enjoyment.

Accompanying the technique is an app that eliminate problems, dualities, pains, fears, patterns and attachments. In the long term, it provides healing, energy strengthening, mental cleansing, detachment and emotional balance. The technique manages more conscious choices, action instead of doubts and strengthens intention. It helps you to improve your business, enhance your relationship with loved ones, it eliminates suffering, helps you feel the harmony with the Universe and enjoy every moment of your life.

This mix of psychology, technology and support gets real perfect results.

I NEED YOUR ASSISTANCE

I need your assistance to let people know that there is a most effective anxiety treatment. The funds raised will be spent entirely on development of the website and app, marketing of the STOP ANXIETY! And EGO DETOX program and let us to spread the word. 

IN ADDITION

For every $10 raised I will provide a person (who cannot afford it) onto EGO DETOX program with a digital copy of the book. So not only will your pledge be helping you, it will also be supporting people who have no money, and access to the information required.


HOW THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT 

10% on a STOP ANXIETY! App and website

20% on mailing copies to journalists and media outlets.

15% on advertising in online trade publications 
50% on online advertising (Google/ Amazon/ Facebook/ Twitter)

5% SEO works

Risks and challenges

The MASTER’s Solution: STOP ANXIETY! and EGO DETOX program are 100% ready and can be delivered immediately to all user once the campaign ends. The app is ready 90%, but website is just drafted. The most important thing is to raise funds enough to spread the message and reach as many people as possible with an impact with key people on mass media. I hope you can help.

Please look at my previous project – www.mastersofuniverse.net

story:
LA VIDEO EN ESPANOL AQUI:


REGARDEZ LA MEME VIDEO EN FRANCAIS ICI:


Amy is a dark Hispanic fantasy in the vein of Alice in Wonderland directed by award-winning director Nicolas Simonin. This is his first production in collaboration with HOLLYWOOD HISPANO, an online platform specializing in promoting Hispanic talents in Hollywood.

The story: Amy, a young woman disconnected from her emotions, encounters a strange little girl. As she follows her into a eerie dark tunnel, Amy will face  darkness that will change her forever. 

NICOLAS SIMONIN CARE FOR EMOTIONAL STORIES


This film explores the horrors of child abuse, treated within the genre of dark fantasy. 

The story connects with Nicolas Simonin's sensibility and personal involvement with non-profit organizations. The goal here is artistic and educational: we want to raise awareness of child abuse, through the strong emotions of cinema.

As you can see in his previous films (see links below)  Nicolas Simonin likes to transport his audience into a unique fantasy world. 

After watching just  1 minute of one of the links below, you cannot help but be moved.


AN HISPANIC THRILLER

"I’m from France but having moved many years in Argentina & Mexico I became Latino in my heart. I shot my first film in Spanish in Argentina 10 years ago and  I’ve been impacted by Latino creativity since my 20s. I want to continue collaborating with great latino talents."

After several years living in Argentina where he directed and produced his first short, Nicolas Simonin moved back to Paris, where he wrote for six years for the French TV networks (TF1, M6, France 2...). His film DERAILED was screened at the 2011 Cannes Film Festival and in more than 35 festivals around the world, receiving 7 awards. DERAILED later was acquired by Time-Warner’s Fearnet.com. DERAILED has been chosen by Eli Roth in 2011 among the 10 finalists of the Universal Studio Halloween contest. His following short SEIZURES was screened at Cannes 2013 and received 2 awards at the Seattle fantasy film festival (Best Jury Short, Best Action film). More info here. 


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Your contribution will help cover the cost to finish this film, pay the post-production, mixing, CGI, sound design as well as cover the cost of marketing, sending the film to festivals and connecting with audiences all over the world. We want you to be part of this great adventure: "In all darkness, there is hope: a possibility to learn to be stronger and grow. This is my story but also yours. Making this indie thriller is about sharing a story we all connect to. "

THE PRIZES

For this film along with DVD & Digital copies of Nicolas Simonin award winning films we have cool, unique & very creative prizes (get your name screamed in an original video directed by the director, or a complete self-portrait produced by Nicolas Simonin)...you can even get a scary real prop doll from the film!!!

But there is something else: Nicolas has done 3 award winning shorts and wants to offer you moviegoers, horror and thriller fans – a new community experience online.

By pledging even the minimum you will be automatically part of the amazing upcoming experience he is creating for 2016 called SomeDarkPlaces. You can check the link below to see more of his work. But let's introduce our amazing team of talents and successes.

OUR AWARDS & SUCCESSES

'DERAILED': 7 Awards.35 Festivals + Distribution deal with FEARNET.COM

Finalist among 10 shorts, Eli Roth'schoice at Universal Halloween Contest 2011,
'SEIZURES' : 2 Awards-10 Festival Distribution deal with INDIEWIRE. Cannes film Festval Film Market 2012

“DERAILED” 5 MAIN AWARDS:
Best Weird Tale at the H.P. Lovecraft Festival, Portland.
Best Foreign Film at Fearless Film Festival 2010, Fort Worth.
Outstanding Achievement for a Short New Port Beach Festival 2010.
Quaterly Winner at Famous Monster Film Festival 2010, Indianapolis.
Award of Honor at the Accolade Film Festival 2010, la Jolla San Diego.

“DERAILED” and ‘SEIZURES’’ MAIN FESTIVAL SELECTIONS:
CANNES Film Festival 2001 & 2012 – May 2011/2012
ScreamFest Film Festival 2010, Los Angeles – October 2010
H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival 2010, Portland, Oregon – October 2010
New Port Beach Film Festival 2010 – April 2010
A night of Horror 2010, Sydney Australia – April 2010
Fearless Film Festival 2010, Fort Worth Texas – May 2010
Indie Film Festival 2010, Colorado – May 2010
SouthSide Film Festival , Bethlehem NYC –June 2010
Famous Monster Film Festival 2010, Indianapolis – June 2010
Accolade Film Festival 2010, La Jolla 2010 – August 2010
2010 Eerie Horror Film Festival, Edinboro Pennsyl. – October 2010
San Diego Horror film Festival 2010, San Diego – November 2010

Link to my Digital Producer summary HERE.


TALENTS FROM SPAIN, MEXICO, CUBA & ALL OVER THE WORLD:

MARIAN LABONTE, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER – HOLLYWOOD HISPANO (SPAIN)

Marian Labonte moved to Los Angeles after an extensive career in the movie industry in Spain and Russia.  Using social media to celebrate successful Latino talents and seeking for new Hispanic talents to celebrate, Marian upcoming platform Hollywood Hispano will be the main place to promote Hispanic talents from all over the world in Hollywood.

https://www.facebook.com/hollywoodhispano

ZULEYKA SILVER, LEAD ACTRESS (LA/MEXICO)

Commencing her acting career by debuting in the television filmThe Strip (2010), Silver has appeared in episodes of popular television series such as 90210,  Big Time Rush, Touch, CSI: Crime Scene Investigation andThe Bold and the Beautiful. In 2009, she auditioned forModel Latina's third season, where she finished as the second runner-up.

In 2013, she auditioned forNuestra Belleza Latina 2013 representing her home countryMexico, where she portrayed acclaimed Mexican actressMaría Félix in a photo shoot, and had the opportunity to portray María José Tenorio, a character fromJenni Riveras acting debut filmFilly Brown. She portrayed 2014 Anna in the Canadian horror thriller Girl House, in which she co-starred Ali Cobrin, Slaine, Nicole Arianna Foxand Camren Bicondova


ENRIQUE SELFA, LEAD ACTOR (SPAIN)

With a strong background in films in Spain, Enrique joined the project AMY with lot of enthusiasm & profesionalism. Among other thing Enrique Selfa is known for Ishalem. Memorias de un vampiro (2012), Toc Toc El Cortometraje (2013) and Second Son: Test True Power (2014).

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4853288/?ref_=nmbio_bio_nm

ISABELLA SUAREZ  (LOS ANGELES/MEXICO)

Isabella Suarez is a young Mexican-American actress from Los Angeles. She is 8 years old and started her acting career just over a year ago in the summer of 2014. Her resume includes work in national commercials, spec commercials, short films and a handful of other Internet campaigns. She is currently studying at Actors Giving Back and is excited to work in future projects.

https://youtu.be/bFSUlt8hRf8

LAUREN MADRIGUAL (LOS ANGELES/MEXICO)

Lauren Madrigal is 12 years old and has attended several acting schools and workshops to further grow as being an actress. Lauren is also a strong competitor in the dance competition world, were she was awarded 'Miss Jr. Teen" Runner Up, and has received several scholarship awards.

Lauren was also accepted into The Joffrey Ballet Intensives and is currently working with Biblical Films for young actors. Additionally, she is a singer for the LA Musical Theater Youth Chorus and on her spare time enjoys going to amusement parks, traveling, shopping with friends


OLIVIA KUAN, DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY (TEXAS)

Olivia began her pursuits to become a cinematographer in her early years at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. The decision to move half-way across the country from Houston to a place without a single familiar face was the first plunge into the adventure of going into film. Her time at school occurred right as the eclipse of film began. Thus, her training and early experiences were entirely captured on celluloid. After earning her degree, Olivia was forced to adapt to the multi-faceted world of HD. This diversity of formats has allowed her portfolio to encompass a range of works including narrative features, music videos, television pilots, commercials, and documentary style projects. Each venture is addressed anew with its own appropriate style, palette, and logistics.

MIKE BROWN, PRODUCER-ASSISTANT CAMERA (SAN DIEGO)

Mike Brown is a talented award-winning photographer originally from San Diego. His extensive experience in all type of Digital cameras, served him for over 7 years in completing short films, award winning music video and time lapse videos for companies such as Red Bull TV. His experience and enthusiasm will be a great asset to the team.

MICHELLE VORACHACK, PRODUCTION DESIGNER (ANAHEIM/LAOS)

Michelle has a wide range of experiences. Adding on to her Architectural background, she has gained proficiency in Interior Design, working with Yacht Interior Design and Commercial Interiors; and Production Design establishing herself in the Film & Entertainment industry.

http://michellevorachack.tumblr.com/

ALYSSA RADMAN, LINE PRODUCER  (LOS ANGELES/IRAN)

Alyssa Radmand is a multi-award-nominated producer who has been making independent films since 2011. She prides herself on using new technologies to run productions more efficiently while still delivering a high-end commercial look.

In 2014, Alyssa Radman and her production company Pigrat Productions directed & produced the short film HICCUP, played at some of the most prestigious festivals around the world (Fantasia Film Festival, Hollyshorts, East End Film Festival…)

http://www.pigratproductions.com/about/

BRYAN CHAVEZ, SPECIAL EFFECT SUPERVISOR/ C.G.I. ARTIST (LA/MEXICO)

Bryan Chavez has worked for the last 15 years in the film and television industries.  He has served as a lead 3d artist on a multitude of projects for television, film, such as SPIDERMAN 3, MIDNIGHT MEAT TRAIN and for many TV Shows.  

With a strong background in traditional artistry, graphic design, sculpting, concept design, motion capture, character development, and animation, Bryan knowledge encompasses all the aspects of post-production. In 2013 and 2014 I was the recipient of two Telly awards for his work on Deadliest Catch.


ROBBEN FENDERSON, SOUND MIXING SUPERVISOR (LOS ANGELES)

Robben Fenderson is a Los Angeles-area native who began music at an early age.  Coming from a guitarist father and pianist mother, he was encouraged to follow his passions and explore music, starting with piano lessons at age 7.

He picked up the cello in elementary school, and soon moved to the double bass in the orchestra.  He performed in honor groups and various ensembles, using all the instruments learned on a regular basis. Robben currently works out of his studio space in San Gabriel, CA.  When he’s not writing he enjoys day trips, learning languages, and playing with his dogs.  


ARTISTIC TALENTS FROM ARGENTINA, MEXICO, SPAIN:

YAMIL BURGUENER, COMPOSER/SOUND DESIGNER (ARGENTINA)

Yamil Burguener is Argentinian artist mostly dedicated principally to sound art, multimedia and interactive art. One of his principal characteristics is the use of varied physical interfaces and the programming algorithm.  He has presented his works in important festivals and universities such as "Synthese 2002" Bourge-France, "10a Tribuna Internacional de Música Electroacústica (Rostrum)" Rome-Italy 2004, "Mutek (Montreal-Canada)" in Buenos Aires 2005, Hugh Hodgson School of Music of the University of Georgia- USA 2006, “IX International Festival of Contemporary Music" Bogota-Colombia 2007. He earned several prizes, among others: the “Fondo Nacional de las Artes”, Municipality of Córdoba, Goethe Institut, UNC, Recoleta Cultural Center, MAMba, CCE-C, LimbO, FARME, Nacional Radio, “Junta de Andalucía–España”, Distinction “Cabeza de Vaca”, Theatre Colón. UNESCO MECAD/ESDi. ASECID. Espacio Fundación Telefónica.
story_txt:
LA VIDEO EN ESPANOL AQUI:

REGARDEZ LA MEME VIDEO EN FRANCAIS ICI:


Amy is a dark Hispanic fantasy in the
vein of Alice in Wonderland directed by award-winning director Nicolas
Simonin. This is his first production in collaboration with HOLLYWOOD HISPANO, an
online platform specializing in promoting Hispanic talents in Hollywood.


The story: Amy, a young woman disconnected from her emotions, encounters a strange little girl. As she follows her into a eerie dark tunnel,
Amy will face  darkness that will change her forever. 


NICOLAS SIMONIN CARE FOR EMOTIONAL STORIES




This film explores the horrors of child abuse, treated within the genre of dark fantasy. 
The story connects with Nicolas Simonin's sensibility and personal involvement with
non-profit organizations. The goal here is artistic and educational: we want to raise awareness of child abuse, through the strong emotions of cinema.


As you can see in his previous films (see links below)  Nicolas Simonin likes to transport his audience into a unique fantasy world. 
After watching just  1 minute of one of the links below, you cannot help but be moved.


AN HISPANIC THRILLER
"I’m from
France but having moved many years in Argentina & Mexico I became Latino in my
heart. I shot my first film in Spanish in Argentina 10 years ago and  I’ve been impacted by Latino creativity since my
20s. I want to continue collaborating with great latino talents."


After several years living in Argentina where he directed and produced his first short, Nicolas Simonin moved back to Paris, where he wrote for six years for the French TV networks (TF1, M6, France 2...). His film DERAILED was screened at the 2011 Cannes Film Festival and in more than 35 festivals around the world, receiving 7 awards. DERAILED later was acquired by Time-Warner’s Fearnet.com. DERAILED has been chosen by Eli Roth in 2011 among the 10 finalists of the Universal Studio Halloween contest. His following short SEIZURES was screened at Cannes 2013 and received 2 awards at the Seattle fantasy film festival (Best Jury Short, Best Action film). More info here. 



WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP


Your contribution will help cover the cost to finish
this film, pay the post-production, mixing, CGI, sound design as well as cover the cost
of marketing, sending the film to festivals and connecting with audiences all over the world. We want you to be part of this great adventure: "In all darkness, there is hope: a possibility to learn to be stronger and grow. This is my story but also yours. Making this indie thriller is about sharing a story we all connect to. "


THE PRIZES
For this
film along with DVD & Digital copies of Nicolas Simonin award winning films we have cool, unique & very creative prizes (get your name screamed in an original video directed by the director, or a complete self-portrait produced by Nicolas Simonin)...you can even get a scary real prop doll from the film!!!


But there
is something else: Nicolas has done 3 award winning shorts and wants to offer you moviegoers, horror and thriller fans – a new community experience online.
By pledging even the minimum you will be
automatically part of the amazing upcoming experience he is creating for 2016 called SomeDarkPlaces. You can
check the link below to see more of his work. But let's introduce our amazing team of talents and successes.
OUR AWARDS & SUCCESSES




'DERAILED': 7 Awards.35 Festivals + Distribution deal with FEARNET.COM
Finalist among 10 shorts, Eli Roth'schoice at Universal Halloween Contest 2011,'SEIZURES' : 2 Awards-10 Festival Distribution deal with INDIEWIRE. Cannes film Festval Film Market 2012
“DERAILED” 5 MAIN AWARDS:Best Weird Tale at the H.P. Lovecraft Festival, Portland.Best Foreign Film at Fearless Film Festival 2010, Fort Worth.Outstanding Achievement for a Short New Port Beach Festival 2010.Quaterly Winner at Famous Monster Film Festival 2010, Indianapolis.Award of Honor at the Accolade Film Festival 2010, la Jolla San Diego.
“DERAILED” and ‘SEIZURES’’ MAIN FESTIVAL SELECTIONS:CANNES Film Festival 2001 & 2012 – May 2011/2012ScreamFest Film Festival 2010, Los Angeles – October 2010H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival 2010, Portland, Oregon – October 2010New Port Beach Film Festival 2010 – April 2010A night of Horror 2010, Sydney Australia – April 2010Fearless Film Festival 2010, Fort Worth Texas – May 2010Indie Film Festival 2010, Colorado – May 2010SouthSide Film Festival , Bethlehem NYC –June 2010Famous Monster Film Festival 2010, Indianapolis – June 2010Accolade Film Festival 2010, La Jolla 2010 – August 20102010 Eerie Horror Film Festival, Edinboro Pennsyl. – October 2010San Diego Horror film Festival 2010, San Diego – November 2010
Link to my Digital Producer summary HERE.
TALENTS FROM SPAIN, MEXICO, CUBA & ALL OVER THE WORLD:
MARIAN LABONTE, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER – HOLLYWOOD HISPANO (SPAIN)




Marian Labonte moved to Los Angeles after an extensive career in the movie industry in Spain and Russia.  Using social media to celebrate successful Latino talents and seeking for new Hispanic talents to celebrate, Marian upcoming platform Hollywood Hispano will be the main place to promote Hispanic talents from all over the world in Hollywood.
https://www.facebook.com/hollywoodhispano

ZULEYKA SILVER, LEAD ACTRESS (LA/MEXICO)


Commencing her acting career by debuting in the television filmThe Strip (2010), Silver has appeared in episodes of popular television series such as 90210,  Big Time Rush, Touch, CSI: Crime Scene Investigation andThe Bold and the Beautiful. In 2009, she auditioned forModel Latina's third season, where she finished as the second runner-up.
In 2013, she auditioned forNuestra Belleza Latina 2013 representing her home countryMexico, where she portrayed acclaimed Mexican actressMaría Félix in a photo shoot, and had the opportunity to portray María José Tenorio, a character fromJenni Riveras acting debut filmFilly Brown. She portrayed 2014 Anna in the Canadian horror thriller Girl House, in which she co-starred Ali Cobrin, Slaine, Nicole Arianna Foxand Camren Bicondova

ENRIQUE SELFA, LEAD ACTOR (SPAIN)


With a strong background in films in Spain, Enrique joined the project AMY with lot of enthusiasm & profesionalism. Among other thing Enrique Selfa is known for Ishalem. Memorias de un vampiro (2012), Toc Toc El Cortometraje (2013) and Second Son: Test True Power (2014).
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4853288/?ref_=nmbio_bio_nm
ISABELLA SUAREZ  (LOS ANGELES/MEXICO)


Isabella Suarez is a young Mexican-American actress from Los Angeles. She is 8 years old and started her acting career just over a year ago in the summer of 2014. Her resume includes work in national commercials, spec commercials, short films and a handful of other Internet campaigns. She is currently studying at Actors Giving Back and is excited to work in future projects.
https://youtu.be/bFSUlt8hRf8
LAUREN MADRIGUAL (LOS ANGELES/MEXICO)



Lauren Madrigal is 12 years old and has attended several acting schools and workshops to further grow as being an actress. Lauren is also a strong competitor in the dance competition world, were she was awarded 'Miss Jr. Teen" Runner Up, and has received several scholarship awards.
Lauren was also accepted into The Joffrey Ballet Intensives and is currently working with Biblical Films for young actors. Additionally, she is a singer for the LA Musical Theater Youth Chorus and on her spare time enjoys going to amusement parks, traveling, shopping with friends


OLIVIA KUAN, DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY (TEXAS)


Olivia began her pursuits to become a cinematographer in her early years at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. The decision to move half-way across the country from Houston to a place without a single familiar face was the first plunge into the adventure of going into film. Her time at school occurred right as the eclipse of film began. Thus, her training and early experiences were entirely captured on celluloid. After earning her degree, Olivia was forced to adapt to the multi-faceted world of HD. This diversity of formats has allowed her portfolio to encompass a range of works including narrative features, music videos, television pilots, commercials, and documentary style projects. Each venture is addressed anew with its own appropriate style, palette, and logistics.

MIKE BROWN, PRODUCER-ASSISTANT CAMERA (SAN DIEGO)

Mike Brown is a talented award-winning photographer originally from San Diego. His extensive experience in all type of Digital cameras, served him for over 7 years in completing short films, award winning music video and time lapse videos for companies such as Red Bull TV. His experience and enthusiasm will be a great asset to the team.

MICHELLE VORACHACK, PRODUCTION DESIGNER (ANAHEIM/LAOS)


Michelle has a wide range of experiences. Adding on to her Architectural background, she has gained proficiency in Interior Design, working with Yacht Interior Design and Commercial Interiors; and Production Design establishing herself in the Film & Entertainment industry.
http://michellevorachack.tumblr.com/
ALYSSA RADMAN, LINE PRODUCER  (LOS ANGELES/IRAN)


Alyssa Radmand is a multi-award-nominated producer who has been making independent films since 2011. She prides herself on using new technologies to run productions more efficiently while still delivering a high-end commercial look.
In 2014, Alyssa Radman and her production company Pigrat Productions directed & produced the short film HICCUP, played at some of the most prestigious festivals around the world (Fantasia Film Festival, Hollyshorts, East End Film Festival…)
http://www.pigratproductions.com/about/
BRYAN CHAVEZ, SPECIAL EFFECT SUPERVISOR/ C.G.I. ARTIST (LA/MEXICO)


Bryan Chavez has worked for the last 15 years in the film and television industries.  He has served as a lead 3d artist on a multitude of projects for television, film, such as SPIDERMAN 3, MIDNIGHT MEAT TRAIN and for many TV Shows.  
With a strong background in traditional artistry, graphic design, sculpting, concept design, motion capture, character development, and animation, Bryan knowledge encompasses all the aspects of post-production. In 2013 and 2014 I was the recipient of two Telly awards for his work on Deadliest Catch.

ROBBEN FENDERSON, SOUND MIXING SUPERVISOR (LOS ANGELES)


Robben Fenderson is a Los Angeles-area native who began music at an early age.  Coming from a guitarist father and pianist mother, he was encouraged to follow his passions and explore music, starting with piano lessons at age 7.
He picked up the cello in elementary school, and soon moved to the double bass in the orchestra.  He performed in honor groups and various ensembles, using all the instruments learned on a regular basis. Robben currently works out of his studio space in San Gabriel, CA.  When he’s not writing he enjoys day trips, learning languages, and playing with his dogs.  

ARTISTIC TALENTS FROM ARGENTINA, MEXICO, SPAIN:
YAMIL BURGUENER, COMPOSER/SOUND DESIGNER (ARGENTINA)


Yamil Burguener is Argentinian artist mostly dedicated principally to sound art, multimedia and interactive art. One of his principal characteristics is the use of varied physical interfaces and the programming algorithm.  He has presented his works in important festivals and universities such as "Synthese 2002" Bourge-France, "10a Tribuna Internacional de Música Electroacústica (Rostrum)" Rome-Italy 2004, "Mutek (Montreal-Canada)" in Buenos Aires 2005, Hugh Hodgson School of Music of the University of Georgia- USA 2006, “IX International Festival of Contemporary Music" Bogota-Colombia 2007. He earned several prizes, among others: the “Fondo Nacional de las Artes”, Municipality of Córdoba, Goethe Institut, UNC, Recoleta Cultural Center, MAMba, CCE-C, LimbO, FARME, Nacional Radio, “Junta de Andalucía–España”, Distinction “Cabeza de Vaca”, Theatre Colón. UNESCO MECAD/ESDi. ASECID. Espacio Fundación Telefónica.

story:
Get to know us

We are two Los Angeles based actresses, writers, and directors who are inspired from strong, comedic, female roles in Hollywood. We are passionate about bringing the intelligent and witty female voice to more television shows, and hope this desire will become a reality with more shows such as our very own, "Liked"!

Often frustrated by the roles for young women in Hollywood, we have always been passionate about creating our own work and writing characters who we would actually want to play! And carry on the season as the leads.

"Liked" tells the story of Savannah, a relationship blogger who fabricates details about her love life in order to feel a sense of success, both personally and professionally. The show goes back and forth between two best friends who are trying to figure out what it means to be liked and why the urgency for acceptance over social media can cause people to go to inappropriate and unethical places. Watch what happens as Savannah figures out how far she will go to be liked! 


What We Need & What You Get

We have long term plans to turn this small and unknown pilot into a huge and successful television show! We are hoping that with a high production value of season one, we can grow from there! And we need your help to do it!

Costs will include paying our cast and crew for all their hard work! Even for the 9 minute pilot, we had a crew of 8 people and we want to be able to compensate them generously for how hard they work. Plus we need to feed everyone. Whoever said actors don't eat….that is a lie. And as for the crew…enough said.

Our cinematographer was generous enough to donate some equipment to us, but we unfortunately cannot do that for 7 more episodes without paying him. We will need to rent and buy camera equipment to make the show look as beautiful as possible! 

Advertising and promotion will be a huge factor as to what you are donating for. If we want to get posters hung up around Los Angeles, postcards by the register at local coffee shops, our logo advertised on Facebook, we need money for this!

And lastly, submission into festivals. Once completed, we hope to submit our web series to multiple festivals around not only Los Angeles, but all of California!

Some donation gifts include CDs, postcards, social media recognition, interaction on Savannah's blog, VIP invitations to our wrap party, and a walk on role to set! If you are feeling especially generous, you can even win a date with Savannah herself! 


The Impact

We got the inspiration for the pilot after we started hearing a lot of people using the term “Insta-envy”, meaning to be envious over someone’s life because of what you see over social media. Which is comical, because it’s not like people are going to post pictures of themselves sobbing in bed. …Unless there is a good filter and a witty caption involved. As much as we obsess over social media, it can destroy a lot of our self worth as well. We are aware everyone and their mother in Los Angeles is creating a unique web series. However, we believe this web series will be a platform for us to start breaking down and discussing the pros and cons of social media, and hopefully recognizing our own self worth beyond the glow of our screen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, we would love for you to follow us and like our page at www.facebook.com/likedwebseries and share all of our news! The most important tool we have is exposure. So please spread our pilot along to your friends!
