story:
Our Story

As a group of students attending Full Sail University our dream is to become professional filmmakers. With the desire to extend our education beyond the classroom we have decided to film this short. Our goal is to gain both experience and wisdom from this student run production. In addition, we have all become very passionate about telling this story and would be grateful for your support.

Crew!

Unit Production Manager: Kelsey Sims 


Director: Graham Zielinski


1st Assistant Director: Rachael Dejno


Director of Photography: Tyler Brebner


Production Designer: Igor Trancredi

Key Grip: Pedro Ortiz

Gaffer: Sterling Sims

Sound Mixer: Robert Landis


The Story of Free Me

Free Me is about a young girl named Abby Brendon who is kidnapped by David Burrows. David, who's mother left his father and him when he was young, has a vengeful and misguided view of what love is. With the hopes of using time and kindness to sway Abby, David holds her against her will, believing this will give him the love he's been longing for. But will David get what he wants or will David discover love in a different way?

What We Need 

The funding we are asking for will go towards making this production as professional as possible. With the money you give us we can obtain better gear, professional talent, an opportunity to submit to festivals, and covering the costs of a typical low-budget production. Any amount you can give us will go towards the bettering of this film. 

What You Can Get
For helping us fund our production we would like to show you our thanks for every amount you can donate:
  • For Donating $15 we will send you a cast and crew signed thank you card.
  • For Donating $25 you will receive in addition to the thank you card a custom Free Me t-shirt.
  • For Donating $50 you will receive a special thanks in our credits along with the custom t-shirt and thank you card.
  • For Donating $100 you will receive a photo book calendar significant to the short and the many other gifts previously listed.
  • For Donating $250 you will receive a personal DVD which includes: The Free Me Short, the Free Me Promo video, the trailer, interviews, and a personal special thanks along with the many other gifts previously listed.
  • For Donating $500 you will receive a limited edition signed poster along with the many other gifts previously listed.
  • For Donating $1,000 you will receive an Executive Producer credit along with the many other gifts previously listed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't donate there is still something huge you can help us do! Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools and post to your Facebook and Twitter, as well as stay tuned for new videos and updates on our progress.

story:
Freddy Carrillo's Day Off showcases an amazing athlete.

Freddy  isn't bigger than life - he is life.  Living it to the fullest, each and every day.  

Back in 1993, Freddy got a magazine in the mail, called 'Blast!'.  The feature article, 'Board Beyond Belief' documented a one-day adventure that included a snow, skate and surf session in Southern California.  A phenomenon that can only be done in a very few places in the world.  

Freddy made a commitment to do the same thing one day as he read that article --from his wheelchair.

Meantime, he became a celebrated athlete in adaptive sports, known as Freddy McShreddy among fellow athletes.  

Then one Christmas Eve, Freddy and family friend, Maggie, made a commitment to document  that dream day when he will  ski, skate and surf. 

Yep, all in one day.  And that day is here...

Freddy calls in sick (wink, wink) to his day job.  Then...

Freddy mono skis at Big Bear in the morning...

Then heads down to the Lake Forest Etnies Skate Park midday....


Then Freddy caps it it off with surf session at San Onofre in the early evening. 

All shot in real time....by an award -winning crew.

Freddy brings new meaning to that burning question:  What did you do today?

Good luck, Freddy McShreddy....let the games begin!

FREDDY'S GOAL

Freddy  hopes his adventure inspires people of all ages from all walks of life - with or without disabilities to live life to the fullest.  But, particularly kids and young adults who have recently become paraplegics themselves.  

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO???

Production crew, equipment rental, transportation, travel, sporting equipment, venue costs, editing; and most important, distribution to hospitals and rehab facilities to show a new way of life after a life-changing event.  

YOUR PERKS

With your donation, you  help all paraplegic athletes  in competitive sports keep that dream alive.  How?

10% of the funds will be donated to the CAF - Challenged Athletes Foundation.  

Check it out at:  www.challengedathletes.org


Thank you so much for your support!   Have a Freddy Day...

story:
The Ledge with Lola Acala is a Half Hour show of Social Justice issues, stories, Arts & Culture in Vancouver, Canada.


Quote

"Do your little bit of good where you are; Its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -Desmond Tutu

 


My name is Lola Acala. I am the Founder, Executive Producer & Host of The Ledge on Shaw TV Vancouver. 

       I produce The Ledge for Shaw as a Producer & Content Provider through my Production Company, Lolacala Productions.  

 In 2008, I created Lolacala Productions and The Ledge show as a Platform for my Advocacy work in Diversity and Equality because I realized, I was NOT getting ANY decent Employment Opportunities I was qualified for. If I wanted the position, I had to create it. 

 

 It took me working odd jobs non-stop for the last 10 Years. In between, I graduated with a Bachelor's Degree in Political Science from Simon Fraser University and slowly over the Years, I built The Ledge to what it is today as a show that fights for Justice, Equality and Opportunity for all members of our Communities, especially those without a voice.  And we have done some great work this area since 2008 when we filmed our first show.

 

And as hard as it was juggling everything over the Years, my Goal was for us to prove ourselves, by supporting ourselves as we built our brand.   And it has not been easy for myself and my crew but our dedication always kept us strong and moving forward and I wouldn't change any of those difficult times. They taught growth and strengthened us and I couldn't be more proud of my Team and the work we are known for today.   

 

With us in regular monthly Broadcast Production since May 2015, it's been even tougher for us to keep our heads above water.  We are at the point now where, it is no longer feasible for us to keep doing it all, with no support.  

And so I come to you, (our immediate and Global Community) and ask you to PLEASE, come and join us and be part of the work we are doing in the World.  

 

OUR VIDEO PRESENTATION 

Our efforts to support independent Television and achieve True Diversity in our Media Landscapes must be followed, with an indomitable will to in fact see them through.

 

Welcome to the Ledge 2016 PRODUCTION Fundraising Campaign!!

   

And as an Independent Broadcast Executive Producer, we are independent Public Television content Providers and as such that work is not supported by Corporate or the Mainstream media which at this stage in our game is exactly as we should want it if we are to remain independent... quite frankly, its the only way.

 

Advocating for those who have NO Voice, calling out the inequalities that pervade our Societies that foster unequal opportunities amongst us, highlighting failures in our system that have caused Harm to others and may affect us all too down the road, if we don't have those things checked.  

 

Calling out Government activities where they need to be called out, as part of the checks and balances of an equal World, we cannot sit back or rest on our Laurels.  It is how we tackle these issues and find Solutions that make change happen, it is how we collectively use our voices, to re-instate the Power that we know resides, in our very hands.    

 

And now thanks to the internet..!  This information Age is one of the most powerful phenomenons of the 21st Century because for the first time in the History of our World, Humans are more closely connected like never before.  We as an immediate and Global Community, together, WE can force and make changes to situations like we've never been able to do in the Lifetime of our World and this is an opportunity we must take up and take on, each and every time.     

 

  And so we, at The Ledge, we come to you, Our Friends, Our Brothers, Our Sisters here at Home, around the World, I ask you to support not a concept but a real tool we've been using to fight and call out injustices, to educate, to inspire future generations of children no matter their color or where they come from that, WE are ALL ONE.

 That is the fundamental message and the foundation of our message in the world.. But we cannot do it ourselves...   

 

We need your Help to support Independent Media that focuses on Immediate and Global Community Social Justice issues.  The Ledge does that!   

 

This Brand, our show is not just a Vancouver show, because we get your messages of Support from our Website and Social Media. 

The Ledge, is a Global show no matter where you live, we deal with a wide range of Public interest topics, issues that have value to ALL people in our World!!..    

 

But we cannot do it ALL, ourselves anymore.  So, Imagine the Possibilities, the amount of Work that myself and my Team will be able to achieve throughout 2016, with all of YOU, unwavering and behind us!!!  

    

I have one of the most talented, dedicated teams in Broadcasting who started with me when I had nothing but a dream since 2008.. I had no wages to pay them, all they did was believe in me and the work I do and I assure you that together, we will continue to seek out issues of injustice, find solutions to right wrongs not just for our immediate, but also, for all of us, our entire Global Community.

   So Friends, Supporters, fellow Advocates, public minded individuals who value the sweat and labor of Social Justice Advocates, friends who value Public Television from right here at Home North America, to the ends of The United States, Europe, Asia, South America, Africa, Australia.. 

Come!  ... HELP US!!..

Support our Fundraising Campaign FOR OUR 2016 PRODUCTION YEAR and TOGETHER we can get doing, the work that we are so good at doing, serving Humanity, together.

       

What You Get!

And we have some great... Give-Back Perks for you as well.. From copies of my EP, or my Single or you can see your name credited as part of our Production crew. There is also an opportunity for you to Record your Support for the show and YOU could find yourself, on the show.

There really are just some great Perks!!...     

 And, whatever Donation Gift Perk you choose, I really look forward to finding out, about you guys as well. Why you think it is important for you to support initiatives likes these in our World?  I want to hear about all of that stuff so that when I get to engage with you all, while, receiving your Donation Gift Perks from our side, I will already hopefully know, who is who amongst you?

 

   And so please, check out which of our Donation Gift Perks you'd like to Honor and Join our Ledge Global Family so that together we can share dialogue about our World, Ours Fears, Our Joys, Our individual and shared experiences.   

 

Let us create a Global Brotherhood and Sisterhood that is unbreakable amidst the chaos in the World we all find ourselves today..  

 And, allow me to leave you, with this...  Please let us never forget that, there are still more good people in the World than bad.  And as long as we, love one another, stick together, and we don't let, anyone divide us with HATE, we will continue to prevail and we can defy all the odds, we just have to work hard, towards LOVE.

 

 I thank you all so much in Advance, for your kind words, for your Generosity and most importantly Guys, I thank you all so much for your LOVE.     We'll see you in 2016!!!!  I Love you Guys!! 

          

WHAT IS A LEDGE FAMILY MEMBER?  A GLOBAL Brotherhood/Sisterhood
No matter the level of your support YOU automatically become a Ledge Family Member.  We value each and everyone of our SUPPORTERS and we want to build a Community and Global movement with you.
As a Ledge Family member, our Collective goal is to make our World a Better Place by making it our Life's Goal to LOVE and support our fellowmen no matter their skin colour or our differences. 
As a Ledge Family Members we choose to make conscious efforts daily to be part of the Solution in our World by using our gifts, talents and abilities to serve humanity as much or as little way as we are able to. 
 As Ledge Family Members, we will learn from one another and create Bonds of Friendships, and with other Ledge Family Members around the World.  Let us create a Global Brotherhood and Sisterhood that is unbreakable in our somewhat chaotic World. 
 

The Impact of YOUR Support!

Our World needs to start empowering a new generation of thinkers and voices outside of the Status Quo who are advocating and fighting for a Healthy Democracy in our World. 

From WHEREVER Location in the World you are, you are using your Donations to work side by side with me in Spirit. You are helping me seek and find solutions to issues and together, we are calling out injustices. 

That is the POWER of what your Donations will allow YOU to do from wherever you are in the World.. 

Come! be part of the Conversation with us! 


  

What We Need 

We need $107k at the very least to help with the run of a 3 person Broadcast Media Production operation including our Community Outreach initiatives. Your Donations will secure all of our 2016 Production & Advocacy efforts and work.

Being Publicly funded by YOU and not having to seek advertisers for our Revenue, protects our freedom of Speech and our freedom of Opinion without fear of repercussion or interference. 


 With NO Advertisers, we CANNOT be influenced.  Your Donations allow us to be INDEPENDENT and not beholden to any Corporate Influence.  After all, our show was created by the PEOPLE and for the PEOPLE, ONLY.

We do this work to stand up for the Humanity of our fellowmen and World.  We want it to be clear that, 'if Silence is taken as consent, we will not stop making our voices heard in matters that concern our World and its humanity.'

And Please, NO amount is too small. Every little bit you send, helps us in BIG ways to achieve our Goals.  We thank and cherish you for standing up for the underdogs in our World who are standing up for others. 

 

 Why Donate?  

   When you support our cause with your Donations, you will be choosing to take a STAND for Healthy Diversity in our Media Landscapes by supporting a woman of colour who has had to fight harder to access the most basic of Economic opportunities her female counterparts enjoy. This has been my experience and I am still fighting those barriers each and everyday.  It is why I do this job in the hopes that I can make a difference for future generation Canadians.

 Your Donations will support our entire 2016 Production Operational Costs, which include buying some additional equipment for some upcoming Projects.  Our Network is so good with supplying our standard Equipments during the week but we also need our own Equipment, especially on weekends when we may need to pursue a story/event on Location and most importantly to pursue other Independent projects.

  Having our own ready equipment will give us the freedom to reach further to do so much more.... and WE ARE SO READY TO DO EVEN MORE!!! 

99% of the work we do is not glamorous!..It is only seen in a glamorous way. Behind the scenes, it is hard painstaking work with the research requiring nothing short of mental agilities. There is no room for mistakes or errors and it requires a lot of reading. I am constantly finishing one research and jumping straight into the next read. We have to be unequivocally accurate,  being able to discern the most relevant facts as they relate to the issues at hand, asking the right questions relevant to our audience..  Then I have to build a half hour show around each topic and go in on the day (it only looks glamourous on filming days coz you get all dressed up for the recording) prepared and as knowledgable as the experts so that I am able to ask the right questions, find the problem areas and hopefully arrive at the right solutions with our experts and Guests.  Then there is the editing which is hours and hours of first, me prepping edit notes for the Editor about final product and they then spend hours and hours more cutting those images correctly. It is such demanding work that we are often working 7 days a week.  

Your Donations will also help us with our Community Outreach Programs.  So many people around us are in  such great need and we hope to step up our Community Outreach in 2016.   When you donate to our resources, we in turn are able to help others even more. This is a fundamental part of being a Ledge Family Member. We HELP those around us.  

 

Through our posted videos on our Youtube Channel, you will be able to experience all of those activities and events with us, Outreach and others. You will also have an opportunity to post your comments and send us messages. 

 

 I look forward to sharing all of those moments with you all as part of OUR Collective efforts as Ledge Family Members doing our 'little bits good' to make our World a better place.  

 

 

Where More of your Support Goes?  

 Should we reach more than our Goal of 107k, we will gratefully put that money towards our separate 40k Company Car Fund, our Emergency Production Fund and the rest towards our Operational Costs and Outreach Programs. When you empower us with more, we in turn, are able to DO MORE, not just in our immediate Communities but also too, in our Global Communities at large! Who knows? You may see us soon in your neck of the woods following a story.

 

I am so very grateful to our Network that they provide a vehicle for my Production use, but it comes with a lot of restrictions. Only one of my Ledge staff members is cleared to drive it and its use does not include other Lolacala Production Projects. Only our Shaw TV ones.  Which is why we ask for your kindness in assisting with this Car Gift request.  

 

Our own The Ledge Company vehicle will give us more freedom to do more, on our own.   Alternatively too, we are open to accepting a vehicle donation to achieve this goal, our Donor keeping in mind that, we transport a lot of heavy equipment.  We in fact utilize Hockey Equipment Bags to ferry some of our Equipments so the donated vehicle must be able to manage a bit of heavy equipment occupational hazards.

 

Risks & Challenges

To not have the support we need to operate in 2016 will see our entire Year’s Production at risk or at the very least will mean another hard painful Year for my Production Team and myself. It will greatly limit the work we are able to do in the community and our World, significantly.

  

The Impact of YOUR Support 

Because YOU help us stand up for Diversity in Media Landscapes, because you help us promote Equality and Fairness for ALL people without a Voice, you will be doing YOUR part to empower Advocates in our World to keep highlighting issues that promote a Healthy Democracy and a Fair-shake for ALL people, in our World.

 

Our comprehensive video presentation will show the body of work I have been engaged in, the past 7 Years.. (please see full episodes of each clip on our Youtube channel or our Website). 

Some of the issues in our Episodes will reveal to you why it is even more important we ramp up our efforts in the coming Year.

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please NO amount is too small in how you can help.  And as much as we welcome any amount we know too that not everyone can contribute but you can still help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and families who value the sweat and hard work of Social Justice Advocates. Ask them all to support this great cause and our work in our World.

Share with others too. Tell them why it is important that together we continue raising our voices to make change to situations in our World.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools also to share on your wall, send to your friends asking them to support a great cause and Campaign. Please help us use all of your abilities to get the word OUT!!!.

Love you Guys so much!!!... xoxox

Thank you.

Lola Acala
story_txt:
The Ledge with Lola Acala is a Half Hour show of Social Justice issues, stories, Arts & Culture in Vancouver, Canada. 


Quote


"Do your little bit of good where you are; Its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -Desmond Tutu

 

My name is Lola Acala. I am
the Founder, Executive Producer & Host of The Ledge on Shaw TV
Vancouver. 
       I produce The Ledge for Shaw
as a Producer & Content Provider through my Production Company, Lolacala
Productions.  
 In 2008, I created Lolacala
Productions and The Ledge show as a Platform for my Advocacy work in Diversity and Equality because I
realized, I was NOT getting ANY decent Employment Opportunities I was qualified
for. If I wanted the position, I had to create it. 
 
 It took me working odd jobs non-stop for the last 10 Years. In between, I graduated with a Bachelor's Degree in Political Science from Simon Fraser University and slowly over the Years, I built The Ledge to what it is today as a show that fights for Justice, Equality and Opportunity for all members of our Communities, especially those without a voice.  And we have done some great work this area since 2008 when we filmed our first show.
 
And as hard as it was juggling everything over the Years, my Goal was for us to prove ourselves, by supporting ourselves as we built our brand.   And it has not been easy for myself and my crew but our dedication always kept us strong and moving forward and I wouldn't change any of those difficult times. They taught growth and strengthened us and I couldn't be more proud of my Team and the work we are known for
today.   
 
With us in regular monthly Broadcast Production since May 2015, it's been even tougher for us to keep our heads above water.  We are at the point now where, it is no longer feasible for us to keep doing it all, with no support.  
And so I come to you, (our
immediate and Global Community) and ask you to PLEASE, come and join us and be part of
the work we are doing in the World.

Our efforts to support
independent Television and achieve True Diversity in our Media Landscapes
must be followed, with an indomitable will to in fact see them through.

PRODUCTION Fundraising Campaign!!

Broadcast Executive Producer, we are independent
Public Television content Providers and as such that work is not
supported by Corporate or the Mainstream media which at this stage in our
game is exactly as we should want it if we are to remain independent...
quite frankly, its the only way.

NO Voice, calling out the inequalities that pervade our Societies
that foster unequal opportunities amongst us, highlighting failures in our
system that have caused Harm to others and may affect us all too down the
road, if we don't have those things checked.

activities where they need to be called out, as part of the checks and balances

story:
STORY

My name is Faisal Shah, director and cinematographer for the music video “Love Monster”.The story follows Ariel, an ill-fated mermaid, who eventually loses the love of her life and disintegrates into sea mist, never to be seen again until now.

We bring Ariel back to life by regenerating her from sea foam. After rising from the purple waters, she finds herself in our current time period. Instead of taking revenge against the prince for breaking her heart, she decides to take revenge on love itself while seeking lust. She becomes a siren and her only way of survival is to feed off other's’ energies through intimacy. While seeking sexual partners, she accidentally runs into another “prince charming” who expresses genuine interest in her.  Ariel finds herself in a dilemma: she either feeds on him to survive or dies falling for him.

IDEA

I approached Justin Saldana about the story and wanted to work on it right away. We then had the pleasure to meet musical artist, George Jeffrey Kalajiant. George loved the story and came up with the beat immediately. The beat was exactly what we were looking for: very aquatic, slow and smooth. His notes became the basis of Ariel’s embodiment.

After we completed the beat we went through the strenuous process of generating the right lyrics. It took about two months to rewrite and re-record. By the end of the process all three of us were content with the final product.

Instead of making a video for a song, I made a song for a music video. This gave me more creative control and allowed the song to become the script itself.

KEEPING IT REAL

Although this music video will display some computer-generated effects, the majority of this project will rely on heavy lighting. The images that you see right now are all practical lighting. I lit the pool itself and kept the woman silhouetted without using special effects. I plan on making the camera work tight and close for intimacy, and lighting it colorful and poppy for beauty.

I want to treat music videos like cinema and encourage people to pay attention to the visuals as well as the song.

This gave me more creative control and allowed the song to become the script itself.KEEPING IT REALAlthough this music video will display some computer-generated effects, the majority of this project will rely on heavy lighting. The images that you see right now are all practical lighting. I lit the pool itself and kept the woman silhouetted without using special effects. I plan on making the camera work tight and close for intimacy, and lighting it colorful and poppy for beauty. I want to treat music videos like cinema and encourage people to pay attention to the visuals as well as the song.

story:
Office Hours is the newest ICTV (Ithaca College Television) scripted dramedy. It's about a girl named Patty. She's the campus's own Olivia Pope. It seems as though she has everything: the connections, the power, the reputation. But she has a big secret. What happens when the one person she hoped wouldn't find out finally digs up that dirt? Not only is she at risk of losing her underground network, but also her best friend, Steph. With a wacky bunch of characters, and a real beating heart in the story of friendship, Office Hours is new ground on ICTV.

Office Hours is the brain-child of Jordan Aaron (Ithaca College '18), Joel Kalow (Ithaca College '18), Anna McPeak (Ithaca College '16) and Yasmeen Mughal (Ithaca College '18). It was born on the pole-vaulting mats of the Athletic and Events Center at Ithaca College where we spent many hours, brainstorming, listening to Mazzy Star, and writing a TV show. 

Anna, who also directed the pilot you watched above, will be spending the spring in Los Angeles, California. She will act as our LA Consultant/voice of reason. Thanks, Anna. 

We brought in JoAnn Castillo (Ithaca College '18) to be our Director of Audience Engagement and with her help, we will be weaving in elements of transmedia never before seen on ICTV!

Meet the Team!

Why We Need You

Here's just a few examples of where your contributions will go:
  • Props and set dressing
  • Costumes (a few of the characters are hockey fans!)
  • Marketing! It can't all be online! With your help we can make sure we get some material out into the real world!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're strapped for cash, don't you worry! Make sure you share this page on your social media! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Vine, Snapchat, it's all fair game! And be sure to check back with our ongoing transmedia starting in February!  

Spring 2016, we're coming for ya!

story:
What's happening?

The dating culture in New York City questions the place and presence of love. It is a common conversation around bars and coffee houses and there have been theatre performances reflecting on it. We're bringing a story to film on 3D (also available in 2D) that finds itself tangled in the complexities of this transition. 


Why 3D?

The third dimension has come in as an innovation and change in cinema. It pops out of the screen and brings a whole new level of interaction with audiences. 3D of the Goddard and Gaspar Noe cinema is a strong inspiration for the film.



Synopsis

Valerie and Ian are friends, or are they in love? Ian has a girlfriend and it's not Eve. Eve is the VIP bartender at Ian's club and is in love with Valerie. Set in NYC, "Upstream" dives into the lives of three New Yorkers chasing something so similar. But what’s getting in their way?


Process

Our plan with the movie is something like this:

- Collaborate with other industry professionals who are creative and technical. We want to play!

- Finalise the ideal equipment and locations.

- Film in January 2016

- Distribute through both 3D and 2D Film Festivals around the world! Who knows we may find ourselves at Cannes or Oscars or both. 


Obstacles

Money! We are a group of talented artists with great training to back us up. For years we have harboured dreams about making great art and putting ourselves out there for the industry to see us and know us. We need resources that we have budgeted for and with your help we can make it happen.



Other ways you can help

- Be a part of the crew! If you think you have something to offer or would like to volunteer and be a part of this amazingly ambitious experience then send us your resume! We'd love that and we'll certainly be in touch!

- Make a cellphone video answering the question: "What's the most difficult thing about love?", Share it with us and we'll share your voice with our fanbase.

- Just share our campaign and help us raise funds to make this amazing piece of art come to life!




Team:

Our core crew is of 7 artists from 5 different countries with more to join. That's what New York can do! 

Shashwat Gupta (Director)is an Indian journalist turned actor/filmmaker who constantly questions belief systems in social establishments.  He has previously worked as an actor, director, screenwriter, editor and cinematographer in India and the United Kingdom. He received his BA in Journalism from Middlesex University and MA in Creative and Cultural Entrepreneurship from the University of London. In August 2013, he moved to New York to purse an MFA in Acting from the Actors Studio Drama School. He is currently a resident artist for the Indo American Arts Council and works on various film and theater projects around the city.

Julie Deffet (Producer) was born in 1988 in a small french speaking town in southern Belgium. She studied Journalism at: l'Université Libre de Bruxelles and after getting her master degree moved to New York City to study filmmaking at The New School. She currently lives and work in New York on both narrative and documentary films. 

Esther Sophia Artner (Writer/Actor) is a New York based actress, originally from Vienna, Austria. She attended a Rudolph Steiner school, where she began to incorporate art and acting into her life. During her undergraduate degree she lived in different countries and experienced many different cultures including: London, Barcelona and Berlin. At the age of 28 she moved to New York to master her craft as an actress at the Actors Studio Drama School. Some of her most recent credits include: Nora Helmer from ‘A Doll House’, Harper from ‘Angels in America’ and Sophia Rilke from ‘Stadt Elegies’. She is a resident artist with the New York based Box Collective. She feels grateful for her family, her fellow artist, her friends and the nature, which keep inspiring and nurturing her. 

Robert Montana (Actor) was born under the Brooklyn Bridge and was raised on the salt air of Long Island. As the sea called to him he enlisted in the United States Marine Corps, exploring Africa, Iraq and Japan. After six years of honorable service he decided to close that chapter of his life and found a place for healing and story telling in the theatre. Robert is currently studying at the Actors Studio Drama School at Pace University. 

Olivia Hardin (Actor) grew up in Columbia, Tennessee, a town best known for its annual Mule Day Parade and festivities! Growing up, she was a competitive gymnast with her coach Norm McKenzie for 15 years before she jetted off to the amazing city of Austin where double majored with a BA in Theater and Dance and a BS in Radio-TV-Film at at the University of Texas. While living in Austin, Olivia acted in numerous independent short and feature film projects while also jumping back for some behind-the-camera work as a director, make-up artist and writer. One of her favorite film projects was working on the independent feature, Z: A Zombie Musical. Olivia is currently living in NYC working towards her MFA at The Actors Studio Drama School.

Jesse Stone  (Assistant Director) is a Canadian singer-songwriter. He graduated from Trebas Institute with a certificate in Music Business Administration. He has previously worked as an event producer and blog editor for the Montreal-based start-up, Hot Soupe. In the spring of 2015, he released his debut record, “Break Of Day.” He has experience working as boom operator and production sound mixer on film. Jesse currently studies at Audio Production at the Institute Of Audio Research in New York City. This will be his first experience as an Assistant Director as he continues his foray in the world of film.

Lauren Callen (Assistant Producer)  is a proud Boston native who is a New York City based Actress and Voice-Over talent trained in the Modern Method. Lauren attended Adelphi University where she recieved a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Acting and where she also had the opportunity to study abroad at The London Dramatic Academy where she recieved classical training. Currently Lauren is going into her third and final year at The Actors Studio Drama School where she will recieve her Master of Fine Arts in Acting in 2016. Currently Lauren is taking on the role of Jess in the production of Destinations directed by Van Dirk Fisher playing at The Riant Theatre's Strawberyy One-Act Festival. Lauren also just finished her voice-over coaching and producing her Commercial Reel at PDR Voice-Over Coaching with Peter Rofé. Lauren is currently an Intern to Farrah Crane (Executive Director of Education) at The Barrow Group Theatre Company and School.

story:
• In the begining this design was simply a stool in form of a guitar for onstage use. Then I started to add extras like unfoldable music stand, guitar stand and foot stand / left or right/. The stool is supplied with two drawers for left and right hand accessories         / botleneck, capo, thumbpick, plectrum, tuner , hex etc./

When it serves as a guitar stand there are wheel and seat stoppers.
For performing mode the seat and the foot stand can be adjusted and individualised.
On the picture is the prototype and funds needed for 3D printers, CNC mashines and best possible materials for the real rpoduct.


And that's all there is to it.

story:
Bref résumé

Le Raid 4L Trophy est une formidable aventure humaine, sportive et solidaire pour les étudiants âgés de 18 à 28 ans. Ici, il n’est pas question de vitesse mais d’orientation pour l’emporter. Relever le défi, c’est d’abord franchir la ligne d’arrivée. Et pour y parvenir, les participants découvriront la pleine dimension du mot entraide. Pour déjouer les pièges d’oueds et de sable dans lesquels beaucoup ne manqueront pas de s’ensabler. C'est pour cela que Florian De Boeck, étudiant en ingénierie civil, et Zaccaria Aghemio, étudiant en ingénierie de gestion, ont décidé de se lancer dans l'aventure. 

"En plus de nous offrir une opportunité exceptionnelle d’échanges inter-culturels, ce projet répond à plusieurs valeurs qui nous sont chères comme la solidarité, l’entraide ou encore la générosité. La réalisation de ce projet est aussi une démarche qui développe notre capacité à entreprendre, en phase directe avec notre cursus académique. Tous deux passionnés d’entrepreneuriat, nous sommes impliqués dans de nombreux projets liant nos capacités à entreprendre, à innover et à pouvoir s’adapter à de nombreuses situations. De plus, ayant déjà participé à des projets humanitaires, lorsque nous avons appris que le 4L Trophy collaborait avec “les Enfants du désert”, nous n’avons pas hésité. La possibilité d’offrir notre aide à tous ces enfants est une occasion unique que nous espérons, grâce à votre aide, pouvoir réaliser. Ce projet regroupant à la fois ce côté humanitaire et ce sens de l’aventure est une opportunité proposée seulement aux étudiants et nous aimerions la saisir tant que nous en avons la chance."


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

La prochaine édition du raid 4L Trophy aura lieu du 18 au 28 février 2016. Pour réaliser ce projet nous aurions besoin d’un budget compris entre 9000 et 11 000 euros. Nous cherchons donc un soutien sous forme de sponsoring ou crowdfunding.

Nous vous présentons le détail des frais auxquels nous devrons faire face afin de réaliser notre projet:

- Inscription au raid 4L Trophy :  3200 €

- Voiture (Achat + préparation) :  4500 €

- Support sponsoring (stickers, T-shirts, ...) :  1000 €

- Assurance du véhicule :  500 €

- Assurance rapatriement :  200 €

- Essence : 800 €

- Péages  : 300 €

- Frais de nourriture et de boisson : 200 €

- Fournitures éducatives et sportives pour les enfants : 300 €

Total      11 000 €

Voici, ci-dessous, les avantages dont vous pourrez bénéficier en nous soutenant. Nous avons affiché le logo des principaux médias internationaux qui suivent le raid mais il ne faut pas oublier tous les médias régionaux :

1. Votre image

- Vous vous afficherez comme une entreprise jeune et dynamique, soucieuse du développement humanitaire.


2. Votre visibilité internationale

- Vous bénéficierez d'un coup de marketing international et original étant donné que nous parcourrons la Belgique, la France, l’Espagne et le Maroc. Le rallye de l’année passée a rassemblé 1200 équipages, nous vous laissons imaginer que 1200 4L ne passent pas inaperçues;


- La couverture médiatique de ce raid vous offre également une opportunité supplémentaire en terme de visibilité. A titre d’exemple, lors du 4L Trophy 2013, il y a eu 52 parutions TV, 47 mentions à la radio, 2092 articles de presse, 254 articles sur le web et 2 millions de pages Internet vues sur le site officiel[1]durant le raid;


- Après chaque étape, l’équipe médiatique de Désertours réalise plusieurs interviews auprès des équipages. Ces interviews, accompagnées d’un résumé de l’étape du jour et d’une sélection de photos, seront diffusées chaque soir lors du « JT 4L » sur plusieurs chaînes nationales et internationales et seront également disponibles sur le site Internet officiel du 4L Trophy;

- Nous avons déjà créé notre page Facebook;

- Si vous le désirez et afin de maximiser votre visibilité, nous créerons des T-shirts à l’effigie de nos sponsors (voir détails en annexe).

3. Mais encore…

- Après le raid, nous nous engageons à circuler avec notre 4L durant minimum un an. Celle-ci se fera évidemment remarquer et nous promouvrons dès lors votre entreprise, de manière originale dans la région bruxelloise, du Brabant wallon et de Liège, puis de la Cote Suisse, notamment la région de Genève à Lausanne.

- Nous avons contacté plusieurs agences de presse afin de leur demander de nous consacrer un article à la fin de notre aventure. Nous ne manquerons pas de mentionner les sponsors qui nous auront permis de mener à bien notre projet;

- Un départ groupé de tous les équipages belges sera organisé au Cinquantenaire. La presse y sera naturellement présente comme lors de l’édition 2015;

D'autres façons d'aider

N'hésitez pas à passer le mot ou à faire de la publicité autour de vous. Il est possible partager le lien via Indiegogo.

story:
I Am An Eco-Social Strategist

My name is Stuart Scott.  I have committed my life to altering civilization's catastrophic trajectory in terms of climate and ecology.  Over my professional career I was Wall Street's first environmentalist stockbroker in the 1970s, an IT consultant to New York City's largest banks and IBM in the 1980s, then went from tech to teaching in the 1990s.  I literally quit my day job as a university instructor in 2008 to focus full-time on fixing the climate problem, and went to where I thought change was most likely to come from, the UN-sponsored climate negotiations, known as the COP, or Conference of Parties to the Kyoto Protocols.

What I found was simultaneously hopeful and discouraging, inspiring and depressing.  The negotiations were a diplomatic battle between those who want to protect the future of humanity and life on Earth, and those intent upon making money at all cost, and preserving Business-As-Usual.  It was a modern day tragedy in the making. 

Since then I have focus intensely upon the systemic contradictions within society and the individual human psyche that are hurtling us toward a collision with Nature.  My work is now to catalyze an understanding of the epic battle for the future of civilization and life on Earth that is called 'the COP.'

Fixing the Climate Crisis from Hollywood

Christian Meoli is our Producer.  His company, Voltaire Media, specializes in strategic marketing concepts, digital engagement, social media and brand identity development for entertainment companies.  

Christian also operates Arena Cinema Hollywood, one of the top indie movie theaters in Los Angeles.  Previously, as Vice President of Marketing for Bigfoot Entertainment, he directed numerous domestic and international theatrical and home entertainment campaigns, notably the award-winning "9000 Needles."  Christian has been featured in the Los Angeles Business Journal and LA Weekly for industry insight,  He also has an established career as a working actor, appearing in over 100 film/TV programs, most recently NCIS:LA and Ray Donovan.  He has had the good fortune to work with the top echelon of producers and directors in TV/Film.

To support CLIMATE MATTERS, charitable donations can be accepted through our fiscal sponsor The Film Collaborative.


We are collaborating with Green Planet Films (greenplanetfilms.org), founded in 2003 in Northern California, a non-profit distributor created to promote environmental education through the artistic power of film.  Green Planet Films connects environmental filmmakers documenting the relationship between nature and humanity for an evolving global movement seeking greater knowledge about the natural world we inhabit and depend upon.

The Backdrop - COP-21 (Conference of Parties)

The conference objective is to achieve a universal agreement on climate, from all the nations of the world. This campaign will raise the funds to film inside of COP-21 in Paris this year, an effort to reveal the elephant in the room.  The footage will be crafted into a documentary that lays out in plain, understandable terms the tug of war between nations and  governments and economic forces and 'civil society '(the people). 

Our future is being bartered for short term economic gain.  But the consequences are already lapping at our doorstep with a real an present danger of the collapse of civilization by mid-century.  Governments know of this, but must downplay their knowledge because of that elephant in the room.  This is both shocking and enraging.  How could we as a species be so selfish and blind?

The Cast

We will have participation from , but not be limited to the following individuals:

Stuart Scott

Stuart is the host of Climate Matters, a series of panel discussions in a talk show format that take place at the UN climate negotiation.  He is the central unifying character in this documentary, and will bring together the other notable people who comprise our cast.  He will conduct our interviews provide the narrative for events taking place in Paris during this year's COP-21 climate negotiations. 

Dr. James Hansen

James Hansen is the world’s most famous climate scientist. As Director of NASA’s Goddard Institute in New York City for 42 years, Dr. Hansen has been sounding the alarm on climate change for 3 decades, through a series of US presidential administrations. A separate page entitled Who Is James Hansen is submitted as Appendix A. to this proposal.

Dr. Hansen will be attending the UN climate negotiations for the first time since they began at the invitation of Stuart Scott. He has heretofore avoided the negotiations believing that policy makers are not discussing real solutions there but rather merely engaging in face-saving rhetoric.

Christiana Figueres

Ms. Figueres has been the Executive Secretary of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) since July 2010. She has presided over five Conferences of the Parties (COPs), and is now faced with the difficult task of delivering a strong agreement on climate change in Paris.  She has a long history in the field of global climate change, having been a member of the Costa Rican negotiating team 1995-2009, and having played a number of key roles in the governance of the UNFCCC before joining the secretariat. (To Be Confirmed)

Dr. Katharine Hayhoe

Katharine Hayhoe is an atmospheric scientist and associate professor of political science at Texas Tech University, where she is director of the Climate Science Center. She co-authored the book A Climate for Change: Global Warming Facts for Faith-Based Decisions together with her husband, Andrew Farley, and Evangelical Minister.  She also co-authored reports for the US Global Change Research Program, as well as National Academy of Sciences reports, including the 3rd National Climate Assessment, released on May 6, 2014.  Shortly after the report was released, she stated, "Climate change is here and now, and not in some distant time or place," adding "The choices we're making today will have a significant impact on our future."  She has served as an expert reviewer for the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's (IPCC) 4th Assessment Report. Time Magazine listed her among the 100 most influential people on Earth in 2014 for her skill as a climate communicator.

Archbishop Emeritus of Canterbury Rowan Williams

Rowan Douglas Williams, Baron Williams of Oystermouth is an Anglican bishop, theologian and poet.  Rev. Williams was the 104th Archbishop of Canterbury, from 2002 until 2012. During and since his tenure as the leading cleric in the Church of England he has been very outspoken on climate change, the human cause and our responsibility for action. He has been a leading voice from the faith community and is a strong orator with a powerful personal presence.

Rev. Richard Cizik

Richard Cizik was the Vice President for Governmental Affairs of the National Association of Evangelicals (NAE) and one of the most prominent Evangelical lobbyists in the United States. In his position with the NAE, Cizik's primary responsibilities were setting the organization's policy on issues and lobbying the White House, Congress, and the Supreme Court. Cizik also served as NAE's national spokesman and edited a monthly magazine, NAE Washington Insight. Since 2003, he has been active in a type of environmentalism known as "creation care"; his stance on global warming has drawn both support and criticism from fellow Evangelicals. He serves on the Board of Advisors of the Nicholas Institute for Environmental Policy Solutions.

Dr. Peter Wadhams (Polar Ice Scientist)

Dr. Wadhams is professor of Ocean Physics, and Head of the Polar Ocean Physics Group in the Department of Applied Mathematics and Theoretical Physics, University of Cambridge. He is best known for his work on sea ice. He is the president of the International Association for the Physical Sciences of the Oceans Commission on Sea Ice and Coordinator for the International Programme for Antarctic Buoys. Wadhams has been the leader of 40 polar field expeditions. He is considered an expert on the impacts that the disappearance of Arctic sea ice will have on climate change, pointing to the high likelihood of the collapse of civilization as early as the middle of this century due to the expected inability of a warming planet to produce enough food for its human inhabitants.

Dr. Wadhams will be coming to the UN climate negotiations for his first time at the invitation of Stuart Scott to participate in a panel discussion on the conditions in the Arctic and what they bode for our future.

Dr. Saleem Huq (Climate Scientist, Adaptation Specialization)

Dr. Huq is a Senior Fellow in the Climate Change Group at the International Institute for Environment and Development in the UK.  Saleemul Huq is an expert on the links between climate change and sustainable development, particularly from the perspective of developing countries. He is also currently Director of the International Centre for Climate Change & Development. Dr. Huq has been a Lead Author in the IPCC’s 3rd, 4th, and 5th Assessment Reports.

Archbishop Serafim Kykkotis (Eastern Orthodox Church)

Archbishop Kykotis is a member of the Central Committee of the World Council of Churches, member of the Southern Africa Faith Communities Environment Institute, and director of the Office on Climate Change for the Patriarchate of Alexandria. Since 2002, he has participated at the United Nations COP conferences. He has authored Church and Environment (Athens, 2012) and participates in the Orthodox-Anglican International Theological Dialogue. He is outspoken on the matter of climate change.


Connecting the Dots

This film will be a wake up call on a grand scale.  It aims to empower viewers with knowledge and inspire in them a commitment to create change while there may still be time.  We will go behind the scenes, spotlighting this critical moment in human history when we are facing our own possible extinction, but choosing to look the other way.
Your contribution to the film will help bring about the social tipping point by which we might avert the worst that would lie in store for us in a world of runaway climate change.

Even the economists fear that in a world of runaway climate change we may not be able to muster the financial resources to do what must be done. Please look inside yourself, and support this project, while money still has meaning. 

Our Usual Habits

The vast majority of investment in Western Society goes into activities that make money but degrade or destroy the natural world either directly or indirectly.  We are asking you to be among the .1% of people who will spend their money to restore Nature.  You are used to justifying your expenditures by 'what's in it for me' criteria.  That is what we are taught from childhood.  Here you are being asked to spend according to a criteria of 'what's in it for others', including your children, their children, and all of present and future life on Earth.

Needs

The goal of this campaign is $61,000 to film and document COP-21 and what goes on in and around it.  We have a pool of videographers, sound technicians, editors, producers, and are networked with distributors in Hollywood.  Who can make it to this year's COP-21 to help us film will depend upon your generosity.   That amount will pay for expenses of a crew for the two weeks from November 30-December 11.  Some will come from the US.  Some will already be in Paris.  Many will volunteer time and work for less than 'union scale'.  All will believe in the urgency of this project.

Perks

Visit Our Perks to See Great Items Available With Your Generous Donation

The Impact

This movie will help create the 'social tipping point'  that is needed to speed our response to climate change, over the interference of forces that currently impede that response.

We are much more likely to 'fix' the climate problem out of Hollywood than out of Washington, D.C.

Risks & Challenges 

Time is short.  We must raise money sufficient for transportation, lodging and food for the tight crew.  The risk here is that a small response will blunt the tip of our arrow, by constraining the amount of footage we can shoot at the COP in our effort to 'reveal to humanity the elephant hiding in the room'.

The challenges will be many.  But I have risen above challenges at the annual COPs since 2008 when I began in Poznan, Poland at COP-14.  I am a climate warrior.

Spread the Word

Thank you so much from the entire CLIMATE MATTERS team for your financial support, which will help to raise awareness of what is interfering with needed environmental change.

WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU!  PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS ON SOCIAL MEDIA TO HELP SAVE THE PLANET.
story_txt:
I Am An Eco-Social StrategistMy name is Stuart Scott.  I have committed my life to altering civilization's catastrophic trajectory in terms of climate and ecology.  Over my professional career I was Wall Street's first environmentalist stockbroker in the 1970s, an IT consultant to New York City's largest banks and IBM in the 1980s, then went from tech to teaching in the 1990s.  I literally quit my day job as a university instructor in 2008 to focus full-time on fixing the climate problem, and went to where I thought change was most likely to come from, the UN-sponsored climate negotiations, known as the COP, or Conference of Parties to the Kyoto Protocols.What I found was simultaneously hopeful and discouraging, inspiring and depressing.  The negotiations were a diplomatic battle between those who want to protect the future of humanity and life on Earth, and those intent upon making money at all cost, and preserving Business-As-Usual.  It was a modern day tragedy in the making. Since then I have focus intensely upon the systemic contradictions within society and the individual human psyche that are hurtling us toward a collision with Nature.  My work is now to catalyze an understanding of the epic battle for the future of civilization and life on Earth that is called 'the COP.'Fixing the Climate Crisis from HollywoodChristian Meoli is our Producer.  His company, Voltaire Media, specializes in strategic marketing concepts, digital engagement, social media and brand identity development for entertainment companies.  Christian also operates Arena Cinema story:
REMIND ME AGAIN...WHAT IS PRECIOUS CARGO?
The New York private school culture is unique, to say the least. Having grown up in that culture, Lauren Singerman and Sasha Kaye have a lot of affection for it, and they also see its comedic potential. Precious Cargo is a comedy loosely based on their experience entering that world from a different angle - as the women hired to guarantee kids' acceptance into the coveted halls of the fanciest schools in NYC. All while doing their best to manage the ups and downs of their own chaotic lives.

We funded production through the generous donations of friends and family. These contributions allowed us to hire a top-notch director of photography and sound recordist, and to pay for the type of equipment we needed in order to produce a beautiful product. We had a cast of forty actors and a crew of twenty. We shot season one of Precious Cargo this past July, in various locations throughout Manhattan, Queens, and Quogue.

WHY DO YOU GUYS NEED MORE MONEY?
We are launching our second fundraising campaign to raise money for post-production, which has already begun. Post-production is the vital step in determining the quality of the final product - it's important to work with people who will do justice to the remarkable work of the writer, actors, DP, director, and the entire crew. We have hired a fantastic editor, Nathan Allen, and an excellent composer, Adam Lindquist. These two fellas are in the process of editing and composing for us, and the material looks and sounds fantastic so far. Once their work is done, the episodes will be passed on to the color corrector and final audio mixer.

We're so excited about how the footage turned out, and we'd love to have you on board to help see us through the next stage of the process! Your contributions will go towards:

  • Editing
  • Music
  • Color Correction
  • Final Audio Mix
  • Publicity

BEFORE I DONATE, I'D LIKE TO KNOW EXACTLY WHO I'M GIVING MY MONEY TO.

Fair enough! Here you go:

Lauren Singerman (Lisa/Executive Producer): Lauren is an actor, a dialect coach, and an awesome tutor. As an actor, Lauren has worked with the Royal Shakespeare Company, Two River Theater Company, Epic Theatre Ensemble, Cider Mill Playhouse, The Artful Conspirators, Kitchen Theatre Company, The Here & Now, Lark Play Development Center, id Theater, and Project Y, among others. She played super nerd Tori Atherton on All My Children. BA: Wesleyan University. MFA: Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University. Member of AEA and SAG-AFTRA. She's married to Dano. Check out her website!

Sasha Kaye (Sandy/Executive Producer): Sasha is a New York-based actor, comedy writer and producer. Her work has been seen at such venues as 13th Street Rep, the NYC International Fringe Festival, McCarter Theater Center, Mile Square Theater, Old Lyric Rep and on Spike TV. Sasha is co-creator, writer and star of the 2012 web series Waiting on Others. She is currently a producer on season 6 of the hit showInk Master. She received her MFA in Acting from Rutgers University and has studied sketch comedy, stand up and improv at Upright Citizens Brigade and People's Improv Theater. www.sashakaye.com. 

Dano Madden (Writer/Executive Producer): Dano Madden is an award-winning writer and director. He is a 2015 MacDowell Fellow. His plays have been produced and/or received development by Actors Theatre of Louisville, The Source Festival, The Artful Conspirators, World At Large Theatre, Seattle Repertory Theatre, The National New Play Network, Mile Square Theatre, Burnt Studio Productions, Northwest Playwrights Alliance, Idaho Theatre for Youth, Kitchen Theatre Company, The University of Tulsa, Bloomsburg University, The Lark, Elephant Room Productions and Seven Devils Playwrights Conference, among others. Dano’s plays have been published by Samuel French, Playscripts Inc., Best American Short Plays and Indie Theater Now. He received his BA from Boise State University and his MFA from Rutgers University. He is currently a speech and drama teacher at the Marymount School of New York. He’s married to Lauren. www.danomadden.com.

Ben Simington (Director/Executive Producer): Ben Simington has taught video in New York City for over 9 years to students ranging in age from kindergarten to high school. Before teaching full-time, he wrote film criticism for Mubi.com, programmed the "Bastards of Hitch" series at 92YTribeca, screened film festival entries for South by Southwest, and worked in independent film distribution at Zeitgeist Films. He holds a BA and MA in Film Studies from Wesleyan University. 

Addie Walsh (Producer): Writer/Performer That’s All I Got  (Project Y ; UNITED SOLO FESTIVAL 2014 AWARD); Writer/Performer The Lala & Mummo Show  (Project Y, Planet Connections Festivity 2014); Writer/Performer Before & After (Project Y); TV writer for just about every soap opera.  Emmy Award & four Writers Guild Awards for Outstanding Writing. Acting: Three Tall Women, The Intelligent Design of Jenny Chow, The Clean House (Kitchen Theater).  Back in the day…member of St. Louis Repertory acting ensemble.  Also served as the theater’s dramaturg and resident playwright.

Talya Klein (Hair, Makeup, & Costume Design/Producer): Talya Klein is a retired make-up artist, having worked in both London and New York, and she now only takes her brushes off the shelf for very special projects. She is thrilled to be part of the Precious Cargo team, and is happy to take credit for how fabulous everyone looks on camera. She holds an MFA in directing from Brown/Trinity and is the Producing Artistic Director of The Here & Now, a company which produces one-off site-specific events. In her spare time, Talya knits miniature sweaters and makes tiny terrariums.

Alex Peterson (Director of Photography): Alex grew up in Chicago, and he moved to New York City to study film at NYU. Taking as many cinematography classes as he could, Alex was among the last generation of filmmakers to learn how to make movies on film while also being given a head start on digital cinema. After graduating, Alex worked in the camera department for commercials, music videos, and feature films. He has worked for and learned from some of the best DPs and crews in New York. As a cinematographer, Alex has traveled the country and the world shooting for ABC, MTV, and award winning filmmakers at Greener Media. Most recently Alex and Greener Media collaborated on a new documentary about the Italian region of Calabria, as well as the 2015 Sundance Institute Award winning documentary Man in the Maze. While home in New York, Alex is keeping busy shooting for the Emmy Award winning Discovery ID show A Crime to Remember.

Adam Lindquist (Composer): Adam Lindquist is a multi-instrumentalist musician and composer now residing in Brooklyn, NY.  Originally from North Carolina, Adam grew up playing folk and rock while also learning traditional composition techniques.  He studied music composition in college at UNCW and completed some post-college studies with Berklee School of Music, after which he began writing for TV/film, theater and dance.  Adam enjoys melding electronic and acoustic sounds to create sounds suited toward a variety of tones and mediums. You can listen to a sample of his music at adamlindquist.com.

Nathan Allen (Editor): Nathan received his MFA in Film Production from Boston University.  From there, he made the move to Los Angeles, where he has edited several feature films, television pilots and reality shows.  In addition, he has edited episodes of the scripted television shows Glee, Nip/Tuck and Rizzoli & Isles.

She received her MFA in Acting from Rutgers University and has studied sketch comedy, stand up and improv at Upright Citizens Brigade and People's Improv Theater. www.sashakaye.com. 

Dano Madden (Writer/Executive Producer): Dano Madden is an award-winning writer and director. He is a 2015 MacDowell Fellow. His plays have been produced and/or received development by Actors Theatre of Louisville, The Source Festival, The Artful Conspirators, World At Large Theatre, Seattle Repertory Theatre, The National New Play Network, Mile Square Theatre, Burnt Studio Productions, Northwest Playwrights Alliance, Idaho Theatre for Youth, Kitchen Theatre Company, The University of Tulsa, Bloomsburg University, The Lark, Elephant Room Productions and Seven Devils Playwrights Conference, among others. Dano’s plays have been published by Samuel French, Playscripts Inc., Best American Short Plays and Indie Theater Now. He received his BA from Boise State University and his MFA from Rutgers University. He is currently a speech and drama teacher at the Marymount School of New York. He’s married to Lauren. www.danomadden.com.
Ben Simington (Director/Executive Producer): Ben Simington has taught video in New York City for over 9 years to students ranging in age from kindergarten to high school. Before teaching full-time, he wrote film criticism for Mubi.com, programmed the "Bastards of Hitch" series at 92YTribeca, screened film festival entries for South by Southwest, and worked in independent film distribution at Zeitgeist Films. He holds a BA and MA in Film Studies from Wesleyan University. 


Addie Walsh (Producer): Writer/Performer That’s All I Got  (Project Y ; UNITED SOLO FESTIVAL 2014 AWARD); Writer/Performer The Lala & Mummo Show  (Project Y, Planet Connections Festivity 2014); Writer/Performer Before & After (Project Y); TV writer for just about every soap opera.  Emmy Award & four Writers Guild Awards for Outstanding Writing. Acting: Three Tall Women, The Intelligent Design of Jenny Chow, The Clean House (Kitchen Theater).  Back in the day…member of St. Louis Repertory acting ensemble.  Also served as the theater’s dramaturg and resident playwright.

Talya Klein (Hair, Makeup, & Costume Design/Producer): Talya Klein is a retired make-up artist, having worked in both London and New York, and she now only takes her brushes off the shelf for very special projects. She is thrilled to be part of the Precious Cargo team, and is happy to take credit for how fabulous everyone looks on camera. She holds an MFA in directing from Brown/Trinity and is the Producing Artistic Director of The Here & Now, a company which produces one-off site-specific events. In her spare time, Talya knits miniature sweaters and makes tiny terrariums.
Alex Peterson (Director of Photography): Alex grew up in Chicago, and he moved to New York City to study film at NYU. Taking as many cinematography classes as he could, Alex was among the last generation of filmmakers to learn how to make movies on film while also being given a head start on digital cinema. After graduating, Alex worked in the camera department for commercials, music videos, and feature films. He has worked for and learned from some of the best DPs and crews in New York. As a cinematographer, Alex has traveled the country and the world shooting for ABC, MTV, and award winning filmmakers at Greener Media. Most recently Alex and Greener Media collaborated on a new documentary about the Italian region of Calabria, as well as the 2015 Sundance Institute Award winning documentary Man in the Maze. While home in New York, Alex is keeping busy shooting for the Emmy Award winning Discovery ID show A Crime to Remember.

Adam Lindquist (Composer): Adam Lindquist is a multi-instrumentalist musician and composer now residing in Brooklyn, NY.  Originally from North Carolina, Adam grew up playing folk and rock while also learning traditional composition techniques.  He studied music composition in college at UNCW and completed some post-college studies with Berklee School of Music, after which he began writing for TV/film, theater and dance.  Adam enjoys melding electronic and acoustic sounds to create sounds suited toward a variety of tones and mediums. You can listen to a sample of his music at adamlindquist.com.
Nathan Allen (Editor): Nathan received his MFA in Film Production from Boston University.  From there, he made the move to Los Angeles, where he has edited several feature films, television pilots and reality shows.  In addition, he has edited episodes of the scripted television shows Glee, Nip/Tuck and Rizzoli & Isles.

story:
SOMATIC

I’m Will Nash and I am the director of SOMATIC, which I'd like you to help me fund.

Set within a British military base in 1943, it is the story of George Watson, an old man who wants to re-live his life, avoid all the mistakes he made before, take time to enjoy the things he rushed and maybe even be able to spend more time with the people he loved. We all have parts of our lives that we wish we could change, do again and relive. For George, the meeting with Dr. Robert Briggs may give him this opportunity.

We already have the very talented Daniel Ings (Eddie The Eagle, Scrotal Recall, Endeavour and Ice Cream) cast as Dr. Briggs (as seen in the video above) as well as Siobhan Finneran (Downton Abbey, Benidorm, Happy Valley and Rita, Sue and Bob Too!) cast as Doctor Mary Thomson.

  


I’m Zara Ballantyne-Grove from Upbeat Productions and I am also the producer of SOMATIC. Upbeat is a video production company that creates promotional content, often to support theatrical film releases, but also for a variety of corporate clients.  Tom Webb, Kieran Lefort and I work together and we made a short film earlier this year which gave us the bug for creating more short films.

A few months ago we met Will Nash via Twitter who popped by to check out our studio. We got chatting, and soon we were swapping links of our recent short films. Will comes from a TV, film and commercial background, and it was fun to see how our approaches to filmmaking were both similar yet different.

Will then revealed he had a short film script set in the 1940s, and before we knew it pre-production on SOMATIC had begun. Tom and Kieran developed the concept of the lab funding video above, for which Kieran wrote the script and we then filmed in the Upbeat studio a week later.

We are making the most of the resources we have available, with industry professionals on board and filming with some of the best cinematic camera gear currently around, however to do the script justice, there are a few key areas we need to spend money on:-

  • Location (Ham House, London)
  • Costume design
  • Fuel (both human and automotive)

We would eventually like to expand the universe further and develop a feature film, and as such we feel that setting the film at Ham House will give SOMATIC the appropriate production value to engage potential funding bodies.

We are personally covering:-

  • Equipment
  • Marketing
  • Festival submission fees
With your help, we can give SOMATIC the production value required to help it stand out. Please help to spread the word by sharing the campaign and follow us on Twitter for updates. Thank you.

story:
Why and what are 

Emotions play a key role in relationships for us. The basic foundation to maintain relationship is through communication. How effectively we maintain communications will decide our relationship with the other person. In the 21st century, modern technology has laid an efficient path for better communications. We can reach to every corner of the world through present telecom services. With a smart phone in our hand, think about a friend who is 1000 miles away, can easily be reached out and share our happy or sad moments with him.

               In this campaign, we want to show a fun and interesting idea for a mobile application, to track emotions in different phases of our lives with selfies.




We have assigned individual colors in RAINBOW, for different emotions, like
Angry
Naughty
Argument
Confusion
Happy
Lonely
Lovely

For these emotions, we are going to integrate photo capturing functionality to capture our selfies. Accordingly, we will provide selection option for the present emotion on the specific situation. With the selection of different emotions, we are going to track the selection of emotion and present a weekly report like given below.

Source of Inventing

We always play with so many craft items. Depending on the final outcome, I used to display different emotions. My father will have my pictures of emotions. I enjoyed the pattern and I have implemented the same process with my brother.  And also I have submitted this research report to my teacher and parents. They encouraged me to develop a project which will be fun and useful. They helped me in all ways to understand the different aspects of presentation platforms and technical guidance to implement. We had formulated a blueprint to show case the data in pictures. And we have come across Indiegogo platform, through which an idea can spread to the whole world. I liked the platform's concept and intentions which made us to present our idea. This technique is fun to try.

Kindly,support us to make this idea get into the hearts of the people and share it to your loving buddies.

App Functionality :

We are going to integrate photo capturing functionality to capture our selfies. Accordingly, we will provide selection option for the present emotion on the specific situation. With the selection of different emotions, we are going to track the selection of emotion and present a weekly report.

 

Sharing through Social Media !
Share your expressions with your Family,Friends and Social Media !!

What We Need & What We Get:

The part of challenge is to execute our blue print, which is where we need your support. Our first priority is to complete the android mobile application development. Then we need to reach out to more people. These two tasks can be achieved with your financial and social media platform sharing. Under your guidance as a team with feedback and suggestions, we can execute the blue print.  Your experience and expertise will help me tremendously in reaching my target to many people.

Our Story:

My name is A. Chaitanya of 6th standard studying in Mount Littera Zee School, Hyderabad, India. My hobbies are art and Dance. As a part of curriculum, I used to develop many painting projects. I have special interest in design and software programming. With this interest, out of curiosity, I came up with this project.

Funds Break Down :

We're asking for $5000, which will pay for:

Basic Application development & Design - 80%

Taxes & Indiegogo Fees - 15%

Perks - 5%

In addition, there might be a few additional development costs and unexpected costs, so we'd love a little padding on our budget.

The Impact:

We are not making any new inventions which are going to disrupt the market. We are trying to make game on a way of emotional communication. Enjoying the life fullest make us happy and we want to see those smiles. That is the impact we are trying to make.

Risks & Challenges:

The android application development have to be finished, which should take 1 month – that is half of the length of the fundraising campaign.  Between the campaign, we’re quite confident about developing the mobile application.

However, and even though we’ve tried to build a certain latitude into our schedule, delays beyond our control are always possible.

Other Ways We Can Help:

Not every problem is solved with penny. Don’t hesitate to talk about this project to others around you and to share it on social networks.  If you follow blogs, celebrities or radio/TV/press journalists, ask them to take a look and to talk about the project.  This would be an enormous help!

Special Thanks to INDIEGOGO !

We are really thankful to Indiegogo platform for providing this wonderful opportunity to reach so many people in the whole. Heartfelt thanks to the whole team for supporting our journey with your wonderful tools and services.

Our Motto !

Have sum fun !

Happy & Colorful Smiles !

story:
Este es un proyecto Totalmente Independiente que explora las realidades Políticas y Sociales que se viven en Puerto Rico.

Mucho se habla hoy día sobre Puerto Rico. La quiebra económica, su estatus político, la "migración masiva" hacia los Estados Unidos y la creciente ola criminal son algunos de los titulares que diariamente vemos. La opinión pública pareciera tachar a los puertorriqueños como el peor ejemplo de auto-gobernanza en el territorio Estadounidense. Pero, ¿Realmente se auto-gobiernan los puertorriqueños?


Desde la invasión Estadounidense, pasando por el establecimiento del Estado Libre Asociado hasta nuestros días, ¡Viva Puerto Rico Libre? El Documental explora los diferentes factores que han empobrecido la calidad de vida de los puertorriqueños en la isla. Expone la situación política como "ficha de tranque" para cualquier intento de recuperación económica o social; a la vez que hace un llamado a la autogestión en todos los frentes posibles para combatir la crisis.


¡Viva Puerto Rico Libre? El Documental es un proyecto dirigido a los jóvenes que tiene como propósito crear conciencia del momento histórico que vivimos.
Durante cinco años, utilizando las redes sociales como medio de contacto, con una cámara en mano y muchas dudas decidí comenzar esta travesía. ¡No ha sido fácil! Son largas horas de entrevista a través de casi todo Puerto Rico. Con "nada" como presupuesto (sin financiamiento de ningún tipo) y escaso equipo técnico he logrado filmar más de veinte (20) entrevistas con personalidades como: Siete Nueve, Ricardo Rosselló, Rafael Bernabe, Tego Calderón, Sonia Fritz, Dennis Mario, Tito Roman Rivera, Nelson Denis, Luis Diaz entre muchos otros para explorar el costo de la libertad.


Hacer un proyecto Totalmente Independiente nos limita en términos de equipo y presupuesto pero nos da la libertad de trabajar los temas con la fluidez y transparencia que necesitan ser abordados.

Existen varios aspectos de la producción para las cuales necesitamos algo de dinero, pero como la producción esta enfocada en "NO PEDIR" bajo ningún concepto, hemos diseñado esta Campaña de PRE-VENTA  para obtener fondos. 

Estos fondos serán utilizados para: 

  • Finalizar Post-Production
  • Imprimir Camisetas
  • DVD
  • Lanzamiento Documental (Premiere)

La Pre-Venta

"Oferta Pa' Educarte"... adquieres el DVD, el afiche promocional y pasas a ser parte de los créditos al final del documental por apoyar esta iniciativa.

**DVD serán entregados a más tardar principios de 2017** 

**Camisetas serán entregadas a más tardar Junio 2016**

"Oferta Promotion-CREW"... adquieres la Camiseta Oficial de ¡Viva Puerto Rico Libre El Documental formando parte de nuestro crew de promoción, DVD, afiche promocional y pasas a ser parte de los créditos al final del documental por apoyar esta iniciativa.

**DVD serán entregados a más tardar principios de 2017**

**Camisetas serán entregadas a más tardar Junio 2016**

También hemos diseñado la oferta:

"Productor Asociado" para aquellos con alma de productor que de alguna manera creen en este proyecto y desean verlo terminado. Esta oferta es muy especial pues le da la oportunidad de ayudarnos a producir este filme con su patrocinio. Ademas de adquirir Dos (2) Camisetas Oficiales de ¡Viva Puerto Rico Libre El Documental, DVD y afiche promocional. 

**DVD serán entregados a más tardar principios de 2017** 

**Camisetas serán entregadas a más tardar Junio 2016**

Necesitamos $6,000 para lograr hacer esto posible. 

TODOS los fondos adquiridos serán utilizados en la producción de este proyecto, su lanzamiento y estrategia promocional. Su aportación sera la clave para que muchos jóvenes puedan recibir esta información sobre su historia. Ademas:

  • ¡Apoyas El Cine Local! Este proyecto es la primera producción de la casa productora Isleño Film. Actualmente Isleño Films se encuentra produciendo dos documentales.
  • ¡Apoyas La Educación! Este proyecto tiene como propósito educar los jóvenes sobre la situación actual de Puerto Rico.
  • ¡Apoyas La Economia Local! Isleño Filmes una compañía local que apoya a otras compañías locales adquiriendo servicios de impresión de camisas, material promocional y copias de DVD entre otros.

Recuerda...

¡Viva Puerto Rico Libre? El Documental es una producción Totalmente Independiente. Necesitamos tu ayuda para difundir el mensaje.

Apoya Esta Iniciativa:

  • Contribuye con la cantidad deseada
  • Adquiere Alguna de Nuestras Ofertas
  • Comparte Enlaces y Videos de la Campaña
  • Unete a nuestra pagina  en facebook.com/vivapuertoricolibreeldocumental/
Fecha A Estrenar: Agosto 2016.
**DVD serán entregados a más tardar principios de 2017** 
**Camisetas serán entregadas a más tardar Junio 2016**
