story:
Good day,

My name is Jeff-Roy Fahd, I am project manager for Solace foundation (a NGO in Lebanon). We work on aid, distribution and sustainable development projects. (House of Mouneh, Lebanese4refugees)

2 weeks ago I was escorting French journalists working for Le Parisien to the Lebanese-Syrian border in order to visit a camp for a story they were intended to write. The camp is situated in the middle of a big agricultural field in a region called Hawsh Al Harimi in West Bekaa. When I first met Jasem Al Ali, I got really touched by his story and the way he fled his home after the siege of ISIS, settling in the East Bekaa region where he got abused and fled again to the camp we visited in the West Bekaa. Jasem has 5 daughters and 2 small boys. The girls work in agriculture fields from time to time, Ahmad and Mohamad are 9 and 11 years old thus cannot work. Jasem has a closed vein in his head, his only job before fleeing his house was a driver and he couldn’t find any job that suits his health in Lebanon yet. Yesterday, I visited Jasem and the 14 member of his family living with him in the camp and spent the day with them. My trip yesterday was a personal trip and was not a work related trip; I got attached to Jasem and his family and decided to take the matter into my own hands by trying and helping him wherever I can. I brought some food supplies along with me yesterday and some clothes, but I asked his wife to prepare a list of items they need by priority so I won’t get stuff they might not need at the moment. The tent where Jasem is living is divided into 3 rooms, 1 room is for the kitchen, another is for the girls and the last room is a sitting room where the boys sleep. What touched me the most is that the coverings of the three rooms are mostly broken and the woods are shattered. Whenever the rain will come pouring down there is no doubt that water will fill their rooms. Jasem has a dept of over 12,000 USD for the owner of the camp because ever since the United Nations decided to reduce the aid for the registered refugees to 66 USD per FAMILY per month, Jasem and his family have been borrowing money and working for free under the patronage of the person in charge of the camp. I got attached to this family and this camp in particular as I am visiting them once a week, this is mainly why I decided to go online with this campaign in order to make a difference to Jasem and try and help him as much as possible. Next week I am staying at their place for 3 days in order to give them support and aid them. This family needs support before the winter, they need clothing, heating machine, gas and a proper cover for their tent and new wood; that is the main purpose of this campaign; Not to forget, I cannot move them from the camp into an apartment because of the dept they have. The funding will be distributed between covering the dept and getting ready for the winter season. I will be buying a lot of covers and clothing, two big heaters for each of the rooms. They preferred a heater that works on Gas because that is the cheapest between the options they have. I will be changing the covers and the wood that the tent is built with because these won’t last for another season; they are literally broken and shattered. In case I don’t reach my goal, we won’t be paying the dept they own to the landlord so we will simply fix the tent and buy the supplies they need in order to get past the winter season without any of them dying from cold or hunger. I think this is an important step in helping refugees in Lebanon and in the world, to make them feel safe and secure, to let them know that there are people from different religion and different background that care about your condition and will offer to help. I took the initiative because the winter is coming soon and the family will struggle to live if we do not act now. The challenges I face at the moment will be real if the winter season arrives before I get the funding, alone I will not be able to change their covers and fix the wood. My biggest challenge is to raise money in time in order to reshape their home so that they are covered for the winter season that is coming fast. I have been working in aid and distribution for the past 2 years, but I have never seen a situation like the situation of Jasem and we connected well and I will never forget his words telling me  “ you are member of the family now “. I will try my best to help them in case the campaign will not work but I could use a hand so the help I will allocate would be bigger.

I know there are a lot of people around the world that cannot donate money but your help is a must. In today’s world millions of people surf the web every day, sharing the story and calling for help will also help us raise the money in time and save a family of 14. Do not forget to use the Indiegogo tools.

Thank you a lot for your contribution. It will mean the world to them.
story_txt:
Good day, 
My name is Jeff-Roy Fahd, I am project manager for Solace foundation
(a NGO in Lebanon). We work on aid, distribution and sustainable development
projects. (House of Mouneh, Lebanese4refugees)
2 weeks ago I was escorting French journalists working for
Le Parisien to the Lebanese-Syrian border in order to visit a camp for a story
they were intended to write. The camp is situated in the middle of a big
agricultural field in a region called Hawsh Al Harimi in West Bekaa. When I first
met Jasem Al Ali, I got really touched by his story and the way he fled his
home after the siege of ISIS, settling in the East Bekaa region where he got
abused and fled again to the camp we visited in the West Bekaa. Jasem has 5
daughters and 2 small boys. The girls work in agriculture fields from time to
time, Ahmad and Mohamad are 9 and 11 years old thus cannot work. Jasem has a closed
vein in his head, his only job before fleeing his house was a driver and he couldn’t
find any job that suits his health in Lebanon yet. Yesterday, I visited Jasem
and the 14 member of his family living with him in the camp and spent the day
with them. My trip yesterday was a personal trip and was not a work related
trip; I got attached to Jasem and his family and decided to take the matter
into my own hands by trying and helping him wherever I can. I brought some food
supplies along with me yesterday and some clothes, but I asked his wife to

season that is coming fast. I have been working in aid and distribution for the
past 2 years, but I have never seen a situation like the situation of Jasem and
we connected well and I will never forget his words telling me  “ you are member of the family now “. I will
try my best to help them in case the campaign will not work but I could use a
hand so the help I will allocate would be bigger.
I know there are a lot of people around the world that
cannot donate money but your help is a must. In today’s world millions of
people surf the web every day, sharing the story and calling for help will also
help us raise the money in time and save a family of 14. Do not forget to use
the Indiegogo tools.
Thank you a lot for your contribution. It will mean the
world to them.

story:
The Man Behind the Gloves:

It’s one thing to have a dream. It’s an entirely different thing to fulfill the dreams of others. To help others attain goals that are beyond oneself is what it means to believe in - and fight for - the transformative power of the dream.

Deshawn Stevenson is that person. Fighting for both his dreams, and the dreams of others.

Deshawn is a highly-ranked amateur MMA fighter based in Greenville, NC. In a matter of three short years, he rose to a record of 8-0, and now holds six MMA titles between two different weight classes (middle and light-heavy weight) a USA National Champion title for Thai-boxing. He dreams of going further, of becoming a UFC fighter, but he knows he can’t do it alone.


After parting ways with his coach of four years in early 2014, training has become difficult. He must now travel 70 miles (as often as possible) to get to his current gym. These traveling expenses along with gym membership and equipment costs are taking a toll on his dream to be a professional fighter.


Despite all of this, Deshawn is acutely aware that his struggles pale in comparison to a lot of kids out there. Amazingly, amid a full-time job at Starbucks and his own training schedule, Deshawn finds time to be a children’s boxing coach, some of whom battle with autism.

Deshawn has a dream, and wants to fulfill the dreams of others. And again, he can’t do it alone. With your help, Deshawn can continue his training and take care of his training expenses:
  • Travel 
  • Gym Fees
  • Licensure fees
  • Fight preparation (Blood-work, nutrition, hotels ect.)
  • Pads
  • Gloves
  • Fight/Althetic/Training Wear
 Along with helping him continue to mentor kids in need. 25% of all funds raised will go towards purchasing equipment for Deshawn’’s students. 

Dreams can’t happen alone. Help make one come true, and help one dream become many.




We have some perks for those of you who are choosing to donate. We also have special perks for those contributing through a business. Be sure to pick the one you would like. All options are along the side of the page, and below.

 


Contributor Championships-By weight class:

Featherweight Champion: Deshawn will be forever thankful for your kindness.

Lightweight Champion: Deshawn will send personal Thank you cards to those who choose this perk.

Welterweight Champion: 10% off tickets to the next fight, and a chance to win a free ticket to the fight As well as a personal thank you card.

Middleweight Champion: A chance at winning a set of free tickets to the fight of your choice. All contributors wil be entered in the drawing automatically when choosing this perk. All middleweight champions contributors will recieve a 25% discount on tickets to Deshawns next fight.

Light Heavyweight Champion: Every #1 fan's dream is to get to hang out with their favorite fighter! By being a $100 contributor you will get to spend the afternoon with Deshawn grabbing lunch or an evening to catch a game/fight. You will have to provide contact information in order to recieve this perk.

Heavyweight Champion: Those who choose this perk will be given a pair of free tickets to Deshawn's next fight. And the opportunity to celebrate with Deshawn after the fight! Along with discounted tickets to fights of your choice. *Sponsor perks as well.

Super Heavyweight Champion: Anyone reaching this goal will be given not only a pair of free tickets, but also 2 months of one-on-one training sessions with Deshawn, and a 1-year training scholarship for a kid of your choice. (Only applicable for in state) Out-Of state contributors will receive 2 free tickets to a fight of choice, and hang out afterthe fight. As well as personalized t-shirts you can wear to the fight. *Sponsor perks as well. 

Company Perks:

Sponsor: Any donation over $250 will automatically become known as a sponsor. If you are with a company making a donation of $250 or more, please include your company information (including contact email) in order to create advertisement for fight gear. All sponsors will be advertised on fight shirts that will be sold at fights. (Shirts will be sold after we have earned enough from sponsorships to print shirts.)

story:
Hello, my name is Freddie Ward and i am looking for funding for my graduation film A Place For Us. The film is a seven minute short film. Set in two worlds, a near future real world and a virtual world. Virtual reality has become so advanced and immersive that it can replicate every human sense in incredible likeness. the virtual reality device can transport its users into their vision of utopia. The film has two characters Noah, a disillusioned dreamer and his partner Evelyn a hardworking and conformative woman. As Noah's obsession with visiting the virtual world grows it puts stress on their relationship which leads to Noah giving Evelyn an ultimatum.

So in terms of funding, as i mentioned in the film the bare minimum budget of the film is just under £1000 which is covering actors, location hire, transport, costume and props. the most crucial of these is the actors and your donations would primarily go towards hiring professional actors.
If i surpass my goal of £1000 i would invest the money into hiring a Sony fs700 for one days shooting for a dream sequence which would benefit from the slow motion capabilities of the fs700. And i would purchase some LED outdoor lights that are far more practical than traditional lights for outdoor shooting.
I would love to involve others in this project, forming a community that you, as a donator feel a part of to create a product that everyone involved in can be proud of. I already have assembled a team of talented crew members who are working with me as a favour so i can put all the money i can into the film. Even if i don't reach my goal i will still be making this film, putting in as much of my student loan as i possibly can.
The film will be shot in early february and will be completed by June 2016, shortly after this it will be published online.
Thank you for checking out my page and reading about the film. Your support and interest is hugely appreciated by myself and the team and if you would like to donate to the project that would be incredible. 

Freddie Ward, Director

story:
It's truly a pleasure to have your support with this campaign, you have no idea what it means to me and the cast to have you pledge whatever has been placed upon your hearts. 

My name is David Rivers, and I'm a film maker. I've been working in film & TV for over 7 years. I received my start after earning a scholarship in acting at one of the top 25 art schools in America ranked by the Hollywood reporter Savannah College Of Art and Design. After my first year I changed my major over to Film & TV. 

As a film major, I've written, produced and directed many short films and wrote two feature screenplays. Not only have I been gifted to write and direct films, I've also written and directed many stage plays as well. After college I worked as the production manager at a local TV station where I created and produced its first original drama called Executives. Executives aired throughout coastal GA & SC with an additional airing in Atlanta GA on People TV, the show is still in production. 

Currently I'm passionate about creating powerful movies that will leave an everlasting impact on every viewer. My goal is to tell realistic stories that meet the viewer right where they are, and find an answer to their dilemmas. Above all, my top priority is to lead every viewer to Christ, and that's what my prayer is for the movie, The Answer.

This campaign isn't just any other campaign, we have you in mind, as well as every potential viewer. My overall goal with "The Answer" is to point someone to Christ through dramatic arts.   It's no secret that our world is suffering horribly from various types of crime like black on black crime, community violence, broken justice systems etc... leaving us asking what's the answer to these problems? Yes, the true and quick answer is Jesus, but truthfully many aren't coming to church, therefore they have to be reached through other medians. In order to do this, we desperately need your help! 

Although I may have the vision, you have to the power to make it happen. You're not giving to just any other movie or project, you're giving to a movement, a ministry, you're helping to fight against spiritual warfare that's killing our young men and women, a warfare that's fighting to keep our justice system failing America. Your giving is paramount and this project can't go forward without your support.

"The Answer" debuted on New Year’s Eve, as part of a church service. It was presented as part movie, part stage play. After the production, many came crying and weeping wanting a better life. That was only at one location.  Could you imagine what could happen if and when this movie reaches the world and the impact it would have on the nations? You would be responsible for sending this message across the world across the globe and your giving is the vehicle driving this powerful movie around the world.  You play a huge part in bringing this movie to life!

What We Need & What You Get

Anyone that's ever been on a movie set knows there are great demands.  There is a need for every position on the film crew to be in full operation if the movie is to reach its full potential. Below is a list of positions and departments your money will support

*CAMERA DEPT

*DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHER

*CAMERA OPERATOR

*FIRST ASSISTANT CAMERA OPERATOR

*SECOND ASSISTANT CAMERA OPERATOR

*PRODUCTION SOUND MIXER

*BOOM OPERATOR

*KEY GRIP

*BEST BOY GRIP

*DOLLY GRIP

*ELECTRICAL DEPT.

*GAFFER

*BEST BOY ELECTRIC

*LIGHTING TECHNICIAN

*EDITORIAL

*FILM EDITOR

*COLOR GRADER

*VISUAL EFFECTS ARTIST

*POST SOUND/MUSIC

*SOUND DESIGNER

*SOUND EDITOR

*COMPOSER

*PRODUCTION

*PRODUCTION MANAGER

*MANAGER

*PRODUCTION COORDINATOR

*DIRECTOR

*ASST. DIRECTOR

*LOCATION MANGER

*PUBLICIST

*ART DEPARTMENT

*PRODUCTION DESIGNER

*ART DIRECTOR

*SET DESIGNER

*ASSISTANT ART DIRECTOR

*SET

*SET DECORATOR

*PROPS

*HAIR MAKEUP

*WARDROBE 

*COSTUME DESIGNER

*FOOD

*BUYING OR RENTING CAMERA AND FILM EQUIPMENT, WITH A 6 TO 8 WK SHOOTING SCHEDULE.

As you can see above it takes a real team to make a great movie. The production that aired on New Year's Eve, I personally, shot, edited, color corrected and worked.  The whole crew on that production myself, and many others still loved it, but I know it could've been a lot better because I wasn't able to give my all to certain positions due to being pulled in many directions. 

You may be asking is $10,000 really enough? "I mean how are you going to produce this film on a $10,000 budget?"  Yes I agree, there are a lot of positions and every single position is needed and very vital to a film success, with that said me and my team would have to look at the most valuable positions that this film can’t go without and hire those positions. Every positions is very important, and we are believing that we receive more than enough form you in order to employ each and every position, With that being said, worldwide films have been successful and produced on a $10,000 budget. 

 "David what happens if you don't meet your $10,000 goal?" Great question! One thing is for sure, We are filming "The Answer" and making it into a movie with or without reaching our goal, reaching our goal just assures us that we can make a better quality film and reach our maximum potential at that level. Every dollar that comes in will go toward the production value of "The Answer," this film will become a finished product, and I know that you as the giver will see to that because you are believing with me!! 

HEY YOU!! Please understand that you're not leaving out empty handed! There are different levels of pledges, and certain levels carry some wonderful perks for giving to the production of this movie! Check out the PERKS page!!! 

The Impact

The reason I'm so passionate about this project is because I'm passionate about people and souls. In the current city that I'm living in, shootings and murders are at an all-time high, and it's so grieving to the community.  I formerly worked in the Juvenile Justice system as well as worked in the public school system and it's a cry for help with many of the youth today. Many of them are misdirected by many different influences.  What this movie will do is give an answer and show there's a better way to live and spark a change of a life. 

 Why is this campaign valuable to you? Because you are helping to push an answer into the future generation by helping to spread the gospel through dramatic arts and touch someone's life across the world. This film has the potential to change lives, and you have the potential to send it across the world.  

I've been filming and ministering for years through film and stage, and I've completed many film projects, as well as, seen many people give their lives to Christ from projects I was wrote and directed. This isn't new to me, I'm not a rookie, I'm ready with a wonderful team to see this project go worldwide, but only with your help! 

Risks & Challenges

In any endeavor there are risks and challenges and in order to be successful.  In order to overcome them, you have to prepare, prepare and then prepare some more. There are many risks that happen in film making. Going over budget, not having a big enough budget, actors are crew getting sick, etc... there are too many risks and challenges that can happen to list them, like earlier stated, you have to prepare not only for the work, but you have to prepare for challenges and risks before you ever walk on set. 

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE PLEASE SHARE THE LINK OVER AND OVER AND OVER!!! THIS IS A PROJECT SET TO TOUCH THE WORLD BUT IT CAN ONLY TOUCH THE WORLD WITH YOUR HELP!! 

MAKE SOME NOISE ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN, TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW ABOUT IT! THEY CAN GIVE $1 OR $100,000 WHATEVER AMOUNT …SHARE IT AND TELL THE WORLD THERE'S A GREAT MOVIE COMING AND IT NEEDS YOUR HELP!

*COMPOSER
*PRODUCTION
*PRODUCTION MANAGER
*MANAGER
*PRODUCTION COORDINATOR
*DIRECTOR
*ASST. DIRECTOR
*LOCATION MANGER
*PUBLICIST
*ART DEPARTMENT
*PRODUCTION DESIGNER
*ART DIRECTOR
*SET DESIGNER
*ASSISTANT ART DIRECTOR
*SET
*SET DECORATOR
*PROPS
*HAIR MAKEUP
*WARDROBE 
*COSTUME DESIGNER
*FOOD
*BUYING OR RENTING CAMERA AND FILM EQUIPMENT, WITH A 6 TO 8 WK SHOOTING SCHEDULE.
As you can see above it takes a real team to make a great movie. The production that aired on New Year's Eve, I personally, shot, edited, color corrected and worked.  The whole crew on that production myself, and many others still loved it, but I know it could've been a lot better because I wasn't able to give my all to certain positions due to being pulled in many directions. 
You may be asking is $10,000 really enough? "I mean how are you going to produce this film on a $10,000 budget?"  Yes I agree, there are a lot of positions and every single position is needed and very vital to a film success, with that said me and my team would have to look at the most valuable positions that this film can’t go without and hire those positions. Every positions is very important, and we are believing that we receive more than enough form you in order to employ each and every position, With that being said, worldwide films have been successful and produced on a $10,000 budget. 
 "David what happens if you don't meet your $10,000 goal?" Great question! One thing is for sure, We are filming "The Answer" and making it into a movie with or without reaching our goal, reaching our goal just assures us that we can make a better quality film and reach our maximum potential at that level. Every dollar that comes in will go toward the production value of "The Answer," this film will become a finished product, and I know that you as the giver will see to that because you are believing with me!! 
HEY YOU!! Please understand that you're not leaving out empty handed! There are different levels of pledges, and certain levels carry some wonderful perks for giving to the production of this movie! Check out the PERKS page!!! 
The Impact
The reason I'm so passionate about this project is because I'm passionate about people and souls. In the current city that I'm living in, shootings and murders are at an all-time high, and it's so grieving to the community.  I formerly worked in the Juvenile Justice system as well as worked in the public school system and it's a cry for help with many of the youth today. Many of them are misdirected by many different influences.  What this movie will do is give an answer and show there's a better way to live and spark a change of a life. 
 Why is this campaign valuable to you? Because you are helping to push an answer into the future generation by helping to spread the gospel through dramatic arts and touch someone's life across the world. This film has the potential to change lives, and you have the potential to send it across the world.  
I've been filming and ministering for years through film and stage, and I've completed many film projects, as well as, seen many people give their lives to Christ from projects I was wrote and directed. This isn't new to me, I'm not a rookie, I'm ready with a wonderful team to see this project go worldwide, but only with your help! 
Risks & Challenges
In any endeavor there are risks and challenges and in order to be successful.  In order to overcome them, you have to prepare, prepare and then prepare some more. There are many risks that happen in film making. Going over budget, not having a big enough budget, actors are crew getting sick, etc... there are too many risks and challenges that can happen to list them, like earlier stated, you have to prepare not only for the work, but you have to prepare for challenges and risks before you ever walk on set. 
Other Ways You Can Help
PLEASE PLEASE SHARE THE LINK OVER AND OVER AND OVER!!! THIS IS A PROJECT SET TO TOUCH THE WORLD BUT IT CAN ONLY TOUCH THE WORLD WITH YOUR HELP!! 
MAKE SOME NOISE ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN, TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW ABOUT IT! THEY CAN GIVE $1 OR $100,000 WHATEVER AMOUNT …SHARE IT AND TELL THE WORLD THERE'S A GREAT MOVIE COMING AND IT NEEDS YOUR HELP!

story:
The Plot

Annabelle Johnson's peaceful day at the library is ruined when a man walks in with a gun.  Now suffering from PTSD and unable to function in the real world, Annabelle signs up for a new age virtual reality experiment meant to "cure" anxiety.  However, the simulation isn't what Annabelle expected, and she quickly finds herself trapped inside of it with no way out.  With only Caden (another participant) to help her, will Annabelle manage to find a way to exit the experiment?  Or will her anxiety get the better of her, keeping her trapped there forever?

The Who

We are a group of indie filmmakers from Boston and eastern North Carolina.  Melissa Bennett, our director, has been working in leadership roles since her high school days and has been teaching filmmaking since 2011.  Both our producer, Alison Rose, and our director of photography, Andrew Fewsmith, have won awards for their productions in the past.  And our production designer, Lizzie Lovett, has done both costume and set design work for numerous theatre productions in the Wilmington area for the past three years.

The When & Where

Principal photography for "Butterflies" will take place in March down in Eastern North Carolina.

The Why

"Butterflies" is a film our director, Melissa Bennett, has been developing for over a year after going through a particularly awful series of panic attacks.  Born and raised in eastern North Carolina, Melissa left her teaching job to pursue her MFA in Film at Boston University.  "Butterflies" is both her thesis film and a journey.

Mental health is a topic that's often talked about but rarely understood.  For people dealing with mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, etc., reaching out to people who don't understand can be difficult, as there's no common experience base to pull from.

This project stemmed from our director's own personal struggle with anxiety and depression.  In an effort to deal with a particularly bad string of panic attacks and also explain to friends and family what anxiety could be like for a person, she wrote the first draft of "Butterflies".  The nightmarish struggle Annabelle goes through during the course of the film can be likened to what someone might feel during a panic attack.

This film doesn't offer a magical answer to dealing with a problem like anxiety.  That's the irony in Annabelle's search - there IS no magic answer.  However, our hope is that this film will open a dialogue between people who suffer from mental health issues and people who don't.  These issues are more prevalent than you might think, and they're often hard to talk about.  But it's important for us to talk about them, and that's why we care so deeply about this film.


The What

Your contributions will go towards a number of our production costs:

  • Paying for use of the locations (40%)
  • Housing, feeding, and transporting our cast and crew (25%)
  • Special rental equipment - such as big lights, generator, etc. (20%)
  • Production design - including costumes and special effects makeup (10%)
  • Safety - mats for falls, stunt coordinator for safe stunt work, special gloves for grip/electric crew, etc. (5%)

The How

While we do face a number of challenges in the creation of "Butterflies" - from night shoots to stunt work to limited time at some of the locations - we've assembled an incredibly talented and dedicated crew from both Boston and Eastern NC.  All of our crew comes with several productions under their belts, some of which have won awards.  

We've also hired a stunt coordinator to rehearse with our leads in order to ensure that all of the stunts are both safe and realistic.  

We know that we have our work cut out for us, but with a strong cast and crew behind this production, we're confident we can overcome all obstacles as they arise.


Can't Donate?  Here's How You Can Still Help!

It's okay if you can't contribute at this time, but there are still ways you can help us!

First off, please spread the word about our campaign!  We need to reach our campaign goal in order to bring our director's vision to life, and we can't do that without support.  So please, tell your friends, family, co-workers, and neighbors!  If you or someone you know doesn't want to contribute through Indiegogo's online contribution system, please email us at butterfliesthefilm@gmail.com with the subject heading DONATION and someone will be in touch with you about other ways to contribute.

Second, if you live in or around the Wilmington/Eastern NC area, consider being an extra during our shoot on Thursday, March 10 at Jungle Rapids in Wilmington, NC.  We are unable to provide transportation to and from the location, but we will be providing lunch for all extras that day.  Again, please contact us at butterfliesthefilm@gmail.com with the subject heading EXTRAS if interested in being a part of this.


Thank you so much for your time and interest in "Butterflies"!  Please help us spread the word about our campaign!

story:
THE FILM - Kisilu : Before The Flood

Over the last four years Kisilu, a Kenyan farmer, has used his camera to document the life of his family, his village and the impact of climate change. Over the years he has documented floods, droughts, storms but also the more human impacts of climate change - kids are sent home from school when school fees can’t be paid; men are moving to towns in search for jobs; and family tensions rise.

“A mastery in the art of filmmaking” 
         - One World Media about a short version of this film

While Kisilu has been capturing his inner life with his camera, we in the rest of the film team have followed him and his family, observing from the outside.

Through seamless intercutting of footage from multiple ‘directors’ we are creating a different, raw and honest portrait of the life and fight of a Kenyan farming family. This documentary is a groundbreaking testimony that puts the human face of climate change on the agenda.

Due to climate change, global weather patterns are becoming increasingly unpredictable and this is hitting those that depend on farming as a livelihood hardest. Kisilu, his wife Christina and their nine children have been self-reliant and surviving off the land for generations, but now they are facing harder times due to more extreme weather conditions. 

Other community members are also in the same boat. One of the starkest signs is that most of the men in Kisilu’s community have left to find work in towns. Kisilu is now one of few men not to have given up on farming. 
"It's become a storm in my head: Are we to fight climate change or will the climate change fight us?" - Kisilu

This film will tell the inspiring story of a man who refuses to give up, who continues to drive long-term change in his community by bringing people together in the fight for day-to-day survival.

After seeing Kisilu's video diaries, Kisilu has been invited this December to speak at the UN Climate Change Conference in Paris where world leaders will negotiate the future of our planet. We are determined to film Kisilu’s journey and speech in Paris and include it in the feature documentary. And to do this we need supporters like you on board. 

"I’ve seen a lot of change in Kisilu. He came to discover that there is need for people to be together as one to fight.”
          - Christina, Kisilu's wife

BE A FILM PRODUCER, BE A DOCUMENTARY FAN  -
AND BE PART OF THE MOVIEMENT!

We've raised enough funding over the last 4 years to get us into the edit suite and to get a 60 minute short version of the film. However, to make the final feature version including Kisilu’s journey to Paris and to get proper music and sound design we need more support.

Up to now we’ve got support from Al Jazeera and One World Media in getting the film this far. We've also been working with the Norwegian environment and justice organisation Spire who have arranged loads of preview screenings and talks in the lead-up to the UN Climate Talks in Paris. The short film is already getting lots of traction and we need your help to reach an even bigger audience by finishing the feature version.

Our goal is for this film to be the starting point to a moviement for campaign organisations and lobbyists to influence, pester, advise those with the power to make the difficult decisions needed to address the cause and consequenses of climate change. This film will be one important way to put pressure on world leaders to bring about climate justice and sign up to a strong, just and legally binding deal to achieve zero emissions by 2050; ambitious pledges on adaptation meassures; and finance for the hardest affected by climate change.

"This film should be a wakeup call for all.”
- Jan Egeland, UN Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs, 2003-06. 

When the film is finished, we'd like it to first tour film festivals internationally, and then to have a life in cinemas and in the work of NGOs world-wide and later on television.

HOW WE INTEND TO USE THE FUNDS

We aim at making a powerful film! And with your support we will. We will use the funds to get us back in the edit suite to finish the cut of the feature film, to commission a composer and to sweet talk a top level sales agent. All to get this film to biggest audience possible.

And to do this we need your donation. 

WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN

To be part of this moviement for change, you can get a link to the film online on the day of the world premiere;  you can pre-order a dvd, you can even be a part of the producing team. 

SUPPORT US IN ANY WAY YOU CAN

If you can't spare the cash, it’s also helpful if you simply share this campaign across your social networks. Just reaching out to people you know who you think might be interested in this, will be of huge help to us.

You can help us by sharing the trailer and the news about the Indiegogo campaign on your Facebook or Twitter. #kisilumovie www.facebook.com/KisiluMovie


Thanks for joining us in this MOVIEMENT! 


www.kisilumovie.com #KisiluMovie

story:
MAN VS MONSTERS

Hi! My name is Jocelyn Marquis, and I am an independent producer-director (B.A. Film Production, Studio Art; Hunter College) and self taught app developer* currently living in Brooklyn, NY. My goal is to produce an original new TV series and distribute it via mobile app. I have close to 25 years of experience in film, TV and music video production in capacities ranging from Director of Photography to sound mixing to post production. (You can check out my short films on YouTube - @CharlieSez007!) 

Over my many years of working in this industry, I have seen producers (including myself,) work very hard and invest a lot of their time and money into projects that they were ultimately unable to get distribution for or monetize at any level. There are a lot of reasons any project succeeds or fails, but a large part of it points to the fact that the current indie film/TV business model is unsustainable. I want to address this with an innovative strategy that will allow my production company to offer our show direct to consumers on the platforms primarily being used by contemporary audiences - i.e. mobile devices, on demand. This custom UI (user interface, for the noobs,) enables us to create a dynamic, interactive environment in which the audience can watch and engage directly with the program through vote in features, a chat room, video games based on our concepts, (just to name a few,) in a cohesive, digital environment. The future is here, and I want to play a part in building it.

The goal for the app 1.0 release is to get the show out there to as many people as possible and demonstrate to a sponsor or investor that this production has the following it needs to be successful, while also promoting this as a viable distribution model, since it's still pretty novel, at least for an independent production company. The app needs to be really, really cool and speak to the level of quality that I want to bring to the entire series - and we are willing to put in the work and get it right.  

*props to stackoverflow.com + apptitude NOLA !!!

BABY STEPS.... Our 1.0 Release

So, technically we need $350K to do a pilot, get the app built (with all the juicy features), and of course since this is an independent project we have a pretty substantial allocation for marketing in the start up budget as well. But, as they say, baby steps. I dug deep to think of what I could do with what I have, and asked myself what can I offer our fans and audience now to get more people interested in the show?  

Over the Summer I began collaborating with my friend John Coulter, a very talented artist and illustrator, on what was originally intended to be a modest app 1.0 project to market and promote the show. Then my overactive imagination took over (curses!) and our modest project became a full fledged interactive environment encompassing all 9 season one episodes - which required the creation of close to 70 independent storyboards, that John has to draw... by hand. 

Most of the art work has been completed (you can preview a sample of it on the video as well as our website and here in our gallery,) and we would like to offer it through this campaign in order to raise funds because I really want to offer payment to my friend for his amazing contribution to this very early phase of this project. We also have a modest budget for promotional expenses when we release the 1.0 app. The whole point is to engage our audience, so promotion and marketing is going to be integral to getting us to the next step. 

Although this is just the first baby step, it's the step that launches us into the world, which makes it the most awesome and exhilarating step of all! 

Join us on this INCREDIBLE ADVENTURE!!

There isn't much space out there for emerging new programming with unknown creative talent behind it in the world of commercial production. Which is why I'm going rogue and doing it this way. I cannot do this alone, though, we can't succeed without the help of friends like John, and the people who have been supportive, even if only with a kind word of encouragement. Producing and self distributing a whole new show is a BIG JOB, and starting a business is, as I have learned over the last few years trying to start the fire - a freaking emotional rollercoaster. But hitting the milestones is THE BIGGEST RUSH EVER and the incredible reward for all the hard work. Making it happen is what gets me out of bed in the morning. 

By joining the campaign, you become a part of my team. You become a part of the unwavering enthusiasm and drive I bring to this project because you are saying you believe this can work and you that you want to see it happen. I believe unconditionally that this will transform broadcasting history and be a game changer for independent producers everywhere. As a part of my team you are joining the incredible adventure we are taking, which in many regards will be no less than revolutionary. I value your commitment to what we are doing, and I want to share the rush. As a member of this campaign, you are the FIRST to get the updates when we hit the milestones: the app 1.0 release, the production of our pilot, the season preview for all nine season one episodes!!! You have access to these updates (and all the behind the scenes pics and video) while the website is under construction and before PR even hits the internets.  

How to SURVIVE THRIVE in Show Business

Creating the project is part of it, and we've got that covered - our app is almost done. In order to get past step one to step two is where things get tricky. We need a lot of people to download this app, and to make that happen, we need a lot of people to know it exists. My experience designing and selling apps as well as in film production has taught me that that creating a cool film/video project or a compelling interface only solves a small part of the problem. If you can't reach your intended audience, then there's really no point to writing the binary or making the show. Marketing is the other piece of the puzzle, the one most independent producers most readily overlook, and the main reason so few succeed.

How do you reach the audience? On the plus we're a horror themed show, with a pretty substantial, growing and global fanbase that's pretty easy to reach through the many dedicated resources that explicitly serve our genre. Knowing who and where your audience is solves A BIG PART of the problem. Our indiegogo campaign will hopefully help us generate some funds to help us promote it!    

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support the campaign and make a contribution, but are still down with this and want to help out, the biggest impact you can make would be to go to our app demo video on youtube, like it and post a comment saying that you are into it and that you look forward to the show! And join us on social media for updates. I would REALLY appreciate it! THANK YOU!

Over the Summer I began collaborating with my friend John Coulter, a very talented artist and illustrator, on what was originally intended to be a modest app 1.0 project to market and promote the show. Then my overactive imagination took over (curses!) and our modest project became a full fledged interactive environment encompassing all 9 season one episodes - which required the creation of close to 70 independent storyboards, that John has to draw... by hand. 
Most of the art work has been completed (you can preview a sample of it on the video as well as our website and here in our gallery,) and we would like to offer it through this campaign in order to raise funds because I really want to offer payment to my friend for his amazing contribution to this very early phase of this project. We also have a modest budget for promotional expenses when we release the 1.0 app. The whole point is to engage our audience, so promotion and marketing is going to be integral to getting us to the next step. 
Although this is just the first baby step, it's the step that launches us into the world, which makes it the most awesome and exhilarating step of all!    Join us on this INCREDIBLE ADVENTURE!!

There isn't much space out there for emerging new programming with unknown creative talent behind it in the world of commercial production. Which is why I'm going rogue and doing it this way. I cannot do this alone, though, we can't succeed without the help of friends like John, and the people who have been supportive, even if only with a kind word of encouragement. Producing and self distributing a whole new show is a BIG JOB, and starting a business is, as I have learned over the last few years trying to start the fire - a freaking emotional rollercoaster. But hitting the milestones is THE BIGGEST RUSH EVER and the incredible reward for all the hard work. Making it happen is what gets me out of bed in the morning. 
By joining the campaign, you become a part of my team. You become a part of the unwavering enthusiasm and drive I bring to this project because you are saying you believe this can work and you that you want to see it happen. I believe unconditionally that this will transform broadcasting history and be a game changer for independent producers everywhere. As a part of my team you are joining the incredible adventure we are taking, which in many regards will be no less than revolutionary. I value your commitment to what we are doing, and I want to share the rush. As a member of this campaign, you are the FIRST to get the updates when we hit the milestones: the app 1.0 release, the production of our pilot, the season preview for all nine season one episodes!!! You have access to these updates (and all the behind the scenes pics and video) while the website is under construction and before PR even hits the internets.  

    How to SURVIVE THRIVE in Show Business Creating the project is part of it, and we've got that covered - our app is almost done. In order to get past step one to step two is where things get tricky. We need a lot of people to download this app, and to make that happen, we need a lot of people to know it exists. My experience designing and selling apps as well as in film production has taught me that that creating a cool film/video project or a compelling interface only solves a small part of the problem. If you can't reach your intended audience, then there's really no point to writing the binary or making the show. Marketing is the other piece of the puzzle, the one most independent producers most readily overlook, and the main reason so few succeed.
How do you reach the audience? On the plus we're a horror themed show, with a pretty substantial, growing and global fanbase that's pretty easy to reach through the many dedicated resources that explicitly serve our genre. Knowing who and where your audience is solves A BIG PART of the problem. Our indiegogo campaign will hopefully help us generate some funds to help us promote it!       Other Ways You Can Help If you can't support the campaign and make a contribution, but are still down with this and want to help out, the biggest impact you can make would be to go to our app demo video on youtube, like it and post a comment saying that you are into it and that you look forward to the show! And join us on social media for updates. I would REALLY appreciate it! THANK YOU!

story:
THE MAN

You probably know Nikola Tesla as one of the 19th century's greatest inventors whose work essentially ushered in the modern technological age. 

Radar, radio, X rays, and alternating current are just a few of the technologies based on his groundbreaking ideas.

What you might not know is that Tesla's interests extended beyond pure physical science into far more dangerous and ancient areas of research.

THE LEGEND

Our short film will tell the secret story of young Nikola Tesla, the Victorian era's first high-tech ghost hunter. 

Using his arsenal of steampunk inspired electric weapons and gadgets, Nikola fights to protect his unsuspecting girlfriend, Helena, against demonic forces that have just wiped out her family and are hell-bent on killing her as well. 

In the end, though, the biggest surprise might be that Helena is not without dark secrets of her own...

CONCEPT ART


LOCATIONS

We will be using real historic locations in Nuremberg (Germany) and Prague (Czech Republic) to recreate an authentic mid-19th century look and feel.


WARDROBE

Costumes and props will be designed by Ami Goodheart, who has already done stellar work on our last short film, Phoenix 9.

Ami has been featured in CLIO award-winning advertising campaigns, museum exhibitions, film, television and high-end fashion magazines including L'Officiel, Elle, Vogue Italia, Dazed and Confused, Surface, Zink, Numéro and V Magazine.



VISUAL EFFECTS

All of our ghosts and demons will seamlessly blend into the world of the story, thanks to visual effects team at VFX Box, which has worked on such big blockbusters as Marvel's Avengers, Cloud Atlas, and many more.


THE TEAM

AMIR REICHART - DIRECTOR / PRODUCER

Born and raised in Cairo, Egypt, Amir studied directing and editing at the Stuttgart Media University in Germany. He made his first steps in the media business as an editor at the ARD (Germanys biggest public broadcaster) and then went on to freelance both as a director and an editor on commercial projects.

His first Sci-Fi - short "Phoenix 9" has been covered by many of the leading genre websites, including io9, Ain't It Cool, Nerdist, GeekTyrant, SlashFilm, and others.

PEER GOPFRICH - WRITER / PRODUCER

After studying entertainment law at the University of California, Berkeley, Peer moved to Los Angeles and worked as reader for several well-known production companies and is now striking out on his own as a screenwriter / producer.

Peer also wrote and produced Phoenix 9, which was his first collaboration with Amir and Hannes. 

HANNES HEIDENREICH - VFX SUPERVISOR / PRODUCER

Hannes began his career by founding the production company Region Five while studying Media- Technology at the University of Ilmenau. Since then, he has become an expert in the fields of compositing, visual effects and producing. Now, in addition to his commercial work, he is looking forward to branch out into feature films in collaboration with Amir and Peer.  


OUR VISION

The German genre film industry is currently in an identity crisis due to their lack of internationally relevant content. Across the country there are calls for new talent that could produce the kinds of genre films that international audiences connect with.

We want to heed that call by creating projects that combine their love of action and science fiction / mystery with the European tradition of grounded, character driven storytelling. Basically we want to create thrilling, action packed stories with characters the audience connects with and cares for. 


PERKS

Most of our perks are fairly straightforward - with the exception of Tesla's "Power Gauntlet". Here's a picture of the base-version, which will be modified by our prop designer to integrate a lightning / plasma gun. So what you see here is just the beginning...


HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

Spread the word. Let your friends know about us on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media platforms you're active on.

The internet might be a vast space, but every voice counts. And who knows... it might be yours that ends up pushing our campaign across the finish line.


WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?

Everybody on our team is investing a great amount of their own time and resources to make this film a reality. But given the scale and ambition of this project, it's impossible to do it all on our own. 

Your contributions will help us with renting locations and equipment, building props, providing catering services on set, and flying in our English-speaking cast.

In addition it will also help us cover the myriad of other incidental expenses that add up over the course of production and can easily run into the thousands as well.

Of course, $16,000 is just the bare minimum needed to make this film happen. Any additional dollar on top of that will go straight toward making it even better.


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Producing a film is a difficult task, no matter the size of the budget. The number of things that can go wrong during any stage of production is legion, and no amount of planning and preparation can entirely eliminate the very real risk of failure.

Having said that, we are confident that we'll meet those challenges because we can rely on an experienced team that has shown their exceptional resilience and resourcefulness many times before. Together with them, we will do everything in our power to turn this project into a success.

story:
Hello, we are Little Betty Films, a third year film and television production company at the university of Lincoln. We have a creative background in film and as our final year project we are making a short film.

Our short film 'January' follows the issues of loneliness and the search for companionship amongst older people. The film follows June, a retired widow that needs to be brought out of her shell after the loss of her husband. Ernest, a quirky old man seeks to take June on a date she won't forget, and change her perspective on her future.

Contributors towards this film will help immensely, not only from a stylistic point of view, as we can get a realistic look, but also being able to provide a comfortable and relaxed environment for the actors, as they are older. We hope to enter the film into festivals and so contributors money will help towards providing us with the opportunity to do so.

What We Need & What You Get

The minimum amount of money we are looking for for this project is £400. We aim for filming to take place within 5 days so we have done a break down for this.

This will go towards:

Petrol/train fair - £200. For actors and crew to drive to the locations for filming. If the actors do not drive we will need to pay for their train fair as we are not paying them directly.

Food for our actors - as we are not paying the actors for their time we will need to keep them fed and watered! -£30 -40 for the 5 days.

Clothes/costumes - £60 - we want to dress the actors, especially Ernest in quirky clothing as he is a quirky character. the film takes place over a few days so they will need to change outfits multiple times. We will shop for these at a charity shop to keep costs down.

Donation to the church - £20 - One of the scenes will be filmed in a church so we would like to give them a donation.

Other money will go towards the cost of buying DVD's for the end product so if contributors would like their name in the credits and a copy of the DVD we can afford to print them out individual copies.  

The Impact

We all know an older person that has lost their partner  or been widowed as they get older and so our film seeks to raise the issue of loneliness after the death of a loved one, and that it is ok to move on and find love again, no matter how old you are.

We are extremely passionate about making this film a success and raising these very real issues for people to help them understand and help an older person they may know find companionship again.

Risks & Challenges

As we are filming in January/February we face the risk of the weather being too bad for us to film in, if we get the funding we need this should not be a rpoblem as we will reschedule filming and adapt the script so that it still works. We will also take out the right equipment as we will be filming outdoors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to contribute towards the film it would be really appreciated if you could share our campaign and spread the word about our film. We hope to get as many people aware of this project as possible!

Many thanks,

Little Betty Films

story:
Short Summary

Peter Sidwell is the brains behind Simply Good Food TV, having worked as a chef and presenter on Britain’s Best Bakery. He knows how hard it is to make it in TV and what goes into creating great recipes on TV. Peter teamed up with Rob Steadman the resident geek to create this new app. Simply Good Food TV is the app for foodies. Since the app was launched in May 2015 we have gained over 13,000 users who on average visit the app at least once a week. This growth in continuing and we gain on average an additional 170 users a day. 

We are launching this funding campaign so that we can generate further income to develop the app and add it to TV's so it is available on the big screen as well as tablet and mobile. The Simply Good Food TV team are all passionate foodies who want to encourage more people to cook at home, with wonderful ingredients from our foodie friends (online farmers market) and offer a platform for new chefs to have a voice. 

There is so much talent out there, we are offering the food equivalent of Netflix. We are looking to create a minimum of 20% of the content on the app, giving the 20 plus chefs we have a place to show it and share it. Giving our audience great new content and inspiring them to get into their kitchens. 

See the app now CLICK HERE FOR APPLE  and CLICK HERE FOR ANDROID



What We Need & What You Get

We wanted to offer something fun for your investment.  Life is all about experiences and having fun along the way. So we have created the following: 

A DVD containing six exclusive episodes from Simply Good Food TV sent to your home.  £ 30.00 

A DVD containing six exclusive episodes from Simply Good Food TV sent to your home, with your name in the credits. £75.00 

A day as Executive producer. Spend the day behind the scenes you will get to direct one of the episodes with one of the Simply Good Food TV chefs. The day will include lunch a bag full of goodies including signed books from the Simply Good Food TV chefs, and the opportunity to chat cooking and pick up advice and tips. £800.00 

The Ultimate Dinner Party, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be part of this flagship programme. The series will see Chefs and foodies  go head to head cooking to win you over as they compete for dinner party chef. The added twist to this is that you as the guest  can bring a mystery ingredient that the chef/ foodie will have to try and include. The decision will be in the hands of the guest dinners, as to who wins the title. You are in for a great foodie experience for the day. You will be part of the show, get to see behind the scenes, and have the opportunity to chat to the chefs and foodies about your cooking questions. £250.00 

Foodie friends hamper this is a delicious hamper packed with our chefs top foodie finds and our foodie friends. £200.00 

The Impact 

We are looking for funding for the development of the app to make it more efficient, quicker and easier to add content to. We are also looking to make it TV ready, so like Netflix you can have it on any device in your house. We are building Simply Good Food TV as a trusted brand and a household name, this funding will enable us to create that through increased marketing and PR and the technical behind the scenes elements. 

Risks & Challenges 

We launched the app in May 2015 with a very small and limited budget, and since then we have achieved a great deal, we have over 13,000 active users we have 20 new chefs including Will Torrent and Mich Turner we have filmed 30 programmes and gained sponsorship from Renault and Filippo Berio. We can't wait to do so much more with a bigger budget. The app is so important to so many people with the foodies and chefs it gives them a platform to have a voice and been seen giving them the opportunity to earn a living doing what they love. It offers small producers the opportunity to chat to the consumers direct and for the big brands they can create great new content for their customers. All in all lots of happy foodies. We look forward to you being part of this foodie journey. 

www.simplygoodfood.tv

story:
SYNOPSIS

Under My Skin is a dark comedy/thriller/horror about Riley, your everyday friendly neighbourhood tattooist... whatever that is. He doesn't have the easiest life what with his snide Hellcat of a boss, his oddball colleagues, and his girlfriend's disapproving gangster family on his tail, not to mention his ex-girlfriend's iron man of a boyfriend (who frankly looks like he could eat a rhino) bullying him and preventing him from seeing his own son… Oh, and a gang of angry biker dwarfs terrorising him until they get answers, thrown into the mix; none of whom are any match for his controlling, possessive mother who's out to destroy any relationship Riley ever has, going to shocking extremes to keep her 'little boy' all to herself...

BACKGROUND

Shooting began on this feature film back in June 2014, funded out of the pocket of low-income single mum Suzi Gwen who saw a unique talent in filmmaker, director, cameraman and editor Yuppie Darkcircles whose ability to create and achieve full-length feature films with large casts, impressive locations and vehicles, effects, naturalistic acting and side-splitting comedy on a low budget, impressed her to the point of her asking him to bring to life her concept and script that had previously drawn interest from television production companies one of which pitched it to the BBC.  Having always only ever got to the 'almost on TV' stage on several occasions, Suzi decided to produce it herself and with few funds of her own, knew that Yuppie was the perfect filmmaker to bring it to life and add his ideas to what began as a quirky half-hour script and has now become a feature-length emotional rollercoaster with more twists and turns than a mile-long super noodle! What's different about this film is the characters don't conform to the stereotypes we always see in film. The lead character is black, he's part of the tattooing sub-culture, his friends and colleagues are of a wide variety of ethnicities, his best friend is gay and his girlfriend has restricted growth, as do the biker gang who look out for her!  The film also tackles issues such as racism, arranged marriage and domestic violence. 

Now, after over a year of hard work and dedication from Yuppie, Suzi (who struggles each month to put funding into the production) and a cast of over seventy actors who all put their time in voluntarily, including actor, international model and Euro Pop star David Schaefer aka David Deen and award-winning filmmaker, actor and writer Tom Cottle (known for Not Sophie's Choice), all we need is funding to finish the last four scenes and hire up to three screening rooms in cinemas to get this project put out there for you, the beautiful public, to come and see, as well as entering it into a few festivals. Our target is £6,000 but we only have two months to reach the target so please pledge and let us make our mark in the world of cinema!  

Any money we raise above the target will go to the RGA (Restricted Growth Association) a registered charity (No 261647) that provides information and support to people of restricted growth and their families. Here is an example of challenges that one of our cast members with restricted growth often has to face:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mEd95cuY7uw

As the film is close to completion there are no real potential obstacles remaining. All the key scenes have been shot, everything that has been shot up until now has been edited and all we need to do after shooting the final scenes is negotiate hiring out screening rooms in individual cinemas.

TEAM BIOGS

Director Yuppie Darkcircles has been directing films, interviews and music videos since 2004 with such labels, artists and actors as Sony, Def Jam artists, N-Dubz, So Solid Crew, Wiley, Eric Sermon, Adina Howard, Omar, Peven Everett, Ninja Man, Frankie Paul, Judith Jacob (actress from Eastenders & The Real McCoy), Sir John Bird (owner of the Big Issue magazine), Levi Roots (Dragon's Den) and Bluey Robinson (MTV). He has also trained and provided opportunities in film for up-coming actors since 2011 and runs Darkcircles Productions.

Producer Suzi Gwen has been performing and writing since childhood. As early as the age of 7, a story that she had written in class was selected by her teacher to be performed in front of the whole school as a play, in which she was also cast in one of the lead roles. At the age of 13 she began to write and perform her own short scripted and improvised plays and comedy sketches to audiences at her high school and at the age of 17 she studied Media at college to gain an insight into the production side of a performance. 
At 18 she successfully auditioned to join the HTV Drama Workshop (now The Workshop) in Cardiff. Here she continued to train in screen acting and gained television roles through their attached agency, Atsli Casting. 
After the birth of her son she went on to train as a stage actor and singer at C.H.A.P.R.A. in Cumbria, in 2002 and has since continued to play a variety of roles in film and theatre.  In 2010 her comedy writing was featured in the script of an episode of Genius with Dave Gorman in which she also featured.
Suzi also taught drama from 2004 to 2013 at various performing arts schools, including a branch of the Paul Nicholas (Just Good Friends, Eastenders) School of Acting where she was also the principal. At the various schools she also produced, directed and wrote several of their productions performed in professional theatres, as well as teaching drama workshops for Bangor University. Having moved to London in 2013 she has branched out into producing and writing her first film production which she hopes to continue to do.
story_txt: SYNOPSISUnder My Skin is a dark comedy/thriller/horror about Riley, your everyday friendly neighbourhood tattooist... whatever that is. He doesn't have the easiest life what with his snide Hellcat of a boss, his oddball colleagues, and his girlfriend's disapproving gangster family on his tail, not to mention his ex-girlfriend's iron man of a boyfriend (who frankly looks like he could eat a rhino) bullying him and preventing him from seeing his own son… Oh, and a gang of angry biker dwarfs terrorising him until they get answers, thrown into the mix; none of whom are any match for his controlling, possessive mother who's out to destroy any relationship Riley ever has, going to shocking extremes to keep her 'little boy' all to herself...BACKGROUNDShooting began on this feature film back in June 2014, funded out of the pocket of low-income single mum Suzi Gwen who saw a unique talent in filmmaker, director, cameraman and editor Yuppie Darkcircles whose ability to create and achieve full-length feature films with large casts, impressive locations and vehicles, effects, naturalistic acting and side-splitting comedy on a low budget, impressed her to the point of her asking him to bring to life her concept and script that had previously drawn interest from television production companies one of which pitched it to the BBC.  Having always only ever got to the 'almost on TV' stage on several occasions, Suzi decided to produce it herself and with few funds of her own, knew that Yuppie was the perfect filmmaker to bring it to life and add his ideas to what began as a quirky half-hour script and has now become a feature-length emotional rollercoaster with more twists and turns than a mile-long super noodle! What's different about this film is the characters don't conform to the stereotypes we always see in film. The lead character is black, he's part of the tattooing sub-culture, his friends and colleagues are of a wide variety of ethnicities, his best friend is gay and his girlfriend has restricted growth, as do the biker gang who look out for her!  The film also tackles issues such as racism, arranged marriage and domestic violence. Now, after over a year of hard work and dedication from Yuppie, Suzi (who struggles each month to put funding into the production) and a cast of over seventy actors who all put their time in voluntarily, including actor, international model and Euro Pop star David Schaefer aka David Deen and award-winning filmmaker, actor and writer Tom Cottle (known for Not Sophie's Choice), all we need is funding to finish the last four scenes and hire up to three screening rooms in cinemas to get this project put out there for you, the beautiful public, to come and see, as well as entering it into a few festivals. Our target is £6,000 but we only have two months to reach the target so please pledge and let us make our mark in the world of cinema!  Any money we raise above the target will go to the RGA (Restricted Growth Association) a registered charity (No 261647) that provides information and support to people of restricted growth and their families. Here is an example of challenges that one of our cast members with restricted growth often has to face:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mEd95cuY7uwAs the film is close to completion there are no real potential obstacles remaining. All the key scenes have been shot, everything that has been shot up until now has been edited and all we need to do after shooting the final scenes is negotiate hiring out screening rooms in individual cinemas.TEAM BIOGSDirector Yuppie Darkcircles has been directing films, interviews and music videos since 2004 with such labels, artists and actors as Sony, Def Jam artists, N-Dubz, So Solid Crew, Wiley, Eric Sermon, Adina Howard, Omar, Peven Everett, Ninja Man, Frankie Paul, Judith Jacob (actress from Eastenders & The Real McCoy), Sir John Bird (owner of the Big Issue magazine), Levi Roots (Dragon's Den) and Bluey Robinson (MTV). He has also trained and provided opportunities in film for up-coming actors since 2011 and runs Darkcircles Productions.Producer Suzi Gwen has been performing and writing since childhood. As early as the age of 7, a story that she had written in class was selected by her teacher to be performed in front of the whole school as a play, in which she was also cast in one of the lead roles. At the age of 13 she began to write and perform her own short scripted and improvised plays and comedy sketches to audiences at her high school and at the age of 17 she studied Media at college to gain an insight into the production side of a performance. At 18 she successfully auditioned to join the HTV Drama Workshop (now The Workshop) in Cardiff. Here she continued to train in screen acting and gained television roles through their attached agency, Atsli Casting. After the birth of her son she went on to train as a stage actor and singer at C.H.A.P.R.A. in Cumbria, in 2002 and has since continued to play a variety of roles in film and theatre.  In 2010 her comedy writing was featured in the script of an episode of Genius with Dave Gorman in which she also featured.Suzi also taught drama from 2004 to 2013 at various performing arts schools, including a branch of the Paul Nicholas (Just Good Friends, Eastenders) School of Acting where she was also the principal. At the various schools she also produced, directed and wrote several of their productions performed in professional theatres, as well as teaching drama workshops for Bangor University. Having moved to London in 2013 she has branched out into producing and writing her first film production which she hopes to continue to do.

story:
Salut. C’est peut-être plus compliqué à vous vendre qu’une coque de smartphone en forme de chat. Mais c’est certainement beaucoup plus important. 

En 2016, vous serez de plus en plus connectés. De plus en plus proches les un des autres. Plus les liens se créent et se croisent, plus la vitesse de l’information augmente. On court pour se déplacer, pour travailler, partager, tweeter, liker, lire, penser, parler, vivre,… 

N’oubliez-vous pas quelque chose d’essentiel ? La complexité de notre monde a besoin de plus de trois minutes trente pour être analysée. Il est venu l’heure de prendre le temps… de s’informer.  CRDI, reprenez goût à découvrir l'information.

Bref résumé

O.V.N.I. dans le monde audiovisuel, CRDI se positionne comme une chaîne généraliste d'information créée sur un code inédit, intégralement conçue selon les spécificités des nouveaux moyens de diffusion.

Forte de la diversité de sa grille de programmation, elle touchera un large panel d'un public de plus en plus intéressé par les outils spécifiques de l'ère numérique. Interactivité, réactivité, sont des éléments qui font entrer CRDI au coeur de vos familles.

Enfin, CRDI se démarque également du reste du paysage audiovisuel par son impressionnant taux de productions internes, offrant par la même occasion des programmes correspondants mieux au goût de notre public.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Notre média va se construire étape par étape, le but étant de pouvoir assurer une totale indépendance et autonomie à nos équipes sur une durée minimum de 2 ans.

Pour ce faire, notre plan financier s'appuie sur 6 objectifs.

1er palier de 10 000 euros : Kit d'interview contenant un micro rf et son récepteur, un micro fusil, une caméra HD panasonic (codec P2) et un trépied , pour permettre  à notre équipe de rédaction  de partir sur le terrain.

2ème palier de 25 000 euros : une workstation de montage, licence AVID et solution de cloud.

3ème palier de 50 000 euros: Première phase d'aménagement et équipement de nos bureaux de rédaction. Notre agence de presse débute réellement ses activités.

4ème palier de 210 000 euros: L'aménagement du studio radio et de sa régie, ainsi que nos sets d'extérieur. 

5ème palier de 405 000 euros: Financement pendant deux ans de l'ensemble des frais fixes de l'A.P.I. (formation, fonctionnement de l'équipe de rédaction, SABAM, frais de fonctionnement, etc.) - Les équipes rédactionnelles restent bénévoles.

6ème palier de 1 600 000 euros: Acquisition du studio TV en réalité virtuelle augmentée. Le projet est à 100% financé, et démarre dans sa globalité.

Outre ces participations, vous pouvez également participer au développement de notre e-média en bénéficiant de contreparties directes, et ce dès 150€.

L'impact

Notre objectif premier sera de restaurer la confiance des citoyens envers les médias tout en leur offrant la parole.

En Belgique francophone, 400 nouveaux diplômés sortent chaque année des écoles de journalisme pour environ 40 postes disponibles.

Alors que chaque année en Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles environ 360 nouveaux diplômés en journalisme (sur 400) se retrouvent dans l'incapacité de poursuivre leur parcours professionnel faute de débouchés. CRDI se veut être une alternative pouvant permettre un emploi ou tout du moins à l'accession au titre de journaliste professionnel.

Puis, développer des outils de formations et d'intégration aux médias et aux nouveaux médias. Travailler sur l'harmonisation des règles déontologiques propres à la profession journalistique au sein de différents types de média.

Risques et défis

Soyons honnêtes, les risques sont extrêmement limités. En effet, le plus grand danger en la matière serait que l'état d'avancement du financement du projet soit trop lent par rapport à la deadline décidée et/ou impartie par nos actuels partenaires et fournisseurs techniques.

D'autre part, nous devons faire face à la possibilité d'une perte d'énergie en interne pour ouvrir les portes verrouillées par des "dinosaures" de la profession journalistique craignant d'une manière injustifiée l'évolution des e-médias. 

Afin de palier au maximum à ces risques, nous pouvons d'ores et déjà compter sur l'équipe de CRDI qui a déjà fait un choix contractuel de bénévolat. Cette initiative permet au projet de bénéficier de 2 ans pour atteindre ses objectifs. Ce format original et inédit permet à CRDI en totale liberté et indépendance de répondre à l'attente du public. 

Il nous est important de souligner dès à présent l'adhésion au projet de partenaires majeurs du monde de l'audiovisuel et technique. 

La forme juridique de l 'ASBL permet également de limiter les risques financiers tout en offrant à l'ensemble des investisseurs des avantages fiscaux non-négligeables.

D'autres façons d'aider

Que votre investissement soit grand ou petit, financier ou non, nous comptons également sur vous pour rejoindre nos équipes de bénévoles et ainsi pouvoir révolutionner ensemble l'univers médiatique.

Envie d'en savoir plus ? Découvrez en un clin d’œil ce que l'on vous réserve !
