story:
Short Summary

(Political Satire) Rindie Liponcock - the Conservative Fox News Barbie running for Mayor of the small town of Baldings, Montana - wants to win, by any means necessary. As Election Day zeroes in, Rindie is joined on the campaign trail by Bobby, her PR intern, and Marcia, her loyal assistant. After spotting her openly gay Liberal opponent with his new fiancé on the front page of the local paper, Rindie hatches a scheme to bring her rival down through a heinous lie. Rindie's attempt to force her team to join her path of destruction will lead truths to be told, images to be shattered, and lives will change forever.

The Importance of RINDIE!

A little bit VEEP mixed with NETWORK, RINDIE! deals with themes of female bosses, mother figures, hidden desires and hidden lesbianism.  As a lesbian, the writing of Rindie has been extremely personal and therapeutic in articulating my own struggles with my role as a woman and my desire to be a powerful leader. Bobby, the perpetual boyscout, is able to articulate his feelings concisely to Rindie (which threatens her). Marcia, the openly queer woman, is able to articulate her truth by her actions (which also threatens Rindie). Rindie is unable to do both. She is stuck, her ideals based upon women like Nancy Reagan and Phyllis Schlafly - who she copies their images, but is not like them deep inside. As we all do, Rindie struggles in searching for her real self, and makes the wrong choice at each turn.

This project started out as an outlet for my good friend, who is also gay, to process our feelings about the pundits lining up to run our country in February 2016. Rindie was a monster conglomeration of Trump, Cruz, Bush, Fiorina: completely ridiculous in speech and demeanor, easy to laugh out. As the months progressed, Rindie became a real woman to us. She had characteristics, and her own warped set of goals. She was no longer a bad SNL sketch, but a complex protagonist we were allowed to not like.

Nowadays, Rindie's ridiculous words are no longer so ridiculous, but par the norm. We are filming November 4th - 6th, the weekend before Election Day! Now is the time to have Rindie shine. I'm excited to bring her smaller scaled story to life. With your help, that is a complete opportunity.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding breakdown:

  • Trying to raise $2000 to help cover our graphics, transportation, makeup artist and wardrobe, craft services, as well as pay for our DP, script supervisor and actors. We already have money backed to cover our complete goal of $4000 - through crowd raising, we are trying to meet the goal halfway. All money will go towards the artists who have donated their time and energy to Rindie!

PERKS, YOU SAY?!

As you see, we have logos for both Rindie and the town of Baldings! The town mascot is a balding eagle, as you can see :) We will have these logos on Gildan Unisex Heavy Cotton t-shirts for our extras to wear...and for our backers to snag! You'd be able to print choose which logo you would want - "RINDIE!" logo, "RINDIE LIPONCOCK 16" logo, "BALDINGS EAGLES Hockey" logo, or "BALDINGS EAGLES" logo. We will also have RINDIE PINS! and RINDIE STICKERS! with her "RINDIE!" logo. 

If we do not reach our goal, the money will just come out of my (Amelia Spitler's) own pocket. If we over exceed our goal, all the money goes to the project. That means more money can be used for my crew's breakfast and lunch, more money can be paid to my dedicated team and cast members, more money can be used on higher quality set dressings and merchandise. 

Risks & Challenges

I am a very dedicated young filmmaker who has spent the last nine months gestating Rindie. I'm so proud of the progress made so far, and I will continue until the movie is completely filmed, mixed, edited, and film festival ready. Filmmaking is my passion, and Rindie is a gift I'm so excited to show the world. Through all the challenges, I will push through with collaboration and guidance from my amazing team. I can not wait to bring Rindie Liponcock to you all. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, fret not! Just having eyes on this page and spreading the word of RINDIE! creates a big impact. 

  • Make some noise about RINDIE! by sharing your campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or through emails to friends!
  • Show your like-minded friends this thesis student's satire. Just in time for Election Day!
story_txt:
Short Summary
(Political Satire) Rindie Liponcock - the Conservative Fox News Barbie running for Mayor of the small town of Baldings, Montana - wants to win, by any means necessary. As Election Day zeroes in, Rindie is joined on the campaign trail by Bobby, her PR intern, and Marcia, her loyal assistant. After spotting her openly gay Liberal opponent with his new fiancé on the front page of the local paper, Rindie hatches a scheme to bring her rival down through a heinous lie. Rindie's attempt to force her team to join her path of destruction will lead truths to be told, images to be shattered, and lives will change forever.
The Importance of RINDIE!
A little bit VEEP mixed with NETWORK, RINDIE! deals with themes of female bosses, mother figures, hidden desires and hidden lesbianism.  As a lesbian, the writing of Rindie has been extremely personal and therapeutic in articulating my own struggles with my role as a woman and my desire to be a powerful leader. Bobby, the perpetual boyscout, is able to articulate his feelings concisely to Rindie (which threatens her). Marcia, the openly queer woman, is able to articulate her truth by her actions (which also threatens Rindie). Rindie is unable to do both. She is stuck, her ideals based upon women like Nancy Reagan and Phyllis Schlafly - who she copies their images, but is not like them deep inside. As we all do, Rindie struggles in searching for her real self, and makes the wrong choice at each turn.
This project started out as an outlet for my good friend, who is also gay, to process our feelings about the pundits lining up to run our country in February 2016. Rindie was a monster conglomeration of Trump, Cruz, Bush, Fiorina: completely ridiculous in speech and demeanor, easy to laugh out. As the months progressed, Rindie became a real woman to us. She had characteristics, and her own warped set of goals. She was no longer a bad SNL sketch, but a complex protagonist we were allowed to not like.
Nowadays, Rindie's ridiculous words are no longer so ridiculous, but par the norm. We are filming November 4th - 6th, the weekend before Election Day! Now is the time to have Rindie shine. I'm excited to bring her smaller scaled story to life. With your help, that is a complete opportunity.

What We Need & What You Get
Our funding breakdown:

Trying to raise $2000 to help cover our graphics, transportation, makeup artist and wardrobe, craft services, as well as pay for our DP, script supervisor and actors. We already have money backed to cover our complete goal of $4000 - through crowd raising, we are trying to meet the goal halfway. All money will go towards the artists who have donated their time and energy to Rindie!
PERKS, YOU SAY?!

As you see, we have logos for both Rindie and the town of Baldings! The town mascot is a balding eagle, as you can see :) We will have these logos on Gildan Unisex Heavy Cotton t-shirts for our extras to wear...and for our backers to snag! You'd be able to print choose which logo you would want - "RINDIE!" logo, "RINDIE LIPONCOCK 16" logo, "BALDINGS EAGLES Hockey" logo, or "BALDINGS EAGLES" logo. We will also have RINDIE PINS! and RINDIE STICKERS! with her "RINDIE!" logo. 
If we do not reach our goal, the money will just come out of my (Amelia Spitler's) own pocket. If we over exceed our goal, all the money goes to the project. That means more money can be used for my crew's breakfast and lunch, more money can be paid to my dedicated team and cast members, more money can be used on higher quality set dressings and merchandise. 
Risks & ChallengesI am a very dedicated young filmmaker who has spent the last nine months gestating Rindie. I'm so proud of the progress made so far, and I will continue until the movie is completely filmed, mixed, edited, and film festival ready. Filmmaking is my passion, and Rindie is a gift I'm so excited to show the world. Through all the challenges, I will push through with collaboration and guidance from my amazing team. I can not wait to bring Rindie Liponcock to you all. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to donate, fret not! Just having eyes on this page and spreading the word of RINDIE! creates a big impact. 

Make some noise about RINDIE! by sharing your campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or through emails to friends!
Show your like-minded friends this thesis student's satire. Just in time for Election Day!

story:
Malacostraca is a psychological horror film with creature puppetry that will be created by FX artist Gabe Bartalos. Gabe has worked on films such as THE TEXAS CHAINSAW MASSACRE PART 2, BRAIN DAMAGE, FRIDAY THE 13TH PART 6, LEPRECHAUN, GREMLINS 2, and Matthew Barney's CREMASTER CYCLE. 

                

                       -Gabe applying prosthetics to Matthew Barney-

Malacostraca is an exploration of the fragility of the human mind, the male ego, and of difficulties in communication. It will be a horrifically scary film full of universally relatable feelings and fears. It will have a tone of trapped dread and nature-based horror; think 'Possession' meets 'Picnic at Hanging Rock.'

Malacostraca will feature the talented actors Amber Bollinger and Charlie Pecoraro as a married couple going through extreme difficulties. The film is seen through the unreliable eyes of the husband who's losing his mind and ability to love... One day when, seemingly suddenly, his wife announces that she’s pregnant, his mind snaps... When the baby is born he doesn’t see it as being his, or even as being human. Instead he sees his baby as a hideous lobster-like creature...

    

Malacostraca will feature incredible practical creature puppets and special effects all supplied by Gabe Bartalos and his crew at Atlantic West Effects. 

FX LIST:

  1. External embryonic sac.
  2. Cable controlled translucent newborn creature puppet.
  3. Silicone torso duplicate of Amber.
  4. Small scale crawdad puppet for skin breakthrough.
  5. Larger cable controlled creature toddler puppet.
  6. Duplicate toddler puppet for stunt work.

  7. Silicone severed fingers.     

                      -Sketch of the Toddler creature by Charles Pieper-


 Gabe's company reel featuring exclusive interviews with Matthew Barney, Mark Seliger, Frank Henenlotter and more...        

                                            FX COST BREAKDOWN: 

Labor: $6,000, Mechanics, Materials: $5000, Shop/Rentals: $4,000.



Charlie Pecoraro has worked in Hollywood for over  11 years, acting in feature films, music videos, television shows, and on stage. He's also produced & starred in 'Circle The Wagen' an award-winning feature-length, "buddy/road-trip/docu-dramedy" on the vintage Volkswagen underground. His latest project is 'The Hollywood Shorties,' a feature-length, historical sports documentary on the untold story of a dwarf basketball team from the 70's & 80's.

Amber Marie Bollinger has appeared in over 35 national television commercials, a slew of short films, as well as several feature length films. In 2015 Amber received the highly coveted Best Actress award for her role in the award-winning sci-fi drama 'Listening' which is currently streaming on NETFLIX. Starpulse took notice and named her TOP 5 Female Performances of 2015 alongside Rosamund Pike. Amber attends Groundlings and has starred in numerous sketches, which led her to co-create one of the most absurd and adored cult comedy web series on the internet, 'Hollywood is Hard (for Kimmy Kim and Frutron).


WRITER/DIRECTOR - Charles Pieper 

Charles is a filmmaker living in Los Angeles. He's directed numerous short films including 'Last Remnants' which he successfully fundraised in 2012. He studied film at Emerson, FAMU, CalArts, and NCSA. His works have been seen in festivals in Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Toronto, Massachusetts, Poland, Madrid, Kiev, Tokyo, and more. 

SPECIAL EFFECTS - Gabe Bartalos 

Gabe has been working within the world of special effects for over 30 years. He's worked with such directors as Tobe Hooper, Frank Henenlotter, Stuart Gordon, Joe Dante, Sam Raimi, and Matthew Barney as well as the musicians Bjork, David Byrne and St. Vincent. He owns Atlantic West Effects.

CINEMATOGRAPHER - Ava Benjamin 

Ava is a cinematographer who has shot short films, music videos, documentaries, and the upcoming feature 'Baja Comedown.' She's worked for Bloomberg, Amazon, Rolling Stone, Vice, The New York Times, and Columbia Records and has received press from Wired, The Atlantic, Paste, Nylon, and FastCo Design. Her documentary short 'Playing With Power' was a Vimeo staff pick last year. More recently the short film 'Sisters' which she shot was featured at the 2016 Maryland Film Festival.  Ava 2016 cinematography reel.

PRODUCER - Kimberly Yan 

Kimmie has produced films including cult favorite 'The Devil's Carnival' and its sequel, 'The Devil's Carnival: Alleluia!' which features iconic pop culture stars such as Adam Pascal, Paul Sorvino, Dayton Callie, Barry Bostwick, Bill Moseley, David Hasselhoff, Tech N9ne, Danny Worsnop, Clown (Slipknot), and Lyndon Smith. Kimmie has also produced music videos and a feature film that is currently in post starring horror legend Lin Shaye. Currently Kimmie produces content on the Motor Trend On Demand network and has worked on "Hell's Kitchen" and "Revenge Body." Kimmie also works as a music supervisor, most recently for Scott Eastwood's 'Dawn Patrol' starring Eastwood and Rita Wilson.

PRODUCER - Travis Cultreri 

Travis has worked in all aspects of the film industry. He has experience with art department, coordinating, production supervising, producing, 1st AD, and assistant editing. Travis produced music videos for Disney Entertainment Group, Cuts Deep Entertainment, Anthem Films, as well as the film The Devil’s Carnival: Alleluia! Recently Travis was the post production coordinator on 'Secret in Their Eyes,' and 'Fifty Shades of Black.' He is currently the post production coordinator on NBC's upcoming 'Emerald City' from visionary director Tarsem Singh. He also helps run a boutique guitar company called Destroy All Guitars.

COSTUME DESIGNER - Amanda Lee 

Amanda is an LA-based costume designer for performance, film and everything in between. Her screen works 'Bread and Butter' and 'Excess Flesh' were recently screened at the Woodstock Film Festival and SXSW. Her stage works include Trisha Brown’s 'Set/Reset & Reset,' Theatre Movement Bazaar’s 'Hot Cat,' and “Four Larks’ 'Orpheus' at the Getty Villa." She holds an MFA from CalArts and is currently filming 'Delinquents' starring VEEP’s Timothy Simons. *IMDB*

PRODUCTION DESIGNER - Melisa Dougherty 

Melisa is a Los Angeles-based artist and Production Designer. She works within installations, projections, sculptures, graphic design, performance art, literary endeavors, and more. She works often within Aporkalypse Productions where she is the in-house production designer as well as head of branding. *IMDB*

_______________________________________________________________________

           WHAT CAN YOU GET FOR YOUR GLORIOUS SUPPORT?

You can get all sorts of wild and crazy and amazing things for your support of our film! You can get posters, prints, books, scripts, pendants, monster sculptures, original art, a limited edition Creepy Co pin and more! The ratio of 'bang' to 'buck' in this fundraiser is stupendous! So do check out the donor tiers to the right and give whatever you may be able to. Every contribution, no matter how big or small, will help bring Malacostraca to life!

              

Here is the design for the Creepy Co. enamel pin! It's a limited edition of 300 so donate to get yours today!

In the  $225 'Aquatint Powers Activate' donor level you can get 1 of 5 limited edition hand signed 6'' x 6'' etching/sugarlift aquatint prints of 'Checkers with Death' by artist Brian Kelley! 

                 

Also newly added is amazing concept art drawn by 'Sherlock' and 'Doctor Who' storyboard artist James Iles! You can get prints of his art or the original hand drawn works!

And here is a video made for a donor in the 'Poet Laureate Power' level, for an example of what you can recieve:

  

       

                                                         THANK YOU!

story:
"Gentle Mother, Font of Mercy..."

In the heat of battle, with wildfire raging, men dying, and the world seemingly collapsing around them, Sansa Stark and Sandor Clegane come together in what will become the defining moment of their relationship and shape each other's spiritual and emotional journeys ever afterward...

In his A Song of Ice & Fire book series, George R.R. Martin created two incredibly rich (though divisive) characters and brought them together for one of the unlikeliest of relationships -- the gentle, naive, beautiful Sansa Stark, and the angry, disillusioned, disfigured Sandor "The Hound" Clegane. Although both characters appear in HBO's "Game of Thrones" (based on ASOIAF), much of their dynamic was omitted, and their intense encounter during the Battle of Blackwater was watered down considerably. Well, Kate and Squid are here to remedy that!

Avid fans of ASOIAF, Sansa, Sandor, and "SanSan" (as the pairing is referred to in fandom), Kate and Squid have decided to adapt a book-accurate version of this scene to film, using a Shakespearean verse written by blogger Nina Friel in place of Martin's dialogue.

(NOTE: We will actually be doing the original dialogue written by GRRM after all -- see the UPDATES section for more info!)

We've been a part of the ASOIAF fandom for a few years now, and we have had the pleasure of making many great friends in the SanSan community, including each other! Our common backgrounds in writing and filmmaking, mixed with our love of Sandor and Sansa, has led to one inevitable conclusion -- "Bird Song"!

This project isn't just for us, though; it's for our fandom friends, it's for George R.R. Martin, and, above all, these fascinating characters themselves.

Why Us?

Well, why not? In addition to being relatively high-profile members of the online SanSan community -- Kate known for her analytical essays and memes, and Squid's fantastic fanfiction always keeping people on the edges of their seats -- both Kate (director, co-producer) and Squid (co-producer) are experienced filmmakers, having each written, directed, and produced successful (and award-winning) short films and features in the past. We both know how to churn out quality content with limited time and budget.

We're not only confident in our own abilities but in each other, and we have a terrific team to support us and our vision!

Meet The Cast!

Before moving forward, we felt it was paramount to lock down our Sandor and Sansa first and foremost! We have done just that with two amazing individuals to embody our Hound and his Little Bird!

Serena Laurel (Sansa)

Serena is a young actress and musician who is up-and-coming in young Hollywood! Having already worked with Kate in the past, Serena is perfect for this role because... well... she is Sansa! Sweet, polite, beautiful, strong, smart -- all the the ingredients that make the character stand out in the often cruel and unforgiving world of Westeros.

"Like" Serena on Facebook and follow her on Instagram!

David Baxter (Sandor)

You may already recognize David from the convention scene and several other "GoT" fan videos. David's Hound cosplay is pretty much legendary at this point; if you've been to a Con, you've probably seen him -- probably because it's impossible to miss him! (He's really tall, is what we're saying...) We're so excited to have him on board this project, as he is basically the definitive Sandor Clegane after Rory McCann!

Follow David on Instagram!

What We Need & What You Get

This project is going to be rad no matter what, but just HOW rad depends on you, the investor!

Our goal of $8,000 seems perhaps lofty, but with that money, we can afford the following:

  • A cool location
  • Hair and prosthetic upgrades for our Sandor
  • A beautiful dress for our Sansa
  • To pay our cast and crew!

Good news is, if we don't reach our goal, we still have options. But we want this to be as great as it possibly can be, and we can't do that without your generous help!

And we're fully prepared to make it worth your while too. In addition to being able to finally see a book-accurate version of the BoBW scene with your own eyes, we are offering a plethora of cool, fun perks, including DVDs, artwork, exclusive bonus footage, and more (outlined in our Perks section).

PLEASE NOTE that donors will be the FIRST ones to get to see the finished project before it's posted online!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if there are some folks who can't make any monetary contributions. But you can still be involved in other ways!

  • COSTUMES: Like I said, we do a need a dress for our Sansa (that can get fake blood on it if necessary), and any cheap/free options are welcome!
  • PROPS: This is, thankfully, not a very prop-heavy scene, but we do need (a) a medieval-looking wineskin, and (b) a medieval-looking dagger with sheath.
  • HAIR/MAKE-UP: Anyone out there with wig-working skills, or experience working with prosthetic make-up? Let us know!
  • LOCATION: We're in the L.A. area, so get at us if you have any leads on a cool, flexible, affordable location (i.e.: a sizeable bedroom with a nice big window which could pass for medieval maiden's chambers).
  • TELL YOUR FRIENDS: Spread the word! Reblog, repost, retweet, etc., on all your various social networking sites!

We're so excited to bring this to life, and hope you are too.

David's Hound cosplay is pretty much legendary at this point; if you've been to a Con, you've probably seen him -- probably because it's impossible to miss him! (He's really tall, is what we're saying...) We're so excited to have him on board this project, as he is basically the definitive Sandor Clegane after Rory McCann! Follow David on Instagram!
  What We Need & What You Get This project is going to be rad no matter what, but just HOW rad depends on you, the investor!
Our goal of $8,000 seems perhaps lofty, but with that money, we can afford the following:  A cool location
Hair and prosthetic upgrades for our Sandor
A beautiful dress for our Sansa
To pay our cast and crew!

Good news is, if we don't reach our goal, we still have options. But we want this to be as great as it possibly can be, and we can't do that without your generous help!
And we're fully prepared to make it worth your while too. In addition to being able to finally see a book-accurate version of the BoBW scene with your own eyes, we are offering a plethora of cool, fun perks, including DVDs, artwork, exclusive bonus footage, and more (outlined in our Perks section). 
PLEASE NOTE that donors will be the FIRST ones to get to see the finished project before it's posted online!
  Other Ways You Can Help We understand if there are some folks who can't make any monetary contributions. But you can still be involved in other ways!  
COSTUMES: Like I said, we do a need a dress for our Sansa (that can get fake blood on it if necessary), and any cheap/free options are welcome!

PROPS: This is, thankfully, not a very prop-heavy scene, but we do need (a) a medieval-looking wineskin, and (b) a medieval-looking dagger with sheath.

HAIR/MAKE-UP: Anyone out there with wig-working skills, or experience working with prosthetic make-up? Let us know!

LOCATION: We're in the L.A. area, so get at us if you have any leads on a cool, flexible, affordable location (i.e.: a sizeable bedroom with a nice big window which could pass for medieval maiden's chambers).
 
TELL YOUR FRIENDS: Spread the word! Reblog, repost, retweet, etc., on all your various social networking sites!
   We're so excited to bring this to life, and hope you are too.

story:
THE PIECE
We will devise a piece of bold theatre that raises questions and sparks debate around the causes and consequences of human trafficking. Reflecting the challenging theme, the team will break traditional theatre conventions, using movement, narrative and sound to examine the truth about trafficking and challenging public perceptions. We also have key workers involved in the anti trafficking organisations on hand as research consultants to ensure authenticity and sensitivity. The piece will be intimate yet courageous, sensitive yet exposing. Through work with community groups we will provide a platform for debate, delving into the depths of this underworld and asking what would the universe look like if we took away the veil that is covering the stark reality.

WHY?

Human trafficking is the fastest growing international crime and is now the second largest illegal trade in the world. In the UK, you are never further than a mile away from someone who has been trafficked. The Human Movement will investigate what it means to be trafficked, explore why it exists and ask who is responsible?

West Yorkshire Police is among the forces which refers the most suspected trafficking cases to the Home Office or National Crime Agency. Between April and June 2015, the most recent period covered by statistics, it provided 17 of the 126 referrals from across the police service. And between October 2014 and October 2015, the number of intelligence reports about suspected trafficking or modern slavery created by the force had risen by 158 per cent to a total of more than 600 over 12 months.


THE PLAN
This week we will begin a three week Research and Development period at theatre Delicatessen in Sheffield.  We will develop the piece through thorough research methods and interviews with key workers in anti trafficking organisations, then using a range of devising methods we will create The Human Movement. We will be holding workshops with victims of trafficking and key workers in the field to help inform the piece as well as to help us understand the intricacies of human trafficking and what victims go through to help us create an authentic theatre experience. We hope these workshops will empower those affected by trafficking and develop some key skills they need to recover.We will be holding a sharing of the piece on 15th September at Theatre Delicatessen and on 16th September at Bradford Playhouse.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP
 Your contributions will be instrumental in helping us develop this important piece of work.

The total cost of this initial stage is £22, 869. We have been successful in receiving Grants For the Arts funding from Arts Council England of £9,000 and  have raised £3500 cash for the project, including personal investment. the support we are receiving in kind from arts organisations and businesses is £10,000, which represents a huge commitment from venues to develop this important piece of new work. The rest has to be raised by us and with your support we can do this!!

What will your pledge be spent on?

Running our workshops with those affected by trafficking and the key workers in anti trafficking organisations.
    It is important that artists are paid properly for their work. You contribution will go towards the costs of paying artists, creatives and production team in line with Equity/TMA rates for the duration of the project.
    Costumes and props
    Costs of touring eg Van, petrol etc
    Costs involved with the research stages


    Marketing Costs
    Printing Costs (Scripts, programmes, flyers, posters)

What you get?
    We have a number of rewards as a thank you for pledging your support!
    You will be a recognised supporter of a crucial piece of work and of our company.
   Your donation will give you the satisfaction of knowing you have helped create a piece of theatre that raises awareness of human trafficking and gives the victims of trafficking a platform to be heard. One of the key problems with tackling trafficking is public awareness.


WHO WE ARE
Buglight Theatre are  committed to making accessible, high quality drama inspired by a range of genres, styles and techniques. At the heart of our work is an exploration of untold stories or well-known stories told in a unique and different way often with the human condition and what it means to be human in mind.

 We create work through a unique creative process of research, devising, improvisation and experimentation. We work very collaboratively at all stages of development. The process empowers performers to create the work, using the collaborative skills of writers and dramaturgs, rather than the more traditional method of working, the other way round, of performers facilitating writers and directors to reach the end product.

 Our  audiences are integral to our work and part of our creative process is to run workshops and engage with targeted groups to help inform our work and give our audiences a part in the creative process.
Keeley Lane – Co-Artistic Director
(Actor, Theatre & Television Producer & Co- Artistic Director of Buglight Theatre)
Keeley is a professional actress since 2009 and co-founded Buglight Theatre in 2014. Keeley has worked with companies such as Northern Lines, New End Beyond Productions and Raaw. She was producer for Nuts and Bolts (2013-14) and produces Script Yorkshire’s Page to Stage events.She also freelances as an Assistant Producer on documentaries such as Dispatches, (Forced Marriage) Panoramas (Paedophilia), Body Donors (CH5), and Homes By The Sea (Ch 4).


Richard Galloway – Co-Artistic Director
(Actor, Facilitator and Co-Artistic Director of Buglight Theatre)
Richard  trained as an actor at Bretton Hall and is an experienced workshop facilitator. He produced The Pillow Man with Hanrick Theatre Company and also has experience producing productions for Oscars Theatre Academy.  He has performed with companies such as Contexture Theatre, The Plays The Thing, Collingwood)


We are collaborating with Jen Nevin and Mike Auger.
Mike Auger – Deviser, performer and Sound Designer
Mike is a choreographer, musician and physical theatre practitioner who co-founded Displace Yourself in July 2013. He is trained in clowning, singing and movement studying at East 15 Acting School and The Grotovski Institute in Poland. Mike has worked with companies such as Told by an Idiot, Riding Lights and Bear Trap and has directed new writing at the Debut Festival. Mike is also Co-Artistic Director of Displace Yourself Theatre, who have created two acclaimed full length theatre works which seek to challenge societal injustice, ‘EDEN’ and ‘Free To Stay’ both supported by ARC Stockton and Theatre in the Mill. (www.displacetheatre.co.uk)

Jennifer Nevin – Deviser and Performer
Jennifer is a theatre maker and experienced workshop facilitator whose work is focussed on exploring social injustices. Jennifer’s skills include mask, clowning and improvisation. She has performed with The Award Winning Ken Campbell School of Night and has directed new writing at the New Wimbledon Studio and The Edinburgh Fringe Festival where one of her directed plays was nominated for an NSDF Award. Jennifer is also Co-Artistic Director of Displace Yourself Theatre.

Do take a look at our website to view our previous work:
www.buglight-theatre.com

FUNDING
Arts Council England

Supporting people and organisations
Theatre Delicatessan
Bradford Playhouse
Jessica Brewster

Previous project supporters
Square Chapel Centre For the Arts
CAST
The Civic
Slung Low
Derby Theatre
Javaad Alipoor
Rod Dixon
Armley Museum
Genesis/Basis

story:
The Foxy Five

The Foxy Five is a webseries that deals with issues of intersectional feminism and follows the lives of five womxn who are finding themselves in the young democracy that is South Africa, Cape Town.

The creator, writer and director Jabu Nadia Newman was particularly inspired during the #FeesMustFall protests and wanted to put all the new concepts and ideas that she was exposed to into a fictional webseries.

 

 

The Funds

Our IndieGoGo campaign is to raise money to shoot the next episode of the series. 

By contributing to The Foxy Five you are enabling an all female and predomantly black cast and crew and helping young actors, filmmakers, stylists and makeup artists the possibility to work on a project which they all stand behind while covering costs

The entire funding will go to all the cast members and crew for working for a full 4 days as well as covering costs of food, petrol, costumes and props.

The Impact

The Foxy Five is a series that deals with black womxn's issues and tries to produce profound and relatable stories which other young womxn can find solace and therapeutic humor in.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to help please share this campaign using different social media channels and help us get the word out there!

If you are a womxn in Cape Town that is either involved in the film industry, styling, wardrobe, makeup, set design, sound design, editing, or props department and would like to get involved please email us at thefoxyfivetv@gmail.com.

Crew and Cast

  • Creator - Jabu Nadia Newman​

  • Blaq Beauty - Tathenda WekwaTenzi

  • Unity Bond - Duduza Mchunu

  • Femme Fatal - Qondiswa James

  • Prolly Plebs - Qiniso Van Damme

  • Wxmen We - Nala Xaba

 

News/Press

(Click on the link to be redirected)

  • Mail & Guardian article
  • Okay Africa article 
  • Gal-Dem article
  • University of Cape Town article
  • On the Line interview
  • Ayiba Magazine interview
  • Good Hope FM interview
  • Channel 24 highlight 
  • Casmir Tv highlight 
  • Pap Culture collab

story:
SYNOPSIS

This documentary film, Purge is meant to illustrate dilemmas and conflicts of a developing world, which mirrors other similar social issues faced by countries in other parts of the world.  It exposes the struggles of a broken nation, working to rebuild its social fabric and chronicles the motion of the purge that rises like a tsunami, and in the midst of it – the casualties, the survivors, the debris.

 

STORY BACKGROUND

Rodrigo Duterte, a Filipino lawyer and mayor of Davao City, also known as “The Punisher” was sworn in as Philippines’ 16th president on June 30th 2016. In attempt to clean up the country's persistent crime problems that are usually drug induced, he announced a crackdown on drug lords and addicts, urging the population to turn them in or kill them.

A wave of horror swept across the nation when his mandate unleashed extr­­ajudicial killings and rampant murders; among casualties were many wrongly and gruesomely killed in the name of drug crimes. The act of culling has drawn diverse reactions from its citizens. Sentiments from all sectors of society are justifiable, thus making this a very complex social issue to undertake. Humanity is put to test, and moral compass are confronted and displaced.

 

DIRECTOR'S STATEMENT

When news of the Philippines drug war splashes across tv news and social media, my sympathy was immediately drawn towards the drug addicts who were murdered in gruesome fashion. Many innocent lives that are not involved in any drug crimes were taken when criminals ride on the purge to commit murders arising from personal feuds or robberies; with victims conveniently disposed in similar murder patterns as the drug offenders.

A lot of emotions stirred within me because of my deep involvement in drug rehabilitation community where I have witnessed many life transformations. I had many burning questions pertaining to the methodology undertaken. What is the difference between a murderer and a drug pusher? How possibly can you stamp down criminality by advocating one against another?

My life was clearly interrupted when a disturbing photo of a mummified murder victim kept revisiting my thoughts.

Delving deeper into the situation, I was brought to realization my understanding of the tragedy was sketched from a first world country perspective where in my country, systems are already in place and untangled from symptoms of an underprivileged society.

The drug raid split the nation's sentiments into two spectrums - one rallied behind the oppressive measure, seeing this as first step towards nation progress, the other inclining towards human rights and calling halt for the motion. My moral values pendulum back and forth these diverse and strong views.

Purge is meant to illustrate dilemmas and conflicts of a developing world, which mirrors other similar social issues faced by countries in other parts of the world.  It exposes the struggles of a broken nation, working to rebuild its social fabric and chronicles the motion of the purge that rises like a tsunami, and in the midst of it – the casualties, the survivors, the debris.

It contains moments of sadness, struggles and injustice for communities especially the poor who are targeted; and glimpse of liberation, hope and illumination for communities and families of victims plagued by crime threats on daily basis.

At the heart of this film is a perpetual questioning: Are political and economic complexities substantial grounds to provide leeway for human rights violation? How can we put human rights in its appropriate place when both casualties are victims and assailants of each other?

 

TEAM

Director - Kwan Adelene

Adelene is a Producer/ director based in Singapore with 12 years of media experience. She has undertaken a number of projects that include documentaries, corporate, and broadcast materials. She is also fluent in conceptualizing, craft, package and distribute content for various content platforms and spends most of her time experimenting mixed film genres.

Apart from the commercial works she has done, Adelene is actively involved in arts festivals, installations and producing short films. Three shorts films were nominated in the 7th Chicago International Film festival, 23rd Singapore International Film Festival 2010 and participated in SMU Film Festival and Singapore short cuts.

Her portfolio can be viewed on kwanadelene.wix.com/portfolio

 

Producer - Nikko May

Hero (2014) is the first short film Nikko produced, which won a silver medal at New York festival and was part of the official selection in Dragon Dreaming festival in 2015. These achievements have strongly encouraged and deepen her interest in making Producing her career. Her works have been screened on multiple public spaces, such as the National Museum of Singapore, Singapore Discovery Center and ASEAN-Japan center in Tokyo. Her latest project titled “I Believe”(2016) is set to be screened at the MAXXI Museum of XXI Century Arts MAXXI of Rome in December 2016 as part of AS Italian Film Festival. Nikko aims to push the boundaries of storytelling that is relatable to audience through the creative construction of the body of her work.

 

Producer - Gerald Fran

Gerald has over 13 years of production experience spanning tv, radio and print.

In Singapore, he handled TVCs, documentaries and corporate videos for clients such as Singtel, Pizza Hut, Samsung, Changi Airport, A* STAR, Rolls-Royce, Thomson Medical Centre, Seletar Aerospace Park, OSIM, Mount Faber, JTC, SBST, MAS, SGX, NUS to name a few.

In the Philippines, he wrote and produced documentaries on land reform, agriculture and solar power which were filmed in off-grid & war-torn communities; as well as TV spots featuring news & success stories on entrepreneurship, livelihood, infrastructure projects; and various corporate videos covering different industries.

Cinematographer - James Hia

[To be updated]

 

Cinematographer - Tay Yu Xian

Yu Xian is an award-winning filmmaker and media artist based in Singapore.

In 2013, he represented Singapore in "Chance of a lifetime", an international non-scripted TV series organized by Hollywood's Variety Magazine & The United Nations Organization (UN) and Hyde Park-Image Nation, hosted by internationally renowned film producer Ashok Amritraj (Ghost Rider, Premonition, Street Fighter). His film "Between X and Y" won the best film and was awarded a special mention by Hollywood's Variety Magazine during the 2013 Cannes Film Festival.

His involvement in feature film saw him work under the stewardship of renowned Australian director Kimble Rendall, 2nd Assistant Director of the Matrix Reloaded and Matrix Revolutions films. As a cinematographer, his short film "A Hole in the Bed" was nominated for Best Cinematography at 2009 Singapore Short Film Awards and featured in the 1st Experimental Film Forum. "Ice Cream Man" was selected for the 23rd Singapore International Film Festival and Chicago International Children Film Festival.

Recently, he wrote and directed "Housing Memories: Eclipse of a Hainan Tribe", a documentary film on the endangered Li tribe in China. The film was screened to an international audience in Hong Kong, Singapore, China and Japan, and premiered in key venues such as the Asian Civilization Museum and the Central Public Library, Singapore.

His portfolio can be viewed on www.tayyuxian.com

 

WHAT WE NEED

Our team has already contacted relevant personnel, and are granted exclusive access.  We are ready to go ahead for intensive research and filming. Currently, we are lacking of funds to run this project full fledge, hence we need your help!

Your Contribution will assist our team in

  • Research (journalist, survey)
  • Travel expenses
  • Accomodation
  • Equipment
  • Food & Land transport
  • Access
  • Granted Interviews (token of appreciation/ gifts of their effort and time)
  • Copyrighted materials (photos and footages)
  • Manpower cost (filming crew)
  • Post-production (Editing, sound post, music copyrights)

This project will be a long haul of about 8 months from research to project completion. It requires a lot of travelling to the Philippines, liaising and location recces in different cities.  We foresee acquirement of copyrighted footages, that itself adds on a big bulk to the budget. [ A copyrighted photo cost at least $600!].

 

 

CHALLENGES

Our team was granted unparalleled access, but we need the funds to come in time for us to kickstart the filming. Your contribution will help us overcome these hurdles.

 

WHAT YOU GET

  • Film Credit
  • Merchandise
  • E-book of all our research (after film release, you will obtain an E-book containing of all our research [photos/ archives/ audio visuals recording]
  • Special edition* E-book for Singaporean [Extended content]

 

THE IMPACT

The documentary undertakes an objective stand; and does not incline towards any camps or attempts to make any political statements. It aims to present the situation as it and assist audience to view this issue in full picture.

Do drug addicts support Duterte? Yes, most of them still do, but why? Tune in and help us tell you why.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Please help us get the word out!
  • We are collecting donations for the poor. [Gifts - Stationeries, storybooks, clothes, toiletries] *New (we are cutting down the process of filtering through old items) *Donors will be informed of where the gifts go to

 

For project updates:

Website: http://purgedocumentary.wixsite.com/info/team

Twitter: https://twitter.com/purgedocu

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Purge-Documentary-on-P...

My moral values pendulum back and forth these diverse and strong views.Purge is meant to illustrate dilemmas and conflicts of a developing world, which mirrors other similar social issues faced by countries in other parts of the world.  It exposes the struggles of a broken nation, working to rebuild its social fabric and chronicles the motion of the purge that rises like a tsunami, and in the midst of it – the casualties, the survivors, the debris.It contains moments of sadness, struggles and injustice for communities especially the poor who are targeted; and glimpse of liberation, hope and illumination for communities and families of victims plagued by crime threats on daily basis.At the heart of this film is a perpetual questioning: Are political and economic complexities substantial grounds to provide leeway for human rights violation? How can we put human rights in its appropriate place when both casualties are victims and assailants of each other? TEAMDirector - Kwan AdeleneAdelene is a Producer/ director based in Singapore with 12 years of media experience. She has undertaken a number of projects that include documentaries, corporate, and broadcast materials. She is also fluent in conceptualizing, craft, package and distribute content for various content platforms and spends most of her time experimenting mixed film genres.Apart from the commercial works she has done, Adelene is actively involved in arts festivals, installations and producing short films. Three shorts films were nominated in the 7th Chicago International Film festival, 23rd Singapore International Film Festival 2010 and participated in SMU Film Festival and Singapore short cuts.Her portfolio can be viewed on kwanadelene.wix.com/portfolio Producer - Nikko MayHero (2014) is the first short film Nikko produced, which won a silver medal at New York festival and was part of the official selection in Dragon Dreaming festival in 2015. These achievements have strongly encouraged and deepen her interest in making Producing her career. Her works have been screened on multiple public spaces, such as the National Museum of Singapore, Singapore Discovery Center and ASEAN-Japan center in Tokyo. Her latest project titled “I Believe”(2016) is set to be screened at the MAXXI Museum of XXI Century Arts MAXXI of Rome in December 2016 as part of AS Italian Film Festival. Nikko aims to push the boundaries of storytelling that is relatable to audience through the creative construction of the body of her work. Producer - Gerald FranGerald has over 13 years of production experience spanning tv, radio and print.In Singapore, he handled TVCs, documentaries and corporate videos for clients such as Singtel, Pizza Hut, Samsung, Changi Airport, A* STAR, Rolls-Royce, Thomson Medical Centre, Seletar Aerospace Park, OSIM, Mount Faber, JTC, SBST, MAS, SGX, NUS to name a few.In the Philippines, he wrote and produced documentaries on land reform, agriculture and solar power which were filmed in off-grid & war-torn communities; as well as TV spots featuring news & success stories on entrepreneurship, livelihood, infrastructure projects; and various corporate videos covering different industries.Cinematographer - James Hia[To be updated] Cinematographer - Tay Yu Xian Yu Xian is an award-winning filmmaker and media artist based in Singapore.In 2013, he represented Singapore in "Chance of a lifetime", an international non-scripted TV series organized by Hollywood's Variety Magazine & The United Nations Organization (UN) and Hyde Park-Image Nation, hosted by internationally renowned film producer Ashok Amritraj (Ghost Rider, Premonition, Street Fighter). His film "Between X and Y" won the best film and was awarded a special mention by Hollywood's Variety Magazine during the 2013 Cannes Film Festival.His involvement in feature film saw him work under the stewardship of renowned Australian director Kimble Rendall, 2nd Assistant Director of the Matrix Reloaded and Matrix Revolutions films. As a cinematographer, his short film "A Hole in the Bed" was nominated for Best Cinematography at 2009 Singapore Short Film Awards and featured in the 1st Experimental Film Forum. "Ice Cream Man" was selected for the 23rd Singapore International Film Festival and Chicago International Children Film Festival.Recently, he wrote and directed "Housing Memories: Eclipse of a Hainan Tribe", a documentary film on the endangered Li tribe in China. The film was screened to an international audience in Hong Kong, Singapore, China and Japan, and premiered in key venues such as the Asian Civilization Museum and the Central Public Library, Singapore.His portfolio can be viewed on www.tayyuxian.com WHAT WE NEEDOur team has already contacted relevant personnel, and are granted exclusive access.  We are ready to go ahead for intensive research and filming. Currently, we are lacking of funds to run this project full fledge, hence we need your help!Your Contribution will assist our team in
Research (journalist, survey)
Travel expenses
Accomodation
Equipment
Food & Land transport
Access
Granted Interviews (token of appreciation/ gifts of their effort and time)
Copyrighted materials (photos and footages)
Manpower cost (filming crew)
Post-production (Editing, sound post, music copyrights)
This project will be a long haul of about 8 months from research to project completion. It requires a lot of travelling to the Philippines, liaising and location recces in different cities.  We foresee acquirement of copyrighted footages, that itself adds on a big bulk to the budget. [ A copyrighted photo cost at least $600!].  CHALLENGESOur team was granted unparalleled access, but we need the funds to come in time for us to kickstart the filming. Your contribution will help us overcome these hurdles. WHAT YOU GET
Film Credit
Merchandise

E-book of all our research (after film release, you will obtain an E-book containing of all our research [photos/ archives/ audio visuals recording]
Special edition* E-book for Singaporean [Extended content]
 THE IMPACTThe documentary undertakes an objective stand; and does not incline towards any camps or attempts to make any political statements. It aims to present the situation as it and assist audience to view this issue in full picture.Do drug addicts support Duterte? Yes, most of them still do, but why? Tune in and help us tell you why. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Please help us get the word out!
We are collecting donations for the poor. [Gifts - Stationeries, storybooks, clothes, toiletries] *New (we are cutting down the process of filtering through old items) *Donors will be informed of where the gifts go to
 For project updates:Website: http://purgedocumentary.wixsite.com/info/teamTwitter: https://twitter.com/purgedocuFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/Purge-Documentary-on-P...

story:
Question: What do you get when you combine gender parity, social justice, environmental sustainability and cannabis?

Answer: A Puffragette™.

Puffragette™ [puff-ruh-jet]: noun a woman (or man) working towards gender parity, social justice and environmental sustainability in the cannabis industry. Origin: Pot + Suffragette

The Film

MARY JANES: THE WOMEN OF WEED follows Puffragettes™ as they navigate the “budding” marijuana industry in the United States. Their combined experience with the medical, legal, technical, scientific and business aspects of cannabis paint a multidimensional portrait of the what it really takes to be “The Women of Weed”.

Along the way, we meet authors, lawyers, doctors, patients, Congresswomen, legalization advocates, parents, and teachers who demystify the legal marijuana industry. We’ll learn about the evolution of the Cannabis Sativa plant, its Schedule I drug status with the DEA, and its eventual legalization for medical use. We’ll discuss how the “War on Drugs” created new “Jim Crow laws”, and the parallels between women leading the way to overturn alcohol prohibition and ending marijuana prohibition. Finally, we’ll highlight female-led businesses that are instilling social responsibility into their foundations and the successes these garner. By the end, we hope female and male audiences become educated voters and empowered entrepreneurs in any industry they choose.

The film is directed and produced by multi-award-winning filmmaker Windy Borman, whose recent successes include: the 10-time award-winning documentary, THE EYES OF THAILAND, narrated by Ashley Judd; and THE BIG PICTURE: RETHINKING DYSLEXIA, which premiered at Sundance and on HBO.

The Movement

Colorado. Washington. Alaska. Oregon. D.C. The recreational use of marijuana is legal in all of them. A total of 25 states have legalized medical marijuana and up to 10 more are likely to legalize it 2016. Concurrently, legitimate, peer-reviewed scientific studies continue to announce the health benefits of cannabis for treating everything from epilepsy and cancer, to PTSD and anxiety.

Clearly we’re at a marijuana tipping point, and “The Women of Weed” could make marijuana legal nationwide, help reform the criminal justice system, and build gender equality into a billion-dollar industry. We call this the Puffragette™ Movement.

According to a recent Marijuana Business Daily study, women hold 36% of leadership positions across the marijuana industry. That’s the highest amount of gender parity in any industry in the United States. In fact, Newsweek predicts that marijuana could be the first billion-dollar industry not dominated by men.

DVA Productions will follow these Puffragettes™ through the highs and lows of the legal cannabis industry in the documentary, MARY JANES: THE WOMEN OF WEED.

The Team

The Filmmaker

Windy Borman, MST, is a multi-award-winning film Director and Producer, as well as the Executive Producer and Director of MARY JANES: THE WOMEN OF WEED. Her recent projects include directing and producing the 10-time award-winning film, THE EYES OF THAILAND (narrated by Ashley Judd), and producing THE BIG PICTURE: RETHINKING DYSLEXIA (which premiered at Sundance and on HBO). Other credits include producing performances for Dr. Maya Angelou and Margaret Cho, directing “The Vagina Monologues”, and writing for Takepart.com and Indiewire: Women and Hollywood.

From 2003-2005, Ms. Borman dedicated two years of her life to Teach For America, teaching middle school Drama and Dance in the South Bronx. In 2006 she opened DVA Productions to use her gift of storytelling to produce film and digital content that give a voice to the voiceless and promote peace, justice and equality.

Windy has been an active member in Women in Film chapters since 2008. She served as the Vice President of Bay Area Women in Film and Media (BAWIFM) and was member of New York Women in Film and Television (NYWIFT). She moved to Colorado in 2014 and is thrilled to serve as the Founding Board Chair of Women in Film and Media Colorado (WIFMCO).

Director's Statement

I’ve always been intrigued by social issues, especially gender equality, social justice, environmental protection, education and empowerment. When I moved to Colorado in 2014—the same year recreational use of marijuana became legal—and started meeting successful women in the weed business—I knew I was perfectly positioned to tell these female entrepreneurs’ stories and inspire domestic and global audiences about how gender parity, social justice and environmental sustainability lead to greater success for all.

The Timeline

We began filming MARY JANES: THE WOMEN OF WEED in February 2016 and Production is already 65% complete. We’ve filmed in Colorado, DC, New York, New Jersey, Massachusetts and California. Oregon, Washington and Alaska are next on our list to round out all the states where adult (aka “recreational”) use of marijuana is legal.

To date we’ve interviewed 36 Puffragettes™ and edited the above MARY JANES Teaser Video to build our audience as we go and help finance the rest of film Production. We plan to premiere MARY JANES: THE WOMEN OF WEED at film festivals in Spring 2017.

In order to complete principal photography this fall, we need your support.

The Crowd-Funding Goal

Our first Crowdfunding Goal is to raise $13,850. These funds will allow us to film for 3 days (one day each in Oregon, Washington, and Alaska), thus showcasing women in each state where adult use of marijuana is legal.

Note: All donations are tax-deductible through our fiscal sponsor, Green Planet Films, a registered 501(c)3.

The Crowd-Funding expenses break down as follows:

$13,850 Goal - $692.50 (5% Indiegogo fee) - $969.50 (7% Fiscal Sponsor Fee) - $3,188.00 (Perk Fulfillment) = $9,000 Film Budget ($3,000 per shoot day x 3 days).

Even if we don't meet our full Crowd-Funding Goal, we can still use your donations to film as much as we can, and everyone will receive their donation "perk", although the DVDs/Digital Downloads may be delayed until the release of the film.

The Perks

We've put together some amazing donation perks including, DVDs/Digital Downloads of the film, Limited Edition Donors-Only "Puffragette" T-shirts, commemorative film posters, invitations to the film premiere--plus a chance to win a signed guitar by Willie Nelson! For a full description of perks, visit our website.

The Impact

You can’t talk about cannabis without including gender equality, social justice and environmental sustainability. Additionally, we’re at a critical point in the United States where we have the first female Presidential candidate from a major party, the Black Lives Matter movement, record-setting global temperatures for the second year in a row, and up to 10 states are voting on marijuana legalization in 2016.

MARY JANES: THE WOMEN OF WEED synthesizes these four vital conversations and adds a perspective that has been left out of previous films about cannabis: Women's.

According to a recent Marijuana Business Daily study, women hold 36% of leadership positions across the marijuana industry. The national average is 22%, so cannabis has the highest amount of gender parity in any industry in the United States.

Secondly, women purchase over 50% of movie tickets, yet represent only 30% of Hollywood speaking roles. This is true for cannabis films, too.

Next, High Times reported that women account for 40% of annual cannabis users, according to the most recent National Survey on Drug Use and Health. This means there were 13.1 million women in the United States who used cannabis in 2015. Women also drive 70-80% of all consumer purchases. This is a huge market share. 

Finally, women are creating businesses that instill corporate responsibility into the foundation of the cannabis industry. Showing this side of the industry is a realistic counterpoint to the other media that have focused on the “stoner” image, vaults of cash, or scantily clad women as arm candy. 

Bottom line: Isn’t it time we had a cannabis film where women get to speak about their experience?

The Need

We need to complete Production of MARY JANES: THE WOMEN OF WEED this fall, so the film can have its festival premiere in Spring 2017, and thereby have the greatest chance to influence the national cannabis conversation under the new presidency.

5 Ways You Can Help

  1. Donate to the Film Campaign.
  2. Share this campaign (using Indiegogo's social sharing tools).
  3. Send a personal message to your family, friends and colleagues to encourage their donations.
  4. Forward this campaign to your press contacts to help us go "viral".
  5. Contact us about becoming a film sponsor.

story:
TRANSFORMER TABLE, THE FUTURE OF YOUR DINING ROOM

Wondering about how to better and more efficiently organize your living room’s space? Transformer Table is the smart adaptable table that always shrinks and fits anywhere – and grows whenever and as much as you need it

In our age, in the rush for space efficiency, apartments are only getting smaller – which means that everything else, including the furniture, needs to be proportional to the limited space that you have at home. However, what should you do when you’re hosting a family meeting or a friend get-together? 

Meet the Transformer Table, a smart piece of furniture that is always there for you – large or small – however and whenever you need it.




 

 
The Transformer Table allows you to save so much space as you want to – making a stylish decorative item in your living room that can be noticed only for its beauty, and not for its size.

 However, you can easily adapt it and turn it into a medium or even very large dining table – if and when you need to.

The Transformer Table has been designed to allow for up to 12 people to sit and enjoy a large family dinner at Christmas time, for example, but its size is scalable and customizable – it can work as a fine decorative console table as much as it can be the dining table for two that fits perfectly into your lifestyle and living room space.



 Available in six different models and designs to fit all decoration preferences, the Transformer Table is built with sturdy steel sliding rails, as well as solid pins and clips, that allow it to be as extendable as stable and reliable. You can be sure that it will hold any weight that would ordinarily come with a large dinner party, for example. Plus, the middle movable legs give it added stability – while also allowing you to hide them in the primary legs when you don’t need them.

This is truly the future of furniture and of your living room. Smarter, stylish and super-efficient. This means that you can forget about having to buy new tables when you move into another house, or having to borrow – or even rent – larger tables when you’re inviting your loved ones for a delightful meal.





Transformer Table Information 

 Dimensions :  

• The Transformer table is 37.375 inches wide and 29.5 inches high.  

• Length changes depending on the number of sections.  

 • 5 sections are included (5 is the maximum of sections that can be installed)

•Each section are 20.125 inches Length of table depending on the number of sections:  

-0 section: 17.75 inches  
-1 section: 37.875 inches
-2 sections: 58.000 inches
-3 sections: 78.125 inches
-4 sections: 98.250 inches
-5 sections: 118.375 inches

 Colors:

- Boreal 
- Sequoia
- Blackwood
- GlazedBlack
- GlazedWhite
- Maple


Chairs info :

- Seat height : 18 Inches
- Back height : 36 Inches
- Width: 17 inches
- Material: Fabric
- Frame : Metal





 And, as we are now moving into the large production stage of the Transformer Table, we are seeking to raise $50,000 to fund its large scale production – while also giving you a unique chance to securing your own Transformer Table for a very special price. That is why we are now inviting you to:

Secure your access to the Transformer Table, in special conditions, while also supporting our project, by choosing one of the great Transformer Table models that we have on offer.

 Share this campaign with your friends and family members who may also want to enjoy the beauty, comfort and functionality of the future of furniture – in their living rooms.

 Thank you so much, and we hope to be soon shipping your Transformer Table!


FAQ

 

Q:What is our warranty?

A:We warranty that If for any reason the table come with any flaws at the ARRIVAL we will send you a replacement part at our cost.

 

Q:Do the Transformer Tables come with 5 sections?

A:Yes, the Transformer Tables come with all the 5 sections and you can customize your dining room as you please. We do offer 5 protectors for the 5 sections, included in the Transformer Table box.

 

Q:Can you get White heat stains/water ring on the Transformer table?

A:No, the Transformer Table is resistant to heat stains/water ring.

 

Q:Can we pick-up the Transformer Table at your warehouse and save on the shipping?

A:Sure, IndieGoGo do not allow us to put ''pick-up'' as a delivery option but if you come and get your Transformer Table we will refund you the shipping cost.

 

Q:When can we choose our Transformer Table/chair color?

A:As soon as the campaign end we will ask every backers witch color they want for each table and each chair they bought.

 

Q:Can we contact you for more information?

A:Sure! here the direct line to get in touch with us.

1-514-812-1594

story:
Hello, I'm Ken Brady. 

I have been writing, directing and performing political work for over 15 years. I wrote and directed Naomi Watts in my award-winning film "A House Divided", and wrote and performed in "The Time Is Now", chosen as the Village Voice Pick of the Week.

All summer in New York City, I've been performing "The Letter H", my very personal and political story of how we arrived at this moment in history in which bigotry became a way to campaign for the US presidency.

My story is so personal that I chose to perform in people's homes rather than in a traditional theater setting. And the response has been overwhelming -- and the call for me to take this on the road has become louder.

So as we countdown to this fork in the road known as the 2016 Presidential election, I am determined to make sure that voters in battleground states have the same opportunity to experience the show up close and personal.

Why me and why now?

Because families in these battleground states mirror mine. They recognize themselves in my story, and see their working class fathers in my father, and their history in mine. I know they will hear me. And I will move them to vote their true conscience.

It has been 36 years since the Reagan revolution turned the course of America in 1980. We will crush each year of that legacy, one show at a time.  

I need your support to deliver this show to a minimum of 36 audiences before November. Each show costs me about $400, and your contribution will make each one a reality.

The funds you donate will support the following:

  • Video documentation & testimonials
  • Publicity for audience awareness
  • Collateral for voting awareness
  • Event booking & coordination
  • Travel & Lodging
  • Community organizations outreach

Thank you for your support!

story:
What is Pit Viper?

Written and directed by Pittsburgh-based filmmaker Ian Altenbaugh, Pit Viper is a mystery/crime series that takes place in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and the surrounding region. The story follows Parker and Medea, and the violence that follows in the wake of their decisions.

While out hunting for scrap metal one day, our down-on-his-luck hero Parker stumbles upon a bloody crime scene. Instead of calling the authorities, Parker instead decides to take a silver ring off of a dead body and pawn it. However, he finds that not only does no one want to buy the ring, but he is now suspected of murdering someone with some dangerous friends. Further complicating matters, Parker's ex-girlfriend Medea, whom he still lives with and loves despite the feeling not being mutual, decides to frame him for stealing money from the local drug dealer.

The goal with Pit Viper is to create a story that is uniquely Western Pennsylvanian, while having a broad enough appeal for everyone to enjoy. A show that is to Pittsburgh what Fargo is to Minneapolis, The Wire was to Baltimore, or Breaking Bad was to Albuquerque.

We believe we have a unique and cool project which we'd love for you to be part of!

 

Where Does Your Money Go?

To put it simply, the more money we can raise, the better our product will be, and the wider audience it will reach. It will also allow us to get Pit Viper out to the world quicker. Because, whether we meet our goal or not, Pit Viper is going to be finished and available to audiences everywhere. However, the more support we get, the more options we have in post-production, especially when it comes to music.

The breakdown of our fundraiser goes as follows:

- $750 for editing and color

- $900 for post-audio mix and score

- $350 for marketing, merchandise, and festival submissions.

 

Our Risks, Our Challenges, Our Story

Pit Viper has been a year in the making. The creator of the series, Ian Altenbaugh spent several years developing the concept and much of 2015 writing the pilot. He also called in every favor and maxed out every credit card he had to get the project made.

While there are always risks with every project, the Pit Viper team believes strongly that they have a product that is smart, unique, and a lot of fun. While money was spent on equipment rentals, the cast and crew worked for free, on a holiday weekend no less, because they felt passionately about making something that represents the place they live.

The Pit Viper team asks that you share this crowdfunding campaign with your friends, family, and anyone you might think would be interested. We feel passionately about this project and if you enjoy the movie half as much as the cast and crew did making it, then you will be highly entertained.

story:
Why is this Campaign Important?

The importance of this film is beyond measure. The Cape Verdean Community and it's Youth are in dire need of positive role models and influential stories about their culture. Even in 2017 someone can go outside and ask a random person "what/where is Cape Verde?" and 99% of folks will be clueless. Not only is this film important for Cape Verdean culture but its also influential in introducing Non-Cape Verdeans to our beautiful and one-of-a-kind culture.

 

The Look of the Film

Cabo Verde is one of the most unique and picturesque places in the world. One of the ten islands which make up Cabo Verde is Brava, known for its luscious landscapes and flora. The creative minds at 32CaboVerde.com captured some of the best footage ever of the island and we plan on working with them and capturing similar footage of the island of Praia for our film. Take a minute to check out the video below and welcome to Cabo Verde!

 

The Feel of the Film

 

Sneak Peak at Footage Already Shot!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for your donation to bring this film to life! With your generous contribution you will be joining our film crew family and helping to produce a historic work of visual art for generations to come!

Your contribution will be going to our many film departments including:

Wardrobe Department

Set Construction

Camera Department

Sound Equipment

Lighting Equipment

Ship Rental

Transport ion

Craft Services

Promotion Materials

Actors Compensation

Facility Rentals

Props Department

If we do not meet our entire goal the funds collected will be divided evenly throughout the above departments. 

Perks

And of course besides donating your not only helping to spread Cape Verdean Cultural Awareness but your contribution comes with many perks! Including Film Credit, DVD Copy, Swag Bag and Tickets to the Premiere!!!

Risks & Challenges

With any film there are risk and challenges to raising funds and making a successful project. However our teams passion and drive push us to make this piece of history come to life no matter the obstacles before us. No Sacrifice, No Glory! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute that much, we understand that but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways!

  • By sharing our campaign on your Facebook, Twitter & IG accounts you can get the word out to hundreds of friends that might be interested in contributing to the film.
  • Remember even $1 goes a long way when its multiplied by hundreds!

story:
Summary

I am an actress originally from South Africa who moved to the UK when I was 14yrs to study drama. I was lucky enough to get into The Brit School at that age, substituting 'normal' subjects for performance related subjects. I completed my four years there with distinctions all the way, followed by a three year degree at Dartington College of Arts with a first.

I have worked on stage and screen as well as devised and produced performance material for theatre and short films. I've also done a bit of professional singing and art... If I had to describe myself in one word, I would say, 'creative'. This is a tough industry but it's a calling. I cannot help but continue to make work that I hope audiences relate to. This has always been my goal, to share a piece of humanity with others.

This campaign is important not only because it will be the first short film I've written, directed and produced, but because it deals with issues close to my heart and universal themes I know will be accessible to a very wide audience. The issue of stress attacks us all. For many, it impacts our health and I want to shed some awareness to the harm in the only way I know, through performance.

Set in a swimming pool, Lane has little dialogue and is very visual. This makes the film even more accessible because you lose the potential language barrier. Taking the broad theme of stress into a swimming pool context allows a very specific way to communicating the concept through the environment. Even for those who are not swimmers, I believe the psychological tension will be something they can relate to because the frame of the film oftens takes the point of view of the swimmer.

Given that this is quite an ambitious project for my first short film, many would run to the hills after conceiving the idea. Working in water is not only expensive for location and equipment, it can also be dangerous. To add, the experience of filming in water is not the common box many film makers tick. However, since writing the film in April, I have been so incredibly supported and encouraged by my film making colleagues and friends that I am determined to make this happen.

The target of £8,500 that we want to reach will cover only the barest of costs, and that includes many favours that I will, for many years, be indebted to. If we reach beyond our target, it means that not only are we doing things correctly and safely, but we will be able to pay crew - many of whom have agreed to work for expenses-only because of their belief. Beyond that are always additional unforeseen festival expenses once the film is complete. The target therefore, really does just cover our backs.

Once the film is complete, you will be apart of something real special! Not only will you have your name (and potential perks) associated to the making of such an ambitious endeavour, you will also be contributing to bringing the awareness of stress and its unhealthy consequences to light. By reaching our target, we can enter into film festivals that will hopefully provide an even wider spectrum of audience to relate to. So whatever support you are able to offer, you will be apart of the achievement.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need £8,500 to just cover the basic costs over a three night shoot, pre and post production. This seems like an enormous figure but when you break it down, a piece of the pie branches out to many unfamiliar factors. A pie chart on our website gives an idea of the costs involved:

http://lane-film.co.uk/funding/

PERKS on offer are art, swimming or film related. Please view the Perks page on the website: http://www.lane-film.co.uk/perks . Watch this space as the perks become more creative as time goes by.

If the target is not reached, the funds will be saved for Lane until additional funding options can be realised. This film is going to be made, come what may.

 

The Impact

The film aims to have a personal impact on its audience. The reality of illness, whether mental or physical, is too often a by-product of stress. This is a universal issue.

The making of the film will allow film makers to stretch their abilities, enrich their experience and explore new ways of film making.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face is safety during filming. For crew and cast we will have onsight lifeguards and first aiders to prevent any potential hazards. Insurance is necessary for public liability as well as equipment, and while you can guessimate these, there's always a risk.

The main challenge is to create the right shots to serve the film content. Research can be done on this but ultimately, until you enter the space with your team and equipment, you have to work together and problem-solve to deliver the drama.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If times are tough in the ol bank account and you are unable to contribute but still want to be involved in the making, please do get in touch!

 

Thank you very much!
