story:
Very important information:

This campaign was created in the belief that the money would be spent for a very good reason. A new film is a very good reason. Meanwhile the situation has completely changed and I (who had set up this campaign for Nick Mancuso) became aware that the money will not be used for the reason as it was originally claimed by Nick Mancuso. I tried to refund the money to every single donator today, but it is not possible for me anymore since all money has already been disbursed to the banking account of Nick Mancuso. If you want to have your money back, I can only suggest to file a compaint against Nick Mancuso directly and also against Indiegogo by taking a screenshot of this update to cause Indiegogo to research this campaign. The e-mail address of Nick Mancuso: nickmancuso.mancuso@gmail.com.

Money for this campaign was donated to Nick Mancuso himself to his banking account:
Nick Mancuso
Bank of America
ny6-252-01-01, 1 New Paltz Plaza
New Paltz, NY 12561, USA
Routing number (ABA): 021000322
Account Number: 483030990228
SWIFT Code: BOFAUS3N

It is not the fault of other people involved in this campaign. I'm sure the producer and director of the film and also all other actors/actresses were not aware that this campaign is a fraud.

That's all information I can provide so that you can claim to get your money refunded by him. Indiegogo is asked to research this campaign and all future campaings of Nick Mancuso (actor, known from the NBC Stingray TV series) and to refund all money to all donators. The police (of several countries) is involved to research this case. December 1st, 2018

____________________________________________________________________

PERSEFONE'S TEARS

A HORROR COMEDY METAFILM
BY NICK MANCUSO

A group of lunatic actors of international reputation are trying to make a bad horror film in the mountains of Calabria in southern Italy when everything goes wrong. Film written and directed by Nick Mancuso and Alberto Gatto. Film directed by Jonathan Heap.

 

 

 

 

SYNOPSES

A group of actors, malcontents, miscreants, idealists and lunatics by nature Americans, Italians, Serbs, Canadians are shooting an insane 3 country coproduction of a bad horror movie about witches in which everything goes to pieces. Written and directed by veteran Hollywood actor Nick Mancuso, star of countless movies and of the cult hit TV series Stingray in the mid 80s. Persefone's Tears will star some of Italy's best and brightest, established Hollywood stars, Serbia's top actors and collection of top cinematographers and editors.
For the first time in history, Hollywood moves into the mountains of Southern Italy near the Aspromonte renowned for its mystery and antiquity.
Starring American actor Nicholas Porcelli (Behaving Badly, Rising Alien) and Silvia Suvadova, John Savage, Nick Mancuso, Enzo de Liguoro, horror star Bill Moseley, Yancy Butler, Cinzia Costa, Lazar Rockwood, Italian movie star and winner of the Donatello Award, Antonella Ponziani, star of Fellinis Intervista, and many other renowned Films, and co directed by Oscar nominated American director Jonathan Heap, with Italian cinematographer Massimiliano Trevis (Titus Andronicus). Persefone's Tears is a comedy horror delight, a film like you have never seen. Music by Calabrian Guitarist "Battente" Francesco Loccisano.

BASIC PLOT

Nick Young, fading former Hollywood TV star decides to accept a role in a low budget horror film shooting in the land of his immigrant parents. Unable to get the role that would catapult him to the top of the Hollywood heap he grudgingly accepts a part portraying a French soldier in Napoleons army in his invasion of the Russia.
His cadre is wiped out in the forests near Moscow and he survives only to enter an abandoned village populated by a coven of witches. In the meantime Nick begins to experience a series of hallucinated visions in which the ancient goddess Persefone appears to him in various guises including famed Slovakian actress Silvia Suvadova. Up for a major role back home with Martin Scorcese Nick undergoes a massive sea change, leaving behind his drug addicted past to reconnect to his personal significance and what is true and real and beautiful. All this while everything is falling apart all around him. He never gets the part that would catapult him to fame and fortune but instead finds the true love of discovering who he really is and why other people are important.

IDEALS

We are hoping to raise 25,000 US-Dollars on the first round with a final budget of 350,000 Euros which we hope to raise from private investors and government sources as well as Indiegogo. Since we have already started filming with an almost zero budget other than the help of many fine people, actors, artists, technicians, behind the scenes, who are doing it from their heart, and personal out of pocket,the money will be used to get the film to its next stage of development. Many fine artists and technicians are helping to make this real. Any contribution at this point will be of help, even if it is just good thoughts and well wishes, and large contributors will get Associate Producer and Producer status for anything over 50,000 Euros plus a potential return. Legal documents will be established for anyone interested.
Investors will be compensated according to established film business standards. All contributors will be on the Angels credits list at the end of the film and all contributors of $100 and above will receive an autographed DVD of the film and production stills.

Thank You

Nick Mancuso

 

NICK MANCUSO

Veteran actor Nick Mancuso star of over 120 films including Under Siege and the NBC series Stingray is playing the role of Vito Mancini, the harried producer writer of La Colpa Della Strega in his film Persefones Tears, filming in Italy. Mr Mancuso will also co direct the film within the film in which a motley crew of international actors are filming a bad horror movie in the Aspromonte mountains of Calabria in southern Italy. As the movie progresses everything starts falling apart but the horror movie is completed and is a success.
Mr Mancuso has been a Hollywood actor for over 40 years and brings a wide range of experience to this Fellinesque enterprise.

 

Nick Mancuso at IMDb

JOHN SAVAGE

Legendary Hollywood Actor John Savage has performed in some of Americas greatest films of the last 30 years including The Deer Hunter with Robert De Niro, the Onion Field, Hair and Thin Red Line by Terrence Malick.
John will be playing the part of the good natured but completely confused director of La Colpa Della Strega. Unable to hold together his international cast of neurotic actors he none less completes the film and falls in love with Mirabella Mancuso, a beautiful Calabrian actress, who resists his adoration until finally she accepts his proposal for marriage. As in all good comedies All's well that ends well.

John Savage at IMDb

SILVIA ŠUVADOVÁ

Silvia Šuvadová plays the goddess Persefone. A star of many independent features, including my films, The Last Gamble and Born Dead, she is one of Hollywoods most beautiful rising Stars. Considered one of Slovakias finest artistic exports Silvia first cane to promince in the Oscar winning Czech film Kolya. We are honored to have Ms Šuvadová in our cast.

 

Silvia Suvadova at IMDb

CINZIA COSTA

Cinzia Costa is a Calabrian acting revelation. Cast by famed Italian director Carlo Carlei, "Il Guidici Meschino" and though only a few years in film Ms Costa has been in many theatre plays, including The Iliad, here in Calabria. Her future is assured as one of Italy's future stars. She plays La Strega in the horror film and Cinzia in Persefone's Tears.

ANTONELLA PONZIANI

Winner of the prestigious David Di Donatello Award from the Venice Film Festival (Italy's Oscar) and many other acting awards Antonella Ponziani is one of Italy's top actresses having worked with some of Italy's brightest lights including Federico Fellini. A renowned saxophonist and director we are honored to have Antonella join our film playing the evil mother witch " Mastrega" in the horror film "Il Colpo Della Strega" and Antonella Ponza, in the meta film Persefone's Tears.

 

Antonella Ponziani at IMDb

ENZO DÈ LIGUORO

Coming from a long line of Neapolitan acting aristocracy including Italian silent movie star Vincenzo dè Liguoro, in the 1920's Enzo dè Liguoro is sheer "acting" fireworks. His family theatre tradition dates back to the 1890s when Naples and the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies was the 3d richest cultural centre of Europe. Mr dè Liguoro is in the ancient acting lineage of Commedia del Arte and we are honored to have him in our cast. He is playing both Enzo de Julius and has been cast in the role of The Devil in The Witches Curse, Il Colpo Della Strega.

 

Curriculum Vitae (short) of Enzo dè Liguoro 
Curriculum Vitae of Enzo dè Liguoro

JONATHAN HEAP
DIRECTOR

Jonathan Heap was nominated for an Oscar in his first film short 12.01, starring Kirkwood Smith. He has since gone on to direct many fine movies starring actors such as Donald Sutherland and Eric Roberts, a commedian in his own right Jonathan will helm the meta film within a film Persefone's Tears.

 

Jonathan Heap at IMDb

ALBERTO GATTO

Biography and Filmography of Alberto Gatto

 

STILLS FROM PERSEFON'S TEARS

Meanwhile the situation has completely changed and I (who had set up this campaign for Nick Mancuso) became aware that the money will not be used for the reason as it was originally claimed by Nick Mancuso. I tried to refund the money to every single donator today, but it is not possible for me anymore since all money has already been disbursed to the banking account of Nick Mancuso. If you want to have your money back, I can only suggest to file a compaint against Nick Mancuso directly and also against Indiegogo by taking a screenshot of this update to cause Indiegogo to research this campaign. The e-mail address of Nick Mancuso: nickmancuso.mancuso@gmail.com.Money for this campaign was donated to Nick Mancuso himself to his banking account:Nick MancusoBank of Americany6-252-01-01, 1 New Paltz PlazaNew Paltz, NY 12561, USARouting number (ABA): 021000322Account Number: 483030990228SWIFT Code: BOFAUS3NIt is not the fault of other people involved in this campaign. I'm sure the producer and director of the film and also all other actors/actresses were not aware that this campaign is a fraud.That's all information I can provide so that you can claim to get your money refunded by him. Indiegogo is asked to research this campaign and all future campaings of Nick Mancuso (actor, known from the NBC Stingray TV series) and to refund all money to all donators. The police (of several countries) is involved to research this case. December 1st, 2018____________________________________________________________________PERSEFONE'S TEARSA HORROR COMEDY METAFILMBY NICK MANCUSOA group of lunatic actors of international reputation are trying to make a bad horror film in the mountains of Calabria in southern Italy when everything goes wrong. Film written and directed by Nick Mancuso and Alberto Gatto. Film directed by Jonathan Heap.    SYNOPSESA group of actors, malcontents, miscreants, idealists and lunatics by nature Americans, Italians, Serbs, Canadians are shooting an insane 3 country coproduction of a bad horror movie about witches in which everything goes to pieces. Written and directed by veteran Hollywood actor Nick Mancuso, star of countless movies and of the cult hit TV series Stingray in the mid 80s. Persefone's Tears will star some of Italy's best and brightest, established Hollywood stars, Serbia's top actors and collection of top cinematographers and editors.For the first time in history, Hollywood moves into the mountains of Southern Italy near the Aspromonte renowned for its mystery and antiquity.Starring American actor Nicholas Porcelli (Behaving Badly, Rising Alien) and Silvia Suvadova, John Savage, Nick Mancuso, Enzo de Liguoro, horror star Bill Moseley, Yancy Butler, Cinzia Costa, Lazar Rockwood, Italian movie star and winner of the Donatello Award, Antonella Ponziani, star of Fellinis Intervista, and many other renowned Films, and co directed by Oscar nominated American director Jonathan Heap, with Italian cinematographer Massimiliano Trevis (Titus Andronicus). Persefone's Tears is a comedy horror delight, a film like you have never seen. Music by Calabrian Guitarist "Battente" Francesco Loccisano.BASIC PLOTNick Young, fading former Hollywood TV star decides to accept a role in a low budget horror film shooting in the land of his immigrant parents. Unable to get the role that would catapult him to the top of the Hollywood heap he grudgingly accepts a part portraying a French soldier in Napoleons army in his invasion of the Russia.His cadre is wiped out in the forests near Moscow and he survives only to enter an abandoned village populated by a coven of witches. In the meantime Nick begins to experience a series of hallucinated visions in which the ancient goddess Persefone appears to him in various guises including famed Slovakian actress Silvia Suvadova. Up for a major role back home with Martin Scorcese Nick undergoes a massive sea change, leaving behind his drug addicted past to reconnect to his personal significance and what is true and real and beautiful. All this while everything is falling apart all around him. He never gets the part that would catapult him to fame and fortune but instead finds the true love of discovering who he really is and why other people are important.IDEALSWe are hoping to raise 25,000 US-Dollars on the first round with a final budget of 350,000 Euros which we hope to raise from private investors and government sources as well as Indiegogo. Since we have already started filming with an almost zero budget other than the help of many fine people, actors, artists, technicians, behind the scenes, who are doing it from their heart, and personal out of pocket,the money will be used to get the film to its next stage of development. Many fine artists and technicians are helping to make this real. Any contribution at this point will be of help, even if it is just good thoughts and well wishes, and large contributors will get Associate Producer and Producer status for anything over 50,000 Euros plus a potential return. Legal documents will be established for anyone interested.Investors will be compensated according to established film business standards. All contributors will be on the Angels credits list at the end of the film and all contributors of $100 and above will receive an autographed DVD of the film and production stills.Thank YouNick Mancuso NICK MANCUSOVeteran actor Nick Mancuso star of over 120 films including Under Siege and the NBC series Stingray is playing the role of Vito Mancini, the harried producer writer of La Colpa Della Strega in his film Persefones Tears, filming in Italy. Mr Mancuso will also co direct the film within the film in which a motley crew of international actors are filming a bad horror movie in the Aspromonte mountains of Calabria in southern Italy. As the movie progresses everything starts falling apart but the horror movie is completed and is a success.Mr Mancuso has been a Hollywood actor for over 40 years and brings a wide range of experience to this Fellinesque enterprise. Nick Mancuso at IMDbJOHN SAVAGELegendary Hollywood Actor John Savage has performed in some of Americas greatest films of the last 30 years including The Deer Hunter with Robert De Niro, the Onion Field, Hair and Thin Red Line by Terrence Malick.John will be playing the part of the good natured but completely confused director of La Colpa Della Strega. Unable to hold together his international cast of neurotic actors he none less completes the film and falls in love with Mirabella Mancuso, a beautiful Calabrian actress, who resists his adoration until finally she accepts his proposal for marriage. As in all good comedies All's well that ends well.John Savage at IMDbSILVIA ŠUVADOVÁSilvia Šuvadová plays the goddess Persefone. A star of many independent features, including my films, The Last Gamble and Born Dead, she is one of Hollywoods most beautiful rising Stars. Considered one of Slovakias finest artistic exports Silvia first cane to promince in the Oscar winning Czech film Kolya. We are honored to have Ms Šuvadová in our cast. Silvia Suvadova at IMDbCINZIA COSTACinzia Costa is a Calabrian acting revelation. Cast by famed Italian director Carlo Carlei, "Il Guidici Meschino" and though only a few years in film Ms Costa has been in many theatre plays, including The Iliad, here in Calabria. Her future is assured as one of Italy's future stars. She plays La Strega in the horror film and Cinzia in Persefone's Tears.ANTONELLA PONZIANIWinner of the prestigious David Di Donatello Award from the Venice Film Festival (Italy's Oscar) and many other acting awards Antonella Ponziani is one of Italy's top actresses having worked with some of Italy's brightest lights including Federico Fellini. A renowned saxophonist and director we are honored to have Antonella join our film playing the evil mother witch " Mastrega" in the horror film "Il Colpo Della Strega" and Antonella Ponza, in the meta film Persefone's Tears. Antonella Ponziani at IMDbENZO DÈ LIGUOROComing from a long line of Neapolitan acting aristocracy including Italian silent movie star Vincenzo dè Liguoro, in the 1920's Enzo dè Liguoro is sheer "acting" fireworks. His family theatre tradition dates back to the 1890s when Naples and the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies was the 3d richest cultural centre of Europe. Mr dè Liguoro is in the ancient acting lineage of Commedia del Arte and we are honored to have him in our cast. He is playing both Enzo de Julius and has been cast in the role of The Devil in The Witches Curse, Il Colpo Della Strega. Curriculum Vitae (short) of Enzo dè Liguoro Curriculum Vitae of Enzo dè LiguoroJONATHAN HEAPDIRECTORJonathan Heap was nominated for an Oscar in his first film short 12.01, starring Kirkwood Smith. He has since gone on to direct many fine movies starring actors such as Donald Sutherland and Eric Roberts, a commedian in his own right Jonathan will helm the meta film within a film Persefone's Tears. Jonathan Heap at IMDbALBERTO GATTOBiography and Filmography of Alberto Gatto  STILLS FROM PERSEFON'S TEARS

story:
Short Summary

Black Girl’s Be Like is the girls’ side of the story. Very often we see a woman at the end of her journey with no clue of how she got there. No one starts out broken, hard, and difficult to love. Yes, even the most hardened woman started out as an innocent girl. What happens to one as they ditch the innocence of girlhood and slip into the woman they will become? Black Girl’s Be Like is a coming of age tale of a girl at the cusp, with the limitless potential that only a child could possess. Does she fall in line with the others and become what her environment dictates? Or does she break out and blaze a new trail? Ta’Sheena is every girl, in every school in a failing district, in every urban community. You ever wonder who was the name behind the statistic? What blurred out child’s face you see in the 5:00 news? This film portrays what young women in such environments experience on a daily basis and how innocence is constantly threatened. In the ongoing narrative of “the hood” who is the heroine? 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make Black Girl’s Be Like a reality I need the proper funding. My past films have been made with little to no budgets. It is my plan for this film to reach larger audiences and that can’t be done without financial support. All the basics of production will be covered; insurance, cast, crew, locations, catering, set dec, props, etc. As well as post-production, which is a huge key in producing a great finished product. I’m collaborating with an awesome crew that are great in their perspective crafts. As an independent contractor myself I know how important it is for our work to be valued and compensated. I would like to translate the kind of professionalism I encounter working on network television/films to my own set, which includes paying and feeding people. Principle photography will be done in my hometown of Grand Rapids, MI, a town that once benefited from a fruitful film incentive but has since lost. It is my hope that my film, in some small way, can bring the love of filmmaking back to the city. By employing local cast, talent, and vendors I hope to add a small spike in the Grand Rapids economy. In short help fund my film because the story needs to be told. Our girls need to know that there are other people like them out there, and that the every day struggle they encounter isn’t singular. 

Aside from the warm-fuzzy feeling you get for donating to a good cause here are some perks that come with giving:

$5-10.00 – Thanks boo, you put 5 on it and we appreciate you!

$15-25.00 – We will make you our #MCM or #WCW (we’ll make sure to choose a cute pic)

$50.00 – You are the proud owner of an official BGBL disc, complete with behind the scenes footage. 

$100.00 – You get hooked up with a #salutetothepursuit t-shirt BGBL Edition as well as a BGBL disc

$200.00 – Come through! Come kick it with us on set in addition to a #salutetothepursuit t-shirt and BGBL disc

$500.00 – Thank yooouuu! The whole world will know of your support to the film, you will be featured in the credits.

$1,000.00 – Lights, Camera, Action! Are you ready for your close-up? This gets  you a featured extra role, maybe even a line or two

$5,000.00 – Welcome to the Team! This gives you an Associate Producer Credit

$10,000.00 – Exec Producer Credit

The Impact

I worked for the Grand Rapids Public School District for 3 years fresh out of college, after first being a product of the district myself. During my time there I worked as an after school teacher, instructing video production, and as a Youth Advocate where I was given a case load of students that I was responsible in helping matriculate through the school year. The kids on the caseload were considered “at-risk” due to whatever guidelines and criteria created by some person sitting in an office came up with. Due to their parents income, and the area they lived in they could have ended up on my list. The students I encountered changed my life. They inspired me, angered me, and challenged me every single day. Although I would leave work exhausted I would always leave feeling like a change was made, even though it may have been small. Not only did I take away a piece of those students in my heart, but also left with their stories and experiences. It angered me that the outside world thought that these kids were bad or stupid, or unworthy in some sense. Black Girl’s Be Like is a story inspired by the stories and lives of the students I encountered. Behind the tough facades of each student I found a child that wanted to be accepted, understood, and loved. I wanted to make this Film so people on the outside could get a glimpse of what happens beyond the headlines. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you're not able to contribute please spread the word and pass the campaign along to others. Share the post & video with as many people as you can so the vision can become a reality. 

Also, if you would like to contribute equipment or talents contact me via email at r.dee.floyd@gmail.com.

story:
Who's asking?

The peepSHOW team crew is designing and building this installation as a labor of love for the Market Street Prototyping Festival and the City of San Francisco. We have received some generous support—from MSPF, SF Planning, YBCA, David Baker Architects, BOK Modern, and Autodesk—but we are an independent team spending a tremendous amount of our personal time, energy, and money to realize this project.

We are hustling to gather support, cut costs, and streamline production. We are committed to making a beautiful, engaging, durable, and safe installation to spark curiosity and conversation and to brighten the Market Street corridor. For this, we need to raise enough funding to fully realize the project. 
 

What is it?

peepSHOW 2.0 is an immersive mirrored urban viewing station that focuses your gaze and thoughts onto concealed street scenes and creates a space for you as a Market Street pedestrian to contemplate your surroundings and connect with fellow citizens. Inspired by a nature viewing station, peepSHOW centers the act of observation in San Francisco's dense city context.

Why are we building it?

We had an amazing experience developing the original peepSHOW for the original Market Street Prototyping Festival last year. The Festival and the City invited us to return—bigger, better, sponsored, and incubated—for this year's event. peepSHOW 2.0 is currently being developed in the Urban Prototyping Research Lab via a 6-month iterative R&D program in collaboration with the Market Street Prototyping team, Gray Area Foundation for the Arts, Autodesk, and the residents of San Francisco. David Baker Architects has committed funds to the project and supported our efforts with flexible scheduling. BOK Modern is a generous fabrication partner, and Arup is providing critical structural engineering guidance.

What needs to happen?

As this entire process is experimental, the funding offered to us is minimal. We are pushing to make peepSHOW 2.0 as engaging, beautiful, and impactful as possible. We need your help to bridge the funding gap! With your support, we can bring peepSHOW 2.0 to Market Street for up to two years and help to shape the future of the city's main corridor.

What's the plan?

We are seeking donations totaling $15,000 to subsidize the funding we have received from the Festival Incubation Program and from our role as an MSPF Design Captain, mentoring 10 first-time prototype projects to develop their vision for the Festival as well. We are looking forward to your contribution! Perks of gratitude range from a private dinner for two inside the peepSHOW, to the chance to have your name engraved on the peepSHOW for all to see, to a VIP invitation to our Fundraiser Party in September.

What's the impact?

peepSHOW 1.0 was our first prototype: We worked hard to create the piece, designing and fabricating it in-house. For peepSHOW 2.0, we are upgrading the concept, construction materials, and design to withstand the elements and a high volume of participants. The new highly interactive peepSHOW 2.0 will be installed in a plaza at Third and Market Streets in San Francisco. This location has the potential to reach 8,000 people every day, and will also support large gatherings, events, and performances. We are working hard to partner with creative and generous fabricators and engineers to bring peepSHOW to life as safely and economically as possible. 

How can I get involved?

Please make a donation! All funds are a meaningful contribution to the peepSHOW project. They will be used resourcefully and appreciated greatly.  Plus, help us get the word out by sharing our campaign with friends, family, and colleagues!

This Indiegogo campaign is fiscally sponsored by Gray Area Foundation for the Arts. Donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

Follow our process here (and find out more about our fundraising party!). 

More...

David Baker Architects: peepSHOW

MSPF Incubation Project: peepSHOW

#MSPFpeepSHOW

#DBAlab

story:
Short Summary

  • Introducing myself: Hi! I'm Baroque Scipio (director's pseudo-name, inspired by a voice teacher who thought Baroque was my name and a Roman History teacher who introduced me to the brilliant name Scipionus). I've loved performing (singing, dancing, acting, directing etc) from a young age. My awesome mother supported me through times of trial growing up by sending me to dance classes after attending the Orange County performing arts high school in Santa Ana from 8:00am-5:00pm five days a week. After which, I attended UCLA's school of theater film and television. Now, I am that recent graduate who is broke paying loans for all the schooling I've done to "make it" along with all the other hopefuls in Los Angeles. I've spent my 24 years on this planet to dedicating and understanding theater and film to better understand humanity and where we sit in it today. Perspective is my favorite aspect to life, and given the chance, I would, if I could, explore everyone's story. 
  • This short film features a handful of young talented actors who I believe should have the chance to be seen. I met them through various theatres and schools and wanted to give them a chance to express a a script meditating on perception and where people can and cannot stand together.
  • I would love a chance to send this film to festivals across the country, continuing to introduce young female perspective into the film industry and therefore the media... to keep the battle for equality in the industry moving foreword to a more equal end. 

Need Support to Send to Festivals & Gratitude in Credits/Websites related to film

  • I say 1,000 here, but anywhere from 50$-1,000's helps to get this film finished right and send to festivals!
  • Wherever you're from- I would love to raise any money I get to send to the closest film festival near you! If accepted you could see the film in it's entirety and a special thanks with your name in the credits.
  • Would love to send to Los Angeles, but also where you're from! 

The Impact

  • I don't intend to break boundaries here, merely to support and continue the discussion and presence of youth with a voice in the film industry
  • The only thing that qualifies anybody to do anything in the arts, is the passion and drive to learn more and more about it every day. I've spent my money, my parents' money and all my time cultivating myself as a cinematic and theatrical artist.
  • If you disagree with my viewpoints or are dispassionate about this particular project, fair game. It was me merely missing the mark in endeavoring to excite you about the ideas that can drive diverse humans. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you support the film please, merely pass these links on! I have a director's website under: http://torirafael.wix.com/aclassact?fb_ref=Default

Thank you! Grazie! Merci! Gracias!

story:
What is ICON?

ICON is the story of a team of three accomplished con-artists, separated for years after bad blood arose between them, who are brought back together for one more Big Score. Intrigues, twists and turns, double-and-triple-crosses abound... It may seem like a familiar plot line -- but what sets our film apart is our process, which we have dubbed "Living Film". Our approach will provide a uniquely raw, visceral, exciting filmmaking and viewing experience.

Unlike traditional filmmaking, in which every moment is choreographed, rehearsed, and filmed numerous times (sometimes dozens of times) in order to capture the "perfect " moment, ICON is unscripted and unrehearsed. And while the outline of the story, and what needs to happen in order to fulfill it, is known by the Director (as well as the Director of Photography and camera operators), the actors have no foreknowledge of what's about to happen. They are existing truthfully in the moment, every moment. The actors will rehearse backstory together in order to better understand character and relationships, and to build shared experiences. But the scenes of the film itself will be happening live.

Similar approaches have been taken in unscripted films in the past, from Godard to Cassavetes to Christopher Guest to James Byrkit -- But Living Film again is different. For our actors, just as in life, there are no retakes. No second chances. No "coverage". No telling where it will all end up. We will shoot with two matching cameras, so we never miss a moment -- but what happens in front of the lens happens once and once only, raw and truthful. It's like a LIVE MOVIE.

We have assembled a team of accomplished storytellers both behind and in front of the camera. All of the players have extensive experience in dramatic improv, writing, acting and filmmaking. We feel confident and excited to bring this new form of storytelling to life

What We Need  

  • We are seeking $20,000 to cover customary expenses associated with creating a viable feature-length film. The creative team (Director, Actors, Director of Photography) are not expecting any direct compensation. We are doing this for the love of the process and the opportunity to create a unique cinematic artwork. But here's how your contributions will be distributed:
  1. $5,000 goes to renting state-of-the-art camera equipment and cinema-quality lenses to make our film look gorgeous. 
  2. $2,000 for sound. As a great DP once said, "Nobody ever left the theater hummin' a nice two-shot." Sound can make or break a great film, and we need to hire the best production sound artist with the finest equipment to assure our story sounds as awesome as it looks
  3. $3,000 -- Location, location, location. There are some shots we can "steal", but several we will need to rent and permit, so that our story's backdrop is as detailed, real and beautiful as the story requires. 
  4. $1,500 -- Production Design. Even the best locations require some Art Direction to make the story feel at home. 
  5. $3,500  -- Insurance. We will be filming under the auspices of SAG/AFTRA, which requires we have the proper insurance to keep all of our players covered and safe. 
  6. $2,500 -- meals/craft services. If you're going to ask artists to work for cheap or free, it is only fair and decent you feed them well.
  7. $1,500 -- Transportation: Fuel, parking, renting a picture-car. LA, baby.
  8. $1,000 -- Contingencies and miscellaneous. Because, as we all know, stuff has a tendency to happen. 
  • If for some reason we do not reach our full funding goal, we will still make our film with whatever funds we have gathered, and we will make it sing.

What You Get

Prizes! Take a look at the Perks section to see some Awesome Rewards we have to thank you for your awesomeness.

What It Means

We understand that our approach to this project presents a risky prospect for the actors and filmmakers. We not only understand the risks; we embrace the risks. As far as we are concerned, the greater the risk the greater the reward, artistically and personally.

We may seem crazy for embracing our "No Retakes/One-Time-Only" rule. Yeah, maybe we are. But it's a good kinda crazy. We believe in this story and in this process. We believe that with the right kind of careful preparation we can walk the edge of crazy without being reckless, and that the results will be as exhilarating for us the creators as they will be for you the audience.

All of the members of the ICON team are well experienced indie filmmakers, who know how to create compelling art on low/no budget with creative efficiency and artistic ingenuity -- coming in ahead of schedule and underbudget. We know that our very best weapon is preparation. To prepare for this project we are extensively rehearsing backstory  -- to help the actors understand their characters/relationships/shared experiences. And the camera crew films the rehearsals -- so they can fully understand the technical and artistic requirements of using a two-camera setup in a fully improvised environment. By production time, the entire team is fully prepared and ready for the challenge.

The ICON creative team is forging new cinematic ground, creating a new form. We believe Living Film will be talked about, explored, implemented and expanded for years to come.

What Happens Next

We intend for ICON to be a viable feature in today's marketplace. Which means a careful strategy of Festival submissions, strategic marketing, and a bid for distribution, whether Theatrical or Digital or both. Whatever happens, ICON is headed soon to a theater/TV/mobile device near you.

What You Can Do

Thanks so much for visiting our Campaign, and for sticking with us this far. We appreciate you! Of course we would love to have your financial support -- but whether or not you contribute financially, there are other ways you can help bring the ICON vision to life:

SHARE! If you believe in what we're doing, share this page on all of your social media platforms. Give us a shout out and let people know how amazing you think this crazy project is gonna be!

Talk us up! Tell friends in person as well as the ones online. Email that crazy rich uncle of yours who always says "If you ever need anything"... Get the Word Out!

Drop us a line.  Moral support is welcome too. If you love what we're doing, let us know. It feels good to feel good.

THANK YOU!

story:
Hard Earth - A Short Film

A young man with an over extended sense of privilege is left a massive inheritance by his dying step father. There's just one last thing he has to do before he can collect...

Marsha Lane Foster, creator of The Hostage Project, directs this funny, clever, and in a strange sense, life affirming film from a screenplay by Earl Hale.

Although Hard Earth is a short film (around 45 minutes), it's much more than that. With this film, Marsha seeks to build a creative community to collaborate on larger scale projects, a virtual idea factory to make our stories come to life through the collaborative magic of cinema. Hard Earth will collectively be our third venture into visual story telling and we wish to keep that momentum going.

Hard Earth is a short film in production directed by Marsha Lane Foster.  Written by Earl Hale. Josh Irwin is the Director of Photography. The film stars Mark Landon Smith, Jay Plyburn, and C.F. Roberts.

But, we need your help!

Principal photography for much of the film has been completed. We are currently shooting the remaining scenes necessary. We will need to raise money to complete the post production process. We're setting a goal of $30,000 to obtain the editing (both image and sound) and special effects hardware necessary to complete this film, as well as meet other important budgetary needs.

  • $15,000 raised will go toward non linear editing equipment, a Digital Audio Workstation, color correction workstation, and studio rental toward needed special effects chroma wall shots.
  • $15,000 will go toward compensation of our amazing actors and to offset some of the location rental and photographic rental costs already incurred, as well as complete the film's website. 
  • We've got some great perks to send you in exchange for your financial help! Exclusive art prints by our director, autographed art by renowned painter C.F. Roberts, limited run, art book prints of the script, signed by the cast and creators with a Blu-ray disc of the movie attached and more!
  • In the event that we don't reach our $30,000 goal, the funds actually collected will be used to meet any outstanding financial obligations toward our actors. They've really committed to their roles and worked really hard to make this story come to life...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways to help us beyond sending money:

  • Like and share our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/HardEarthFilm/
  • Keep up with production news at Marsha Lane Foster's site http://www.lanefosterfineart.com/
  • Follow us on twitter at https://twitter.com/HardEarthFilm
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks!

story:
Kurz-Inhalt:
Nach den merkwürdigen Ereignissen und dem Unfalltod von Andi, stehen Kommissar Moser und sein Kollege Pladl vor einem Rätsel. Was ist in dieser Nacht passiert? Was hat Andi vor seinem Unfall gefilmt? Plötzlich geht ein Notruf ein, der im direkten Zusammenhang steht.

Worum geht es in dem Projekt:
Die erste Staffel "Ebersberg" begeisterte knapp eine halbe Millionen Zuschauer über Facebook, Youtube und Amazon. Jetzt soll die Geschichte in einer zweiten Staffel weiter bzw. zu Ende erzählt werden. Die zweite Staffel soll auf vier Folgen a 20 Minuten aufgeteilt werden. Der in Ebersberg stationierte Kommissar Moser und sein Kollege Pladl stehen vor einem Rätsel, als das blutüberströmte Mädchen Laura auf dem Revier erscheint und sich an nichts mehr erinnern kann. Der Fall ist aber nicht das einzige Erschreckende, wie Moser bald feststellen wird.

Was sind die Ziele und wer ist Zielgruppe:
Mit der Fortsetzung wollen wir die Geschichte rund um die weiße Frau von Ebersberg zu Ende erzählen. Freunde und Fans der Serie sowie alle Horrorfans sollen sich noch einmal gruseln und mit rätseln, bevor die Horrorserie vollends aufgeklärt wird.

Warum sollte jemand dieses Projekt unterstützen:
Unabhängige Filmproduktionen sind nur dann möglich, wenn es Unterstützer und Förderer gibt. Doch große Filmproduktionen riskieren ungern ihre gewohnten Abläufe und trauen sich daher nicht auf deutsche Genreideen zu setzen. Und das, obwohl Deutschland das Land der Märchen, Sagen und Legenden ist. Mit der Unterstützung dieser Produktion wird bewiesen, dass die Zuschauer selber bestimmen wollen und können, was sie sehen wollen und dass es nicht immer deutsche Komödien sein müssen.

Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung:
Das Geld wird ausschließlich für die Produktion der Serie verwendet. Produktionskosten ergeben sich aus Equipment, Locations, Requsiten, Effekte, Maske, Catering und vieles mehr.

Unterstützen via PayPal, Kreditkarte oder Überweisung:
Indiegogo bietet für den europäischen Markt aktuell nur PayPal Bezahlung. Wer kein Konto hat, kann aber via Kreditkarte zahlen. Hierzu musst du nur auf "Unterstützen" klicken und wirst dann via PayPal, auch ohne Konto, weitergleitet. PayPal sichert deine Daten zuverlässig ab.

Eine weitere Möglichkeit ist die direkte Überweisung. Dein Geld wird nach Eingang auf dem Konto sofort hier sichtbar. Trage deinen Namen (wie du öffentlich gezeigt werden möchtest) und "Ebersberg Staffel 2" sowie deinen gewünschten Perk (Dankeschön) in die Verwendungszweck-Zeile ein und schon bist du mit dabei. Anbei die Bank Daten:

Sparda Bank München

IBAN: DE77 7009 0500 0004 5286 54

BIC: GENODEF 1S04

Wir möchten uns an dieser Stelle bei jedem Unterstützer recht herzlich bedanken.

Ihr seid die Besten!!!

story:
The Story

A young girl, Kira, is on the search for her lost cat! Her family is all packed up and ready to move to their new house in the morning. If she can't find her cat by the end of the night, she'll have to leave her friend behind forever!

Expenses

To make this short film, the cast and crew will need to stay alive and be transported! Here is what your contribution will go toward:

  • 2 meals a day for 7 days
  • Gas
  • U-Haul rental (to transport our film equipment)
  • Equipment rental

Filming dates: Nov. 28 - Dec. 7

Post production: Dec. 7 - Jun. 2017

Impact

It's more important to me that this project is worth the time and hard work of those helping to make it, than it is for me to be a cool filmmaker (but I do think and hope the film will turn out pretty rad!).  And if it's worth it to the cast and crew who have already signed on, I can only hope it will be worth a small contribution from you as well!

I've been on too many film sets where it's all about achieving the director's vision and not the collaborative choices and creative compromises that the medium of filmmaking requires. I want to move towards an approach where the director is a magnifying glass that focuses input from all departments.

"(When asked what a director does) I help." - Krzysztof Kieslowski

While my short film won't reach a widespread audience, or impact the way people think about social injustice--it will be a fun, cozy, small scale story that I hope anyone who gets a chance to watch it can enjoy.

Risks & Challenges

We have a few--

  • Working with live cats
  • Working with children
  • Filming at night in the woods in the cold!
  • Practical effects and the safety protocols required
  • Raising enough funds to feed cast/crew 

These are just a few of the challenges we will face, but we look forward to facing and overcoming them!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Sharing this page on Facebook is great. Word of mouth is much appreciated too :)

story:
What is Don't Schmuck It Up? 


Created by Sam Reetz and Juliet Picard, Don't Schmuck It Up is a scripted web series and situational comedy about defying stereotypes in everyday situations.
Jules Veritas (Picard) and Avery Ardente (Reetz) are two millennial reporters taking the ESPN hockey world by storm and redefining what it means to be a career woman in NYC in the process.

Where are we in the production timeline?

Currently, we've filmed and self-produced Episodes 1-4 and are rounding out production on the rest of Season 1 by July 2016. Production costs add up fast, though, and we'd like to pay our stellar cast and crew for all their hard work in making this show concept a reality. We need YOUR help to make this possible, get our name out there to web fests AND get Season 2 funded in time to meet our August 2016 production slate. 

From Left to Right: Sam Reetz (Avery Ardente) & Juliet Picard (Jules Veritas). Photo by Matt Clements. 


How is our show concept different?

Unlike other female-driven web series, Don't Schmuck It Up turns the tables on women in hockey and the classic romantic comedy. It's 30 Rock meets Sex and the City and ESPN's SportsCenter. 

From Left to Right: Sam Reetz (Avery Ardente) & Juliet Picard (Jules Veritas). Photo by Matt Clements. 


How will donations be used?

We can't make it all happen without YOUR support, so we're offering great perks to our fanbase to help us reach our goal. Support our campaign for a chance to get an autographed copy of the Season 1 finale script, be featured in a future episode, meet the cast and crew at the DSIU Wrap Party and so much more!

Wondering how we plan to use what we raise? Here's how we'll distribute our Indiegogo funds:

Meet Team DSIU: The Cast & Crew 

We can't keep swimming upstream without the hard work of our stellar cast and crew.  Meet Team DSIU!

 The Cast


 The Crew

Want to learn more about us? Click on the link below for cast and crew member bios from Season 1:

http://www.millennialethics.com/dont-schmuck-it... 

**Check back soon for more cast & crew updates!**


Join the Team DSIU community

Love the idea, want to help, but not able to donate? Join our Team DSIU community!

By following us on social media and sharing our Indiegogo campaign with your friends, you're helping us spread the word and get our name out there!

For updates on the show, let's connect on:

Vimeo: 

http://vimeo.com/mepcollective 

Twitter:

http://twitter.com/dontschmuckitup 

Instagram:

http://instagram.com/mepcollective

Facebook:

http://facebook.com/mepcollective

Snapchat: 



Thanks for helping us to continue on the Don't Schmuck It Up adventure! Your support means the world!

Created by Sam Reetz and Juliet Picard, Don't Schmuck It Up is a scripted web series and situational comedy about defying stereotypes in everyday situations.Jules Veritas (Picard) and Avery Ardente (Reetz) are two millennial reporters taking the ESPN hockey world by storm and redefining what it means to be a career woman in NYC in the process.


Where are we in the production timeline?
 Currently, we've filmed and self-produced Episodes 1-4 and are rounding out production on the rest of Season 1 by July 2016. Production costs add up fast, though, and we'd like to pay our stellar cast and crew for all their hard work in making this show concept a reality. We need YOUR help to make this possible, get our name out there to web fests AND get Season 2 funded in time to meet our August 2016 production slate. 


From Left to Right: Sam Reetz (Avery Ardente) & Juliet Picard (Jules Veritas). Photo by Matt Clements. 



How is our show concept different? Unlike other female-driven web series, Don't Schmuck It Up turns the tables on women in hockey and the classic romantic comedy. It's 30 Rock meets Sex and the City and ESPN's SportsCenter. 


From Left to Right: Sam Reetz (Avery Ardente) & Juliet Picard (Jules Veritas). Photo by Matt Clements. 


How will donations be used?
We can't make it all happen without YOUR support, so we're offering great perks to our fanbase to help us reach our goal. Support our campaign for a chance to get an autographed copy of the Season 1 finale script, be featured in a future episode, meet the cast and crew at the DSIU Wrap Party and so much more!

Wondering how we plan to use what we raise? Here's how we'll distribute our Indiegogo funds: 

Meet Team DSIU: The Cast & Crew 
We can't keep swimming upstream without the hard work of our stellar cast and crew.  Meet Team DSIU!
 The Cast






 The Crew




Want to learn more about us? Click on the link below for cast and crew member bios from Season 1:

http://www.millennialethics.com/dont-schmuck-it... 

**Check back soon for more cast & crew updates!**   
Join the Team DSIU community Love the idea, want to help, but not able to donate? Join our Team DSIU community!
By following us on social media and sharing our Indiegogo campaign with your friends, you're helping us spread the word and get our name out there!
For updates on the show, let's connect on:
Vimeo: 
http://vimeo.com/mepcollective 
Twitter:
http://twitter.com/dontschmuckitup 
Instagram:
http://instagram.com/mepcollective
Facebook:
http://facebook.com/mepcollective
Snapchat: 




Thanks for helping us to continue on the Don't Schmuck It Up adventure! Your support means the world!

story:
BFM

We are the Birmingham Film Movement and our passion is telling stories for screen. We are a group of individuals who have worked all over the UK and overseas making Film and Television. Our ambition is to create a stronger film presence here in the Midlands and we want the opportunity to showcase the talent the Midlands has to offer the Film world. 

The 45 is a film being made with a lot of passion, a lot of time, a lot of love and a lot of determination. We are extremely passionate about making this project and we have found an incredibly talented cast to bring the story to life;

Ashley Rice, David Atkins, Keiren Hamilton-Amos, James Edge & Luanda Holness.

This project has been in development for over a year now and we are so close to making it a reality. For many of us it is the chance to showcase the skills we have learnt from working in this great industry.

Our project is very ambitious. The film is set completely at night and outside on location; a challenging task for any film crew. But we have a very talented and experienced team to see us through the long nights.

As with all film shoots there are plenty of risks but we have taken every step possible to control and minimize these. Everyone involved is putting in countless hours of preparation and planning into the project to make it as safe and as organised as possible. 

Alongside our determination and hard-work, your support will help us achieve our goals, hire kit, pay for locations & feed the crew - probably the most important thing! 

This project is just the beginning; we plan to learn, grow and aim to develop more projects together and we will hopefully create a stronger film presence in the Midlands and across the UK.

Please check out our gallery for videos including a video from the director Giles Dearn.

story:
THE GOOD NEWS

There is a wealth of solutions that is ripe for sharing, applying and scaling across the globe.

By applying knowledge of the land and farming techniques that have been improved and passed on from generation to generation for hundreds, sometimes thousands of years, farming communities all over the world still produce healthy and plentiful food in harmony with nature.

It’s time to share their stories with respect and deep curiosity...

 

OUR MISSION

We want to raise awareness about the destructive impact of our food system on our health and the environment; and show the wealth of solutions that indigenous farming holds to these global challenges. 

 

ABOUT THE DOCUMENTARY

In Memoria Nueva Agostino, Sava, Stefano and Luke will live for 4 months in remote regions of Brazil, Mexico and Colombia, hosted by 4 indigenous farming communities that are part of Terra Madre (for more info scroll down to Supported By). 

We will live with these communities to learn, to understand, and to shoot a documentary that celebrates the resilience of their culture, the richness of their food and the collective knowledge they preserved over the ages. 

We will shoot throughout our entire stay in Latin America from October 2016 - January 2017. Upon return, we will go straight into post production, and premiere our film in May 2017. 

 

YOUR SUPPORT

With your support you help us to create a beautiful and powerful documentary that we will share with universities, food producers, entrepreneurs and consumers across the globe to inspire them to take action and work towards a sustainable food system.

A portion of the proceeds from the documentary will go to initiatives that support the communities that host us and promote sustainable farming.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like our Facebook page and help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to share Memoria Nueva with your family and friends.

 

FUNDING NEEDS €45.000+

Making the Documentary (€37.500)

Production Equipment: €8.000 + Editing: €9.000 + Music & Sound Mixing: €5.000 + Colour Correction: €2.000 + Travel & Transportation: €9.000 + Design, DVD Printing and Distribution: €2.500 + Insurance & Health: €2.000

Reach, Promote and Inspire (7.500+)

This budget is not limited as we strive to reach even more universities, entrepreneurs, food producers and consumers through media coverage, conferences, speeches, and more.

...the higher the crowdfunding, the greater the impact of Memoria Nueva...

 

THE BIG PERKS EXPLAINED

6 Wines + Nonna Rosa's Delicacies (€750)

Good things often start with great food. Nonna Rosa's packages served countless of dinners bringing smiles and wonderful memories to us and our friends in Milan. Now you can bring happiness to your table with your very own organic survival pack. 

We will personally deliver 1 Box of Premium wine (Value €220) + 1 box of organic happiness: olive oil, pasta, tomato sauce, jam, honey, dried tomatoes, olives, herbs and more. All products made with love by Agostino's family in Puglia. 

2 nights at Romantic Biohotel (€850)

Agostino and Stefano spend most of their childhood playing in the olive groves and vineyards surrounding Lama di Luna, an 18th century Puglian Masseria, renovated and transformed by their father, Pietro, in to a beautiful Biohotel. From an early age, Ago and Stefano were made part of the  re-discovery of old traditions through the usage of traditional architecture and feng shui during the renovation to the way of cultivating organic food rooted in Puglian culture. 

This perk includes two nights for two people at Lama di Luna. Sleep in thick vaulted bedrooms surrounded by 190 hectares of olive groves, vineyards and fruit trees. Relax at the pool or visit the picturesque towns and beaches in its vicinity. For more info and pictures scroll down. The perk is valid from April - December 2017 (excluding August).

Exclusive Premiere Package (€1.500)

Two nights for two people at our Biohotel Lama di Luna (see pictures above) during the premiere of Memoria Nueva. Includes: Two tickets to the premiere + Dinner with the Team. Be the first to see our documentary and make sure to bring a good suitcase, since we will not let you leave without our organic olive oil and other Puglian delights. 

Create Your Own Perk Edition 1 (€3.000)

Call us and we'll be happy to help you create your own reward package. Choose from the best organic food, wines and olive oil that Puglia has to offer OR let us organise an unforgettable trip of UP TO 4 DAYS for you through this beautiful region. Want both options? No problem, we can mix our offer as you wish.

Create Your Own Perk Edition 2 (€5.000)

Call us and we'll be happy to help you create your own reward package. Choose from the best organic food, wines and olive oil that Puglia has to offer OR let us organise an unforgettable trip of UP TO 5 DAYS for you through this beautiful region. Want both options? No problem, we can mix our offer as you wish. 

Join Us in Mexico for 5 Days (€6.000)

With this you'll be living with us in one Mexican community for 5 days during November 2016 and you'll be a part of the actual documentary. This is an unique opportunity and by far the most precious perk. 

 

THE TEAM

Agostino Petroni - Gastronome

Italian (25). A true Slow Food aficionado, Agostino is a manifestation of old traditions and new ideas: As a “rooted explorer”, he sees life from a food perspective. While sharing a flat during their business studies at Bocconi University,  Sava and Ago laid out the plans for a sustainable food venture. An idea that gradually evolved in to our project, inspired by Ago’s experiences during his master at the Slow Food University (UNISG).

UNISG - MA Food Culture & Communication

Sava Riaskoff - Social Entrepreneur

Dutch (25). An entrepreneurial idealist, Sava seeks to combine technology and big ideas with social impact. At ESADE Business School, he became fascinated with Socratic Dialogue: a powerful method to find answers to universal questions, or build bridges between opposing world views, based on consensus and mutual understanding. A passion that will surely help us to go below the surface and uncover more...

ESADE Business School - MSc Innovation & Entrepreneurship

Stefano Petroni - Film Director

Italian (22). Stefano is a natural storyteller who loves to capture and reshape life through the lens of his camera, something he gets to do every day while studying film at Bournemouth University in the UK. Growing up on his family’s biomasseria Lama di Luna, sustainable farming and Italian food culture run through his veins. It was only a matter of time until his roots and his passion for filmmaking would come together...

Bournemouth University - BA Television Production

Luke Namer - Film Maker

American (25). After working in Africa and Latin America for Global Brigades, an international development organization, Luke discovered how generalized media portrayal of low income countries often dehumanizes local lives and renders local communities voiceless in their own story. As a result, Luke founded Redefined Films, a platform that democratizes media and empowers stories that matter, such as our project.

Cornell University - BA Political Science & Government 

 

SUPPORTING TEAM

Alison Staffin - Graphic designer

American (21). Alison is a senior biology major who has found her calling in graphic design. Fueled by her curiosity for understanding the world around us, she focuses on designing for organizations that aim to share underrepresented perspectives. She was introduced to our project after interning for Redefined Films, where she created marketing materials and other deliverables for their recent documentaries. Alison will create informative graphics for us to strengthen our social media and press campaign. 

Boston University - BA Biology

 

KICKOFF EVENT

September 23 @ Terra Madre Salone Del Gusto 2016

We have been invited by Slow Food to present our project at this year’s ‘Terra Madre Salone del Gusto’, together with the representatives of the Terra Madre communities that will host us. We await you at our kickoff event on Saturday September 23rd at 14:30h in the stand of the University of Gastronomic Science (UNISG).

‘Terra Madre Salone del Gusto’ is the largest food and wine fair in the world. Around 250,000 chefs, scientists, food producers, students, and politicians from over 150 countries will gather to share their food and their vision for the future of our global food system. The event will take place from September 22nd to September 26th in Turin, Italy. Come join us!

 

SUPPORTED BY

Slow Food was founded in 1989 to prevent the disappearance of local food cultures and traditions. Since then, it has grown into a global movement involving millions of people in over 160 countries, working to ensure access to good, clean and fair food for everyone.

Slow Food’s world vision revolves around the idea that food is tied to many other aspects of life, including culture, politics, agriculture and the environment. Through our food choices we can collectively influence how food is cultivated, produced and distributed, and as a result bring about great change.

Terra Madre is an international network spread out over 150 countries, uniting food producers, fishers, breeders, chefs, academics, students, NGOs and representatives of local communities. They work on a new approach to food production and gastronomy, based on the defense of biodiversity, environmental protection and respect for local cultures and traditions.

The ESADE Entrepreneurship Institute (EEI) is dedicated to academic excellence in the field of entrepreneurship and a variety of related subjects. Their mission is to become the international reference point in the field of entrepreneurship, venture capital, entrepreneurial creativity, as well as innovation and growth through an active educational model, a rigorous research programme and an active presence in the social debate. 

RedefinedFilms.org is a social action media website that shifts the media paradigm by changing the way content is driven. Redefined empowers socially conscious citizens to tell stories that matter by enabling them to raise awareness and funds for the cause they care about. 

 

PRESS

story:
WHY?

Why should you be interested in this project?

There a lot of movies and ideas that competes for your attention and your money of course :) + the problem of homeless guys are so complicated and diverse that any kind of help seems like a tiny drop to the ocean. And this quickly discourages many of us.  + some of the homeless people want to be homeless and most of them have problems with addiction and there is no one universal solution. 

But there is one thing that we all should be clear about - very powerful but simple truth  - most of the men and women whose lives are ruined and they had to sleep on the streets because they lost their homes due to different reasons CANNOT get back to normal lives by themselves. Something should happen. And in most cases it is a financial help and in some rare cases it is a boon - gift from the heavens - a baby. 
So help me and my crew to tell this amazing story and remind the world this powerful message. 




WHO I AM? 
Filmmaker - Olzhas Nurbayev, an aspiring filmmaker from Kazakhstan. Currently am I finishing MFA degree from New York Film Academy. The Boon is my final project. I am planning to go with this short movie to festivals.


WHAT DO I GET FOR MY CONTRIBUTION?
Aside from the great feeling that you are an indifferent human being who not only supports the young filmmaker from Kazakhstan but also contributes to the project that rise homeless people problem in the society, you will have an opportunity to literally help homeless people by giving real dinner or warm piece of cloth (details in rewards part). Little things that means a lot for those who is in need. And you will get photo and video evidences that proves it. 

HOW THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT?

We need $3,000 dollars for permission to shoot, for permission to shoot a baby (we have a baby in our movie who is found by homeless, if you remember :) ) , for renting and buying all our props. Part of the money will go to my crew . We have an extremely talented DP, producer and sound mixer.  

We have some great perks for those who can help: opportunity to give a dinner of warm piece of cloth to those who in need, homeless guys in LA.

story:
RheinoRex in partnership with Whatever the Mood bring you a web series for the new times.

Short Summary

THE SO-SO YOU DON’T KNOW web series is a dark comedy about urban loneliness.  We all know what it’s like to search for love to take away the emptiness inside, only to find out it’s an inside job.  Therapist Rhonda Vasalo is running a Groupon special for new clients, but little do these New Yorkers know what they signed up for.  Love is hard, but self-love is harder.

The characters in each episode run the gamut of race, creed, age and sexual orientation.  What everyone has in common is the need to connect.

I am a filmmaker who has shot over 60 music videos (including 2Pac’s last and one for Amy Winehouse), commercials, short films and a feature.  I was selected by Filmmaker Magazine as one of their “Top 25 New Faces of Independent Film,” and have been reviewed by the New York Times and featured on radio shows.     

Help me raise $30,000 so that I can shoot all episodes of Season One and get it out to the public.  This money will go towards hiring local NY crew and actors, pay for locations, permits, lighting, sound equipment, post-production crew, sound design, music composition, and lobster tail for my daily lunch.  Just kidding.  About the daily part.

Your donations will help bring this project to into the hearts and minds of others.  The goal of all of my projects, particularly this one, is to touch and uplift people using the guise of humor and entertainment.  We all seek out stories that resonate with us, and I promise you this one will do just that.

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous donations will earn you some amazing things, like a free therapy session with the show's actual therapist or a day on the set with the cast and crew.

The Impact

Have you often craved video content that resonates with you in a real way?  This show is a chance to connect to people's hearts, let the lonely know they're not alone, and turn the challenges we all face into laughter.  You contributing means putting legs on this project - taking it from script to screen - putting something good out there.  Entertainment with humanity.  You can even submit one of your own tales of love/loneliness for a chance at having an episode written about it.

With a proven track record of over 25 years writing and directing for the big and small screens (see my other web series on https://www.youtube.com/user/MsGrooveChic), I have solid experience taking things from the page to the people.

Risks & Challenges

Independent filmmaking is always a challenge.  But with any amount raised, we will shoot episode by episode, relentlessly going forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

If times are tight (I understand that!), then you can still help by getting the word out there!  Make some noise about this.  Share on social media.  Tell your friends.   Use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!
story_txt:
RheinoRex in partnership with Whatever the Mood bring you a web series for the new times.
Short Summary
THE SO-SO YOU DON’T KNOW web series is a dark comedy about urban loneliness.  We all know what it’s like to search for love to take away the emptiness inside, only to find out it’s an inside job.  Therapist Rhonda Vasalo is running a Groupon special for new clients, but little do these New Yorkers know what they signed up for.  Love is hard, but self-love is harder.
The characters in each episode run the gamut of race, creed, age and sexual orientation.  What everyone has in common is the need to connect.
I am a filmmaker who has shot over 60 music videos (including 2Pac’s last and one for Amy Winehouse), commercials, short films and a feature.  I was selected by Filmmaker Magazine as one of their “Top 25 New Faces of Independent Film,” and have been reviewed by the New York Times and featured on radio shows.     
Help me raise $30,000 so that I can shoot all episodes of Season One and get it out to the public.  This money will go towards hiring local NY crew and actors, pay for locations, permits, lighting, sound equipment, post-production crew, sound design, music composition, and lobster tail for my daily lunch.  Just kidding.  About the daily part.
Your donations will help bring this project to into the hearts and minds of others.  The goal of all of my projects, particularly this one, is to touch and uplift people using the guise of humor and entertainment.  We all seek out stories that resonate with us, and I promise you this one will do just that.

What We Need & What You Get
Your generous donations will earn you some amazing things, like a free therapy session with the show's actual therapist or a day on the set with the cast and crew.

The Impact
Have you often craved video content that resonates with you in a real way?  This show is a chance to connect to people's hearts, let the lonely know they're not alone, and turn the challenges we all face into laughter.  You contributing means putting legs on this project - taking it from script to screen - putting something good out there.  Entertainment with humanity.  You can even submit one of your own tales of love/loneliness for a chance at having an episode written about it.
With a proven track record of over 25 years writing and directing for the big and small screens (see my other web series on https://www.youtube.com/user/MsGrooveChic), I have solid experience taking things from the page to the people.

Risks & Challenges
Independent filmmaking is always a challenge.  But with any amount raised, we will shoot episode by episode, relentlessly going forward.

Other Ways You Can Help
If times are tight (I understand that!), then you can still help by getting the word out there!  Make some noise about this.  Share on social media.  Tell your friends.   Use the Indiegogo share tools!
THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!

story:
The story is about a 14 year old girl who is driven by love and jealousy that embarks on a journey to protect her sister from her father's ritualistic molestation. She uses her learnt sexuality to expose and symbolically castrate her dad. She doesn't consider the cost of her actions. 

The film explores the complex emotions of the abused and abuser. It is a compelling story as it looks at abuse in an exciting way. 

We are a crew of 7 Film School graduates based in Central London. Together we have made 14 short films collectively in a period of 10 months. We are highly skilled in the each of our disciplines as film makers.

Contributors will help us achieve in bringing awareness to the plight of child abuse. You will also assist us in getting great production value for the short film, allowing us to enter festival to win.

We need to raise funds for location, props, transport, equipment, post-production and marketing as well as a grand piano for one of our main scene.  

If we do not reach our goal of additional funding, it will impact the over all quality of our Short Film.

We wouldn’t be able to get a grand piano, additional gear and a great location.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is not securing the location of the shoot. We are working with children which can be challenging due the sensitive nature of the piece. With your help, if we get a grand piano, the care of keeping/ transporting the fragile instrument. 

Challenge of shooting this piece in 4 days. Challenge of getting the shots without the correct equipment and story telling tools.

How we will overcome these challenges, if by getting a paid chaperone to take care of the children.

By using a different instrument other than a grand piano.

With the proper gear provided, it will help us speed up the process of making this short film.

If you are unable to help us financially, please share this message with your friends and family.

If you are in London and you know of a location (house) with a grand piano or one that can house a grand piano. Please let us know. Thank you very much.

story:
We love tech and we love a do-it-yourself approach that get's kid's learning in a creative way. But too often tech and craft toys are limited to indoor activities. We believe that kids and their toys shouldn't be limited to inside or outside, creative or active. That's why we created Dronoid, a safe, easy to construct, easy to customize and easy to fly drone toy for kids.

We at Dronoid believe in rigorous quality control. We have set up an overseas office to inspect the products on site, as well as third party testing facilities to ensure a quality product.

Our goal was to make drone flying even more fun for the whole family. That’s why Dronoid is modular. Sure, it’s a flying drone, but it’s also a land rover and an all-terrain tank—all in the same toy!

Dronoid lets kids ages 8 and up build the toys they play with, making it a fun, outdoor activity for parents and kids to enjoy together.

Let your kid’s personality fly. The Dronoid Starter Kit includes 1 Drone, Camera, Charger, Remote Control, Propellers, Lithium Ion Battery, Transmitter and 1GB card.

You can choose the Good Guy in white and blue, the Bad Guy in black and red, or the Princess in white and pink.

You can even customize Dronoid by choosing your favorite face, body, and color—Dronoid lets your kid’s personality shine!

Fun attachments like an HD camera let kids film movies anywhere their Dronoid goes, with more fun features always on the way.

Rule the ground, no matter how rough the terrain. The Dronoid Tank Kit includes 2 large tank tread and wheel attachments.

Not your ordinary remote-controlled car. The Dronoid Rover Kit includes 2 large wheel attachments, 1 small wheel attachments, and 2 arm attachments.

You can customize your Dronoid with a new face and body, currently available in Orange, Aquamarine or Commando Green.
