story:
Welcome to LGBTea.com

The freedom and good things in life are meant to be enjoyed, tea is no exception.

LGBTea.com was founded by Katerina Markakis. Katerina has been a tea lover for many years. Sampling and finding interesting and exotic flavors has always been one of her distinct passions. Her knowledge of tea, its benefits, history and how their unique flavors blend has propelled her to launch her popular blog 1001teafacts.com which attracts thousands of tea lovers,  drinkers and even the novices of tea who are interested in finding out the great health benefits tea has to offer.

Katerina, being a lifelong avid supporter of LGBT civil rights, brainstormed an idea that it would be a dream come true to form a business where both her passions can be married into a beautiful union, which she has cleverly named LGBTea.com. Katerina is married to her wonderful and loving husband George and from that marriage she has learnt first-hand the impact of what discrimination can do to people who chose to be happy in a perceived "unconventional" way. Katerina’s marriage to George is what you would call a May-December marriage. Through their experience, they have learnt first-hand not only how to overcome this, but it has given them the ability to encourage others to embrace their rights to love and live freely and openly. LGBTea.com formed out her love for the LGBT community, will be a guiding light for the LGBT community, giving them access to discussion forums, LGBT directory and resources and of course a marketplace for flavorful and exotic teas from around the world. Let’s all just love, laugh, live and drink tea!

 

Our Mission

LGBTea.com feels strongly about the civil liberties for all, but most importantly for the LGBT community. We are striving to create a global initiative where all are accepting and supportive of the right to love, live and enjoy life the way we choose. With Katerina’s passion for tea, LGBTea.com will make it its endeavor to encourage the LGBT community to embrace their individuality while offering the finest and freshest teas and ingredients and other tea related items sourced worldwide. We are committed to operate in a socially responsible manner, protecting and nurturing a diverse and accepting culture for future generations.

Our Teas

How We Support Our Community

LGBTea.com is a strong supporter of LGBT rights and Civil rights in general. As such, we have been a supporter of many organizations that fight for equal liberty. Some of the ones we are a member of include the HRC, The Trevor Project and LGBT Foundation. To further solidify our support for the LGBT community, we are forming the LGBTea Foundation, a non-profit organization that will be committed to providing the much needed support and resources the LGBT community needs in areas such as youth advancement and civil liberties on a whole.

In addition to selling tea, LGBTea.com will also be an outlet where people can participate in our LGBT Communities discussions and forums as well as to be able to find LGBT friendly companies and resources in our LGBT Directories worldwide.

LGBTea Communities

LGBTea Directories

LGBTea Marketplace

Our main purpose is to be more than just a tea company; we will be a guiding light for tea lovers and the LGBT community worldwide.

 

Goal to reach! $25,000

Our Goal

The goal of this campaign is to give us the capital we need to order more products from countries worldwide. We at LGBTea.com believe is providing our customers with the best products such as a vast variety of exotic teas, gifts, books and tea ware from artisans across the globe.

We are also in need of funding to brand our products with our own unique packaging as well as creating our uniquely designed Tea and LGBT gift baskets for all occasions. We are also in need of a warehouse space for storage as well as a distribution point.

Even though our website is partially complete, three of our main core areas are yet to be developed. These are our LGBT Marketplace, LGBT Directories and LGBT Communities. These three areas will be an integral part of our business as it lets us be somewhat of an encyclopedic website for all things Tea and LGBT. Customers will be able to find resources, news, LGBT friendly listings, curated tea and LGBT blogs, Tea facts and exquisite artisan products from across the world.

We will also be opening the opportunity for Cafes and restaurants worldwide to be a part of our community with our LGBTeas Served Here Program listed below:

LGBTeas Served Here Program:

This gives Cafes, Restaurants, etc, the opportunity to join our program which will give them, not only an enhanced directory listing, along with the marketing features they chose, but also a tea assortment box to be able to serve LGBTeas in their establishment along with a “LGBTeas Served Here” Window decal for their front window.  These Establishments will be promoted online as a place where people can go and enjoy our teas.

 

We are all for giving back to the community and the cause we serve. By backing our campaign, a portion of all sales of our perks will be donated to the LGBTea Foundation. As mentioned above, the LGBTea Foundation is being formed to help provide much needed resources for the LGBT community. 

 

What will the funds be used for?

  • Develop our product packaging
  • Acquire a warehouse for storage and distribution
  • Get the word out - Marketing our brand and cause
  • Website development – Creating our LGBT Marketplace, LGBT Communities and LGBT Directory portals
  • Product acquisition of exotics teas, tea ware, books, Gifts and Gift Baskets
  • Implementing our Cafes/Restaurant participation program

 

What’s in it For You? 

Because we are so grateful for your contribution, we have some great perks available to show just how happy we are that you have chosen to be an integral part of our start-up team.

Mouth Watering Perks

Not only can you purchase all perks listed on our campaign, but you also have the option of buying them for friends and family for the holiday season and we will send them as gifts on your behalf. How neat is that?!! We've got you covered for the holiday season.

Please note:

  • We can only Ship the Above 5 Perks to the USA and the European Union
  • If you purchase a Perk that requires you to make a selection of Tea(s), you will receive an email survey at the end of the Campaign for you to provide us with your selections and any other instructions you have for us!

Please Note: Gift cards can be used on our site at www.LGBTea.com  for Teas, Teaware & Gifts, Books, Gift Baskets and much more. Please provide the email address of the recipients you would like the gift cards to be sent to for the holidays. An explanation on how to redeem their gift cards will be explained within the email.

Don't think our perks stop here...not a chance! We want to give you the opportunity to read all the wonderful things your support will help us achieve. Bellow, you will find our additional, AMAZING perks in the form of gift baskets packaged with our teas that you'll just want to devour.

 

Now for those delectable additional perks I mentioned

Please Note:

Gift baskets can only be shipped to the continental United States and , if tea(s) selections are required, you will be sent  a survey at the completion of the campaign to determine your tea choices.

story:
JONAS is set in the Deep South about a teenage kid named Jonas growing up in a rural town in 1973 . We find Jonas on a hot afternoon the day of his eighteenth birthday; bailing on one of his last days of high school for a day by the pool with his carnivalesque cousin Tyler and the doe-eyed Susan; his new fling. His only worry involves steering clear of his careworn mother Jonna. As a young, single mother, Jonna makes it her goal to keep Jonas in her cross-hairs; ensuring that he does what's expected of him as a young man who's reveling in his youth and taking advantage of every leisure that small town living has to offer.

 

   Photographs have been an integral part of my upbringing and perspective as a film maker. It's where it all started for me. One of the defining inspirations behind the film and its direction are a number of photographs taken by photographers the likes of Danny Lyon, William Eggleston, Stephen Shore, and the late William Gedney. Their work undeniably brought a great wealth of inspiration when setting out on Jonas.

 

"William Gedney, Appalachia"

It's important to note that our story does take place in the early seventies but that being said it's rooted in the Deep South within a distinctly rural town. We'll still see a lot of influence pulled from the 60's  that will inform the look of the film. I want to focus on capturing how much the past influences current and future generations.

Jonas will be shot utilizing vintage spherical lenses with a traditional approach to shooting style that effectively highlights the actors performances as well as the rural landscapes in order to garner the full experience of time, place, and performance. 

        

 

The film will be shot in full color but there are still many unique elements to B&W photography taken during the period that I am easily inspired by. With color out of the way, so much of black and white photography puts special intent on capturing the right moment and like any great photograph one single image can communicate a much larger story. 

   

 

 

 

http://www.michaelfloresphoto.com/

 

       

 

             

In order to round out the rest of our crew, capture every last bit of this exciting story, and cut it into a reality, we need those green backs! To keep the big dream alive. (and pay for a long and expensive grocery list)  The monies gets diced up accordingly...

x  The Essentials  x

  • Cast Members: There’s only a hand full of actors and while most are warm and generous, I gotta give em something.
     
  • Crew Compensation: It’s not going to be much (probably the bare minimum) but I’m much too awkward to ask someone to work for an “IMDB Credit.”
     
  • On Set Meals: If you’re going to ask someone to work a 12-hour day they need to be fed properly. Nothing says we can’t afford to do what we’re doing like a continental breakfast before sunrise.
     
  • Equipment: No I’m not shooting this on 35mm with a sexy Panavision System but I’m not shooting it hand held on my iPhone either. We gotta go to a rental house and rent a van full of expensive camera and rigging equipment that will probably be dropped in the pool on day one anyway.
     
  • Insurance: for above mentioned ruined camera gear.

Movies are important, and as any one with a soul would agree: necessary. For myself and for hopefully those of you reading this, very few moments compare to the all encompassing and immeasurable satisfaction that comes from a great film.  It makes you come alive and takes away the slog of the mundane. All reasons well worth the price of admission.. or contribution!

Share the Mullah! Share this page with people you know!

story:
What's it about?

All the Things You Are is a short film about a granddaughter, Taylor, and grandmother, Marion shortly after the passing of their grandfather and husband, Paul. One day, they try to cheer themselves up by going to the mall - but an unexpected moment occurs to remind them that while Paul is not physically here, he lives on in other ways, and specifically, through music.

This film is written and directed by me, and takes inspiration from my own experience with my grandfather. His love of music influenced me to this day and I want to pay tribute to him through this film.

What We Need & What You Get

My grandmother is gracious enough to let us use her house in New Jersey for filming. That takes care of location, which is great! But...

  • Transportation: Getting all of the lovely crew members and actors who have decided to work on this project is another story. It can get quite expensive to transport everyone since we are all coming from New York! Our equipment, borrowed from NYU, also needs to be transported down for the two days of filming. Your donation will help us immensely for transportation funds!
  • Food: Our other biggest expense is food for the crew. While its a relatively small crew, we still need to be well fed and able to work hard for the film. Your donation will also help for food funds!

As you can see, our main funding necessities are food and transportation. Anything can help!

The Impact & Ways You Can Help

Besides the utmost gratitude from me and my family for making this dream come alive, you will be a part of this amazing experience every step of the way! It means so much to me for this film to be created, and I really can't thank you enough in advance for even the smallest of a donation. For my grandfather, I know that he is smiling down as this film becomes fully realized.

You will receive different gifts depending on how much you donate, but anything is appreciated! And most of all, you will 100% be credited~!

Please consider sharing this campaign even if you cannot donate - you may never know!

Thank you!

-Sara

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Brandon Hugo Arroyo, a Junior in the SUNY Purchase Film Conservatory. As a Puerto Rican filmmaker, I find that the discussion of identity provides its hand rather simply in my life. The question of purpose or place, as one grows older, is something that overlooks the steps taken to achieve what one has earned. With this film, I plan on telling a story that shares a coming of age tale that simply seeks to appreciate the sacrifices made by parents to pursue our own individual voices.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $2,800 to go towards cast&crew, food, transportation, and location. As well as any art direction and design work needed to promote the film. 

The Impact

The impact of this film is small but speaks to a larger political issue in cinema as well as the United States. The misrepresentation and underrepresentation of Women and Latinos in media needs to be better handled. As a filmmaker, as a spectator, as a participant in this discussion, your voice in contribution makes the impact of the film all the more apparent.

story:
Welcome to the crowdfunding page for SEEDS OF RENAISSANCE:

a film about the artistic value of food growing!

I am an Italian freelance video journalist. I'd like to bring you straight into the scenery, the lives, the techniques and the personal stories of some of the most passionate Italian local food growers and contemporary artists.

I am inviting you to get involved in this project, to allow us to cover the post-production fees and continue the project!

If our goal is met, we will also be able to promote SEEDS OF RENAISSANCE to become a web series, because there are many other stories that deserve to be told, both in Italy and abroad, so reach out! For us even the smallest contribution is vital, to let us know you are curious and you think this film deserves to be completed and the project continued!

 

What can I find in Seeds of Renaissance – the documentary?

Starting from a specific land, we tell you about:

-rare and unique food that comes only from that agricultural area

-the special and sustainable techniques used to produce it

-some food growers of the region, their production choices and personal stories

-some contemporary artists of the region, their lives and the story of their works

-the bonds between these artists and food growers

-what agriculture and art have in common and how they can inspire each other

-a travel itinerary searching art collections/works of contemporary art, agricultural products, wines and kitchen

-a recipe using the described products...and much more!

 

About Seeds of Renaissance - the project

Thanks to your support, we would like to:

1/ finish the first documentary/episode, in two versions: linear and interactive (webdoc)

2/ start a new episode

3/ create a community where the people interested to apply the special sustainable farming practices as seen in the different episodes, get in touch with the food growers that use them.

 

What you can do

If you like the project and you would like it to continue and to see the documentary finished,

please send us some love and your free contribution!

 

Your opinion and advice is very important for us. Please let us know whether you like this project or not and how would you implement it. If you know about any story of art and food with a strong local identity that you wish to be told, please write to us! We will be happy to evaluate it together.

 

We will also be very grateful if you spread the word among your friends and share our campaign on the social platforms:

Facebook: @seedsrenaissance

Twitter: @seeds_renaiss

Instagram: seedsrenaissance

 

Benvenuti sulla pagina per il crowdfunding di SEEDS OF RENAISSANCE: un film sul valore artistico dell'agricoltura!

Sono una video giornalista freelance italiana, e vorrei portarvi dentro i paesaggi, le vite, le tecniche e le storie personali di alcuni fra i più appassionati produttori e artisti contemporanei piemontesi.

Vi invito a lasciarvi coinvolgere in questo progetto, per permetterci di coprire i costi di post-produzione e continuare il progetto!

Se il nostro obiettivo verrà raggiunto grazie a voi, potremo anche promuovere SEEDS OF RENAISSANCE per trasformarlo in una serie web, perché ci sono moltissime altre storie che meritano di essere raccontate, in Italia e non solo, quindi aiutateci! Per noi anche il più piccolo contributo è vitale, per farci sapere che siete curiosi e pensate che questo documentario merita di essere terminato e il progetto proseguito!

 

Che cosa trovo in Seeds of Renaissance – il documentario?

Partendo da un territorio specifico vi racconteremo:

-di cibi unici e rari che provengono solo da quell'area;

-delle tecniche speciali usate per produrli nel rispetto dell'ambiente;

-di alcuni produttori agricoli di quei luoghi, delle loro scelte produttive e delle loro storie personali;

-di alcuni artisti contemporanei della zona, della loro vita e della storia delle loro opere;

-dei legami di artisti e produttori fra loro;

-del modo in cui agricoltura e arte possono ispirarsi a vicenda e cosa hanno in comune;

-di un possibile itinerario alla ricerca di collezioni/opere d'arte contemporanea, prodotti agricoli, vini e cucina;

-di una ricetta che mette insieme i prodotti raccontati....e molto altro!

 

A proposito del progetto Seeds of Renaissance

Grazie al vostro supporto, vorremmo:

1/ terminare il primo documentario/episodio, in due versioni: lineare e interattivo (webdoc);

2/ iniziare un nuovo episodio;

3/ creare una comunità dove persone interessate ad applicare le particolari tecniche agricole descritte nelle varie puntate si mettano in contatto con i produttori che le usano per impararle.

 

Cosa potete fare

Se vi piace il progetto,vorreste farlo proseguire e vedere il documentario terminato, andate su:

https://igg.me/at/sor

e mandateci un po' di affetto e il vostro libero contributo!

 

La vostra opinione e i vostri consigli sono molto importanti per noi. Scriveteci per dirci se il progetto vi piace oppure no, e come vorreste vederlo sviluppato.

Se avete suggerimenti su storie fra arte e cibo con un forte legame territoriale che vi piacerebbe fossero raccontate, saremo felici di valutarle insieme.

 

Vi saremmo molto grati se vorrete anche spargere la voce fra i vostri amici e condividere la campagna sui social dove Seeds of Renaissance è presente:

Facebook: @seedsrenaissance

Twitter: @seeds_renaiss

Instagram: seedsrenaissance

story:
My name is Kelvin Torres Alicea and I am the writer and director of New Kid in Town. I am currently a full time student at Full Sail University. My class and I have worked diligently to get this project off of its feet. From the Script to the Pre-Visualization process, we’ve done everything as a unified team. We have worked on other sets together and we know what we have to do to work as a well-oiled machine when it comes to production. We are confident that this movie will come out to be spectacular.

 

The story starts off with the introduction of Aunt Maria’s apartment and Victor settling into his new home. In this part of the film we are informed of both of the character’s social standpoint in relation to each other, and society. We also learn that Aunt Maria can relate to Victor more than he knows.

Leading into further in the story we get introduced to our main antagonist (Rodney), and lead support character (Bryant). These two characters are really what provide the “meat” and flavor to the movie because they influence Victor’s emotions directly. Furthermore, we see the Victor’s character change in the film in this section of the film.

Lastly after the big montage scene that is where the climax of the film happens, and all the loose ends are being tied to deliver the big payoff at the end of the film. The film expresses self-determination in these harsh times where people think other races are superior to others. There are people that are going to try to surpass you in life, but it’s all about getting the help you need to bypass it and move on.

         

 

We live in a time where there is still discrimination amongst us. Some suffer more than others but at the end of the day we are not treated equally just because we are different. This movie shows that even though things in life are uncontrollably unfair, you CAN get through these hurdles with grit and dedication. So, we feel that this short film would inspire those who feel suppressed by those around them to pursue their dreams.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We thank you for your support even if it isn't financially related. We invite you to join us on social media.

story:
I'm currently an undergrad senior at Ithaca College with a B.F.A in Film, Photography, and Visual Arts and a minor in Animation. The Horrible Truth About Birthdays is the final film I'm making for my Motion Graphics and Animation course, the last class I'll need to complete my minor. 

It's probably, most definitely, very likely, like literally, the last college film I'll ever make.

This is one of my biggest passion projects yet, and I'm excited to get it going. 

The Horrible Truth About Birthdays is a dark short film based off of Blue's Clues and one of the many theories on why Steve Burns originally left the show: that acting in front of a green screen and talking to yourself will drive you insane. 

The short includes both live action and animation, just like in Blue's Clues.

Your help would be the happiest of helps for this project; there's even some cool perks you can get by donating! Like the graphic novel of The Horrible Truth About Birthdays!

Woo!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here's where the real fun happens. The horrible truth is, we need your money! But don't worry, your money is going towards some very cool things (not horrible) and you'll also receive some very cool things (not horrible either)

Here's why we need $$$

  • To feed our lovely cast and crew
  • To obtain really cool props
  • To help pay for printing of the graphic novel and posters
  • To submit to film festivals in hopes that that moment could be a small moment of reflection when one day we're standing at the Oscars, looking back at this very moment

Here's some of the perks you can get by donating $$$

  • Special thanks in the credits for donating
  • Digital copy of the poster
  • Digital copy of the film
  • Digital copy of the graphic novel
  • An ACTUAL poster (8.5" x 11" though)
  • A signed script used on set by cast and crew 
  • OR THE ACTUAL F*CKING GRAPHIC NOVEL, SIGNED BY CAST AND CREW
  • I KNOW, RIGHT?
  • LIKE, WOAH
  • The actual, printed, physical copy of the graphic novel, signed by us

The crew for this is extremely small, a team of five for one shoot and a team of two for the next. Along with that, a LOT of animation needs to be finished for the film before May, AND THE GRAPHIC NOVEL

OH MY GOODNESS

But no worries! We're filming all of this March 4th and 11th, right before when Ithaca College's spring break starts. That gives  me an entire week to animate, draw, and edit the film, as well as finish the graphic novel

 

Can't donate? No worries! You can still help by spreading the word, talking about it with your friends or family, and sharing the Indiegogo and Facebook page!

Every small contribution counts, and we wouldn't be able to make this film without your help

Thanks! And stay tuned for more! Not so terrible things are coming to you soon!

FB: https://www.facebook.com/TheHorribleTruthAboutB...

story:
How did it all start?!

My name is Yana. I am Bulgarian. But now I live in South Korea. I am a student at Chung-Ang university in Seoul and my major is film directing. And here is the story behind the 2nd short fiction film I shot in Korea in Korean with Korean actors:


When I arrived in Korea almost 3 years ago I had to spend 1 year learning Korean in a city called Gwangju. I didn‘t have any expectations for it. And then it happened: I fell for it. I fell for Gwangju, for its people and streets, for its parks and its sun, for its past and present. Why? There is no logical explanation – just as you cannot explain logically why you love somebody. It is a feeling inside of you.

So after I went up to Seoul to study film directing, it was a bitter-sweet emotion. Because part of me would always stay in Gwangju.

And then I got an assignment to shoot a short film...

And my heart jumped: can I? Can I really try and tell a story about that city I fell for?

It took months of reading books, watching documentaries or fiction films dedicated to Gwangju and its past. It took months for the story to take a shape in my head. It took months to decide which of all the Gwangju images I have in my mind I want to show.

And that's how the story  connected with an important historical event from the past of Gwangju was created. But this short film is not just about the past, it is a tale about the choices we make and the strength we need to go on.

I wanted to tell a universal story - showing characters that can be seen in any corner of the world. Talking about issues, struggles, doubts, fears and dreams that everybody can relate to.

 

November Will Be May

This is the story of a woman in her late 50ies. Living alone after her husband passed away and her daughter went for work abroad, she has just retired from her job as a book editor. But one day she decides to take one more last assignment and go on a 1-day trip along with a writer researching for his new book. The trip will take her back to a city which hides the secrets of her past. Will she be able to face them?

What was to follow?

Gathering a team, location scouting, casting, rehearsing, storyboarding...

And then it was time to go to Gwangju and to actually shoot the film. It was an amazing experience – to be back in the city, to be back at those places so dear to my heart... and all this with an amazing team!

But now it is time to finish the journey...

And I need some more help. Despite all the efforts there are holes in the budget and any support will bring this film closer to life.

Any money we get from this campaign will go for:

  • the rights for the music used in the film
  • the sound design
  • making the poster and the other visuals
  • applying for festivals

I think the last point needs some clarification: many people don‘t know but there a lot of festivals that require an entrance fee if you want to submit your film for consideration. For a short film that film can range from 5$ till 40$. And for now getting into festivals is the only way for me as a director to build my resume and gain some attention to my work...

November Will Be May
This is the story of a woman in her late 50ies. Living alone after her husband passed away and her daughter went for work abroad, she has just retired from her job as a book editor. But one day she decides to take one more last assignment and go on a 1-day trip along with a writer researching for his new book. The trip will take her back to a city which hides the secrets of her past. Will she be able to face them?

What was to follow?
Gathering a team, location scouting, casting, rehearsing, storyboarding...
And then it was time to go to Gwangju and to actually shoot the film. It was an amazing experience – to be back in the city, to be back at those places so dear to my heart... and all this with an amazing team!


But now it is time to finish the journey... 
And I need some more help. Despite all the efforts there are holes in the budget and any support will bring this film closer to life.
Any money we get from this campaign will go for:

the rights for the music used in the film
the sound design
making the poster and the other visuals
applying for festivals

I think the last point needs some clarification: many people don‘t know but there a lot of festivals that require an entrance fee if you want to submit your film for consideration. For a short film that film can range from 5$ till 40$. And for now getting into festivals is the only way for me as a director to build my resume and gain some attention to my work...
